sentence: This paper develops a framework for evaluating the ability of neural models on answering free-form mathematical problems.
label: none

sentence: The contributions are i) a publicly available dataset, and ii) an evaluation of two existing model families, recurrent networks and the Transformer.
label: none

sentence: I think that this paper makes a good contribution by establishing a benchmark and providing some preliminary results.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: I am biased because I once did exactly the same thing as this paper, although at a much smaller scale; I am thus happy to see such a public dataset.
label: none

sentence: The paper is a reasonable dataset/analysis paper.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Whether to accept it or not depends on what standard ICLR has towards such papers (ones that do not propose a new model/new theory).
label: none

sentence: I think that the dataset generation process is well-thought-out.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: There are a large variety of modules, and trying to not generate either trivial or impossible problems is a plus in my opinion.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The results and discussions in the main part of the paper are too light in my opinion; the average model accuracy across modules is not an interesting metric at all, although it does show that the Transformer performs better than recurrent networks.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I think the authors should move a portion of the big bar plot (too low resolution, btw) into the main text and discuss it thoroughly.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Details on how to generate the dataset, however, can be moved into the appendix.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I am also not entirely satisfied by using accuracy as the only metric; how about using something like beam search to build a "soft", secondary metric?
label: asp_substance

sentence: One other thing I want to see is a test set with multiple different difficulty levels.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors try to do this with composition, which is good, but I am not sure whether that captures the real important thing - the ability to generalize, say learning to factorise single-variable polynomials and test it on factorising polynomials with multiple variables? And what about the transfer between these tasks (e.g., if a network learns to solve equations with both x and y and also factorise a polynomial with x, can it generalize to the unseen case of factorising a polynomial with both x and y)?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Also, is there an option for "unsolvable"?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: For example, the answer being a special "this is impossible" character for "factorise x^2 - 5" (if your training set does not use \sqrt, of course).
label: none

sentence: # Weaknesses
label: none

sentence: Applications are a bit unclear.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: It would be nice to see a better case made for spherical convolutions within the experimental section.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The experiments on SHREC17 show all three spherical methods under-performing other approaches.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It leaves it unclear to the reader when someone should choose to utilize a spherical method or when the proposed method would then be preferred compared to other spherical methods.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Is there a task that this representation significantly outperforms other spherical methods and non-spherical methods?
label: asp_substance

sentence: Or a specific useful application where spherical methods in general outperform other approaches?
label: asp_substance

sentence: # Strengths:
label: none

sentence: The method is well developed and explained.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Ability to implement in a straight-forward manner on GPU.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Authors provide a variant of WGAN, called PC-GAN, to generate 3D point clouds.
label: none

sentence: The drawback of a vanilla GAN with a DeepSet classifier is analyzed.
label: none

sentence: The rationality that decoupling the point generator with the object generator is also discussed.
label: none

sentence: A sandwiching objective function is proposed to achieve a better estimation of Wasserstein distance.
label: none

sentence: Compared with AAE and the simplified variants of the proposed PC-GAN, the proposed PC-GAN achieves incremental results on point cloud generation.
label: none

sentence: Comments:
label: none

sentence: 1. Authors calculate W_U in a primal form via solving an assignment programming problem.
label: none

sentence: Have authors ever tried Sinkhorn iteration?
label: asp_substance

sentence: To my knowledge, sinkhorn iteration is a very popular method to solve OT problem effectively.
label: none

sentence: It would be nice if authors can provide some reasons and comparisons for their choice on the optimizer of W_U.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Authors proved that the sandwiching object W_s is closer to the real Wasserstein distance, but it increases the variance of the loss function.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, the dynamics of W_U, and W_L, according to lemma1, is (epsilon2-epsilon1)*w(P, G) while the dynamics of W_s is 2*epsilon1 * w(P, G), and 2epsilon1 > epsilon2 - epsilon1 (according to the assumption in lemma 1).
label: none

sentence: Does it mean that the W_s is not as stable as W_L or W_U during training?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Additionally, authors combined W_U with W_L with a mixture 20:1, i.e., the s in Eqs(6, 13, 14) is smaller than 0.05.
label: none

sentence: In such a situation, both the value and the dynamics of W_s will be very close to that of W_U. Does it mean that W_L is not so important as W_U?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Authors should analyze the stability of their method in details.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Essentially, the proposed method is a variant of WGAN, which estimates Wasserstein distance with lower bias but may suffer from worse stability.
label: none

sentence: In the experiments, both the setting and the experimental results show that the proposed W_s will be very close to W_U. As a result, the improvement caused by the proposed method is incremental compared with its variants.
label: asp_originality

sentence: = Summary
label: none

sentence: Embeddings of mathematical theorems and rewrite rules are presented.
label: none

sentence: An in-depth analysis of the resulting embeddings is presented, showing that a network can learn to "apply" embedded rewrite rules to embedded theorems, yielding results that are similar to the embedding of the rewritten theorem.
label: none

sentence: [i.e., app'(emb(thm), emb(rule)) is near to emb(app(thm, rule))] This is an interesting property for the application of deep learning to automated theorem proving, though not directly a breakthrough result.
label: none

sentence: = Strong/Weak Points
label: none

sentence: + Simply a cute result, showing that proof search can remain in embedding space for a limited time horizon without having to switch back into the theorem prover environment.
label: asp_originality

sentence: + Nicely designed experiments testing this (somewhat surprising) property empirically
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Missed opportunity of better analysis of which theorem/rewrite rule properties are more likely to fail
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Writing sometimes a bit overcomplicated (e.g., Sect. 4.5 could just be a figure of a commuting diagram and two sentences...)
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - Architecture choice unclear: Why are $\sigma$ and $\omega$ separate networks.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: This is discussed on p4, but it's unclear to me how keeping $\sigma$ separate is benefitial for the analysis, and this is not picked up again explicitly again?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: = Recommendation
label: none

sentence: Overall, this is a nice, somewhat surprising result.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The writing and experiments could use some improvement, but I believe that the majority of the ICLR audience would enjoy seeing this result (even though it would have no impact on most people's research)

sentence: Though rather dense in its exposition, this paper is an interesting contribution to the area of self-supervised learning  based on discrete representations.

sentence: The authors take it as a given that discrete is good because it allows us to leverage work in NLP.

sentence: "Table 4 shows that our first results are promising, even though they are not as good as the state of the art." The state of the art on LibriSpeech is not Mohamed at al. 2019. See e.g. Irie et al. Interspeech 2019 for better result

sentence: The Conclusion is very sparse. "In future work, we are planning to apply other algorithms requiring discrete inputs to audio data":
label: none

sentence: can  you elaborate?

sentence: The authors of this paper are proposing a neural network approach for learning diffusion dynamics in networks.
label: none

sentence: The authors argue that the main advantage of their framework is that it incorporates the structure of independent cascades into the model which predicts the diffusion process.
label: none

sentence: The primary difficulty in reviewing this paper is the poor presentation of the paper.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: There are many typos and mistakes (e.g., the last paragraph of the paper starts with a sentence that does not make any sense), missing references (e.g., there is an empty parenthesis at the end of the second paragraph on the second page) and in at least two cases, there are references to a formula that is not in the manuscript (e.g., reference to formula 15 on line 3 of page 5).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This issues makes reviewing this paper very difficult.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In the modeling section, authors use p(I|D) as q^D(.) in the Eq. 12, where p(I|D) is the conditional probability that a particular node infected an observed infected node first.
label: none

sentence: Plugging p(I|D) in Eq. 12 and using decomposition of p(D ,I) used in Eq. 10, we arrive at a formulation which drops all p(I|D) terms.
label: none

sentence: This results in an objective function which only involves infected nodes (and no term associated with the parent node), weighted by likelihood of each node j infecting the node at step i. This should make the training more simplified than what is discussed in Algorithm 2.
label: none

sentence: Beyond this simplification, I am not clear if that is actually intended by the authors.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The experiments demonstrate a superior performance of the proposed model compared to alternative benchmarks.
label: none

sentence: The authors explain how they trained their own model but there is no mention on how they trained benchmark models.
label: asp_substance

sentence: However, given that the datasets used in the experiments were not used in the associated benchmark papers, it is necessary for authors to explain how they trained competing models.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Due to several shortcomings of the paper, most important of which is on presentation of the paper, this manuscript requires a significant revision by the authors to reach the necessary standards for publication, moreover it would be helpful to clarify the modeling choices and consequences of these choices more clearly.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Quality: A simple approach accompanied with a theoretical justification and large number of experimental results.
label: none

sentence: The theoretical justification is spread out in the main body and appendices.
label: none

sentence: The proof given in the appendix is overly short and not detailed enough.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The large number of experiment although welcoming needs to be properly discussed and related to the state of the art numbers, including any work that the authors are referring themselves in this submission.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The approach is not linked to so called Tandem approach that was/is popular in speech recognition where a generative model (GMM) is trained on top of features extracted by a neural network model.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Clarity: The simple approach is clearly described.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: However, the theoretical justification and experimental results are not.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Originality: The work is moderately original.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Significance: It is hard to assess given the current submission.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The paper investigates the possibility of learning a model to predict the training behaviour of deep learning architectures from hyperparameter information and a history of training observations.
label: none

sentence: The model can then be used by researchers or a reinforcement learning agent to make better hyperparameter choices.
label: none

sentence: The paper first adapts the Transformer model to be suitable to this prediction task by introducing a discretization scheme that prevents the transformer decoder's predictions from collapsing to a single curve.
label: none

sentence: Next, the problem is formalized as a partially-observable MDP with a discrete action set, and PPO and SimPLe are introduced.
label: none

sentence: The proposed model-based method is compared against a human and a model-free baseline training a Wide ResNet on CIFAR-10.
label: none

sentence: The model-based method achieves better validation error than the other baselines that use actual data.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Next, the method is compared against a human and a model-free baseline training Transformer models on the Penn Treebank dataset.
label: none

sentence: While the human achieves the best performance at the end of the run, the proposed method appears to learn more quickly than the others and finishes with performance comparable to the model-free baseline.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Currently I lean towards accepting this paper for publication, despite a few issues.
label: none

sentence: It asks an interesting question: can we learn a model of the training dynamics to avoid actually having to do the training?
label: asp_substance

sentence: This could potentially prevent a lot of unnecessary computation and also lead to better-performing models.
label: none

sentence: It then shows some experimental evidence suggesting that this is possible.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Most importantly, I would like to see a measure of variance/uncertainty like confidence intervals included in the results; otherwise it's impossible to assess whether the results are likely to be significant or not. Other questions:
label: asp_substance

sentence: 1. In the PTB experiment, it looks like the human only adapts the learning rate and leaves the rest of the hyperparameters alone.
label: none

sentence: Why was this policy used as the baseline? It seems extremely basic and unlikely to truly lead to optimal performance.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 2. Why were more baselines from the related work not included? I understand the experiments are a proof of concept, but it would be nice to get a feeling for what some of the other methods do.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 3. How do PPO and SimPLe handle partial observability? Is it principled to apply them to partially-observable environments?
label: asp_substance

sentence: 4. Why not use continuous actions with a parameterized policy (e.g. Gaussian)?
label: asp_substance

sentence: 5. Is it reasonable to assume that the learning dynamics of all deep learning architectures are similar enough that a model trained on one set of deep learning architectures and problems will generalize to new architectures and problems?
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper targets at studying the mutual exclusive bias which existed in children learning, to help understand whether there exists similar bias in deep networks.

sentence: and it also includes some weak claims that should be removed.

sentence: The paper proposed a hierarchical framework for problem embedding and intended to apply it to adaptive tutoring.

label: none

sentence: In sum, the paper has a very good application but not good enough as a research paper.

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: The manuscript proposes a multi-domain adversarial learning (MDL) method called MULANN, to leverage multiple datasets with overlapping but distinct class sets, in a semi-supervised setting.
label: none

sentence: The authors define a new discrimination task to discriminate, within each domain, labeled samples from unlabeled ones that most likely belong to extra classes (classes with no labeled or unlabeled samples in the domain).
label: none

sentence: They also introduce a bound on the average- and worst-domain risk in MDL, obtained using the H-divergence.
label: none

sentence: Strengths:
label: none

sentence: - The idea of using discriminators for separating the labeled samples from unlabeled ones that most likely belong to extra classes is interesting.
label: asp_originality

sentence: - A new generalization bound for MDL is introduced.
label: asp_originality

sentence: - The paper was clear, well written, well-motivated and nicely structured.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - The authors perform numerous empirical experiments on several types of problems on various datasets (Digit, OFFICE,CELL) successfully showing how the MULANN can reduce the nasty effects of the adversarial domain discriminator and repulse (a fraction of) unlabeled examples from labeled ones in each domain.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Weaknesses:
label: none

sentence: - all the experiments except the last row of Table 2 concern adaptation between two domains.
label: none

sentence: Given the paper title, the reviewer would have expected more experiments in a multiple domain context.
label: asp_substance

sentence: More precisely, for the digit datasets, the reviewer was interested to see how the proposed MDL performs on jointly adapting SVHN, MNIST, MNIST-M, and USPS or jointly adapting DSLR, Amazon, and Webcam for OFFICE dataset.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Moreover, comparison with some of the DA baselines (ADDA[1], DSN[2]) is missing.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The authors propose to rank the unlabeled samples of each domain according to the entropy of their classification of the current classifier.
label: none

sentence: Obviously there must be some false ranking (specially at the initial stages of updating the classifier) for the unlabeled samples (e.g. the classifier may output high entropy for the unlabeled samples of the classes with labeled samples) and they may harm the performance of adaptation.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It is not clear how MULANN can work in this situation and how its performance vary with the noisy signals conveyed in those false pseudolabeled samples.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - Although the paper introduces the generalization bound for MDL, it does not give new formulation or algorithm to handle MDL (MULANN handles only the class asymmetry when domains involve distinct sets of classes and it has nothing to do with MDL).
label: none

sentence: hence, there is no connection between the theoretical results on MDL generalization bound and the proposed method MULANN.
label: arg_other

sentence: Since each domain may have different number of classes, it is not clear how the number of classes (L) is set in the classification module (maximum number of classes in all domain?).
label: asp_replicability

sentence: The reviewer is also interested to see how the the generalization bound introduced in this paper is related to the recent theoretical works [3],[4] on MDL.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: [1] Tzeng, Eric, et al. "Adversarial discriminative domain adaptation." Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition (CVPR). Vol. 1. No. 2. 2017.
label: none

sentence: Bousmalis, Konstantinos, et al. "Domain separation networks." Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems. 2016.
label: none

sentence: [3] Zhao, Han, et al. "Multiple Source Domain Adaptation with Adversarial Learning." Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems. 2018.
label: none

sentence: [4] Hoffman, Judy, Mehryar Mohri, and Ningshan Zhang. "Algorithms and Theory for Multiple-Source Adaptation."  Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems. 2018.
label: none

sentence: The authors propose three improvements to the DNC model: masked attention, erasion of de-allocated elements, and sharpened temporal links --- and show that this allows the model to solve synthetic memory tasks faster and with better precision.
label: none

sentence: They also show the model performs better on average on bAbI than the original DNC.
label: none

sentence: The negatives are that the paper does not really show this modified DNC can solve a task that the original DNC could not. As the authors also admit, there have been other DNC improvements that have had more dramatic improvements on bAbI.
label: asp_originality

sentence: I think the paper is particularly clearly written, and I would vote for it being accepted as it has implications beyond the DNC.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The fact that masked attention works so much better than the standard cosine-weighted content-based attention is pretty interesting in itself.
label: none

sentence: The insights (e.g. Figure 5) are interesting and show the study is not just trying to be a benchmark paper for some top-level results, but actually cares about understanding a problem and fixing it.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Although most recent memory architectures do not seem to have incorporated the DNC's slightly complex memory de-allocation scheme, any resurgent work in this area would benefit from this study.
label: none

sentence: The paper deals with the problem of recovering an exact solution for both the dictionary and the activation coefficients.
label: none

sentence: As other works, the solution is based on a proper initialization of the dictionary.
label: none

sentence: The authors suggest using Aurora 2015 as a possible initialization.
label: none

sentence: The contribution improves Arora 2015 in that it converges linearly and recovers both the dictionary and the coefficients with no bias.
label: none

sentence: The main contribution is the use of a IHT-based strategy to update the coefficients, with a gradient-based update for the dictionary (NOODL algorithm).
label: none

sentence: The authors show that, combined with a proper initialization, this has exact recovery guaranties.
label: none

sentence: Interestingly, their experiments show that NOODL converges linearly in number of iterations, while Arora gets stuck after some iterations.
label: none

sentence: I think the paper is relevant and proposes an interesting contribution.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The paper is well written and the key elements are in the body.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: However, there is a lot of important material in the Appendix, which I think may be relevant to the readers.
label: none

sentence: It would be nice to have some more intuitive explanations at least of Theorem 1.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Also, it is clear in the experiments the superiority with respect to Arora in terms of iterations (and error), but what about computational time?
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The paper proposed variational selective autoencoders (VSAE) to learn from partially-observed multimodal data.
label: none

sentence: Overall, the proposed method is elegant; however, the presentation, the claim, and the experiments suffer from significant flaws.
label: asp_substance

sentence: See below for detailed comments.
label: none

sentence: [Pros]
label: none

sentence: 1. The main idea of the paper is to propose a generative model that can handle partially-observed multimodal data during training.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, prior work considered non-missing data during training, while we can't always guarantee that all the modalities are available.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Especially in the field of multimodal learning, we often face the issue of imperfect sensors.
label: none

sentence: This line of work should be encouraged.
label: none

sentence: 2. In my opinion, the idea is elegant.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The way the author handles the missingness is by introducing an auxiliary binary random variable (the mask) for it.
label: none

sentence: Nevertheless, its presentation and Figure 1 makes this elegant idea seems over-complicated.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: [Cons]
label: none

sentence: 1. [The claim] One of my concerns for this paper is the assumption of the factorized latent variables from multimodal data.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Specifically, the author mentioned Tsai et al. assumed factorized latent variables from the multimodal data, while Tsai et al. actually assumed the generation of multimodal data consists of disentangled modality-specific and multimodal factors.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It seems to me; the author assumed data from one modality is generated by all the latent factors (see Eq. (11)), then what is the point for assuming the prior of the latent factor is factorized (see Eq. (4) and (5))?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: One possible explanation is because we want to handle the partially-observable issues from multimodal data, and it would be easier to make the latent factors factorized (see Eq. (6)).
label: none

sentence: The author should comment on this.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 2. [Phrasing.] There are too many unconcise or informal phrases in the paper.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: For example, I don't understand what does it mean in "However, if training data is complete, ..... handle during missing data during test." Another example would be the last few paragraphs on page 4; they are very unclear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Also, the author should avoid using the word "simply" too often (see the last few paragraphs on page 5).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 3. [Presentation.] The presentation is undesirable. It may make the readers hard to follow the paper.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I list some instances here.
label: none

sentence: a. In Eq. (3), it surprises me to see the symbol \epsilon without any explanation.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: b. In Eq. (6), it also surprises me to see no description of \phi and \psi.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The author should also add more explanation here,
label: asp_clarity

sentence: since Eq. (6)  stands a crucial role in the author's method.
label: none

sentence: c. Figure 1 is over-complicated.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: d. What is the metric in Table 1 and 2?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The author never explains. E.g., link to NRMSE and PFC to the Table.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: e. What are the two modalities in Table 2? The author should explain.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: f. The author completely moved the results of MNIST-SVHN to Supplementary.
label: none

sentence: It is fine, but it seems weird that the author still mentioned the setup of MNIST+SVHN in the main text.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: g. The author mentioned, in Table , the last two rows serve the upper bound for other methods.
label: none

sentence: While some results are even better than the last two rows.
label: none

sentence: The author should explain this.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: h. Generally speaking, the paper does require a significant effort to polish Section 3 and 4.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 4. [Experiments.] The author presented a multimodal representation learning framework for partially-observable multimodal data, while the experiments cannot corraborrate the claim.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: First, I consider the tabular features as multi-feature data and less to be the multimodal data.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Second, the synthetic image pairs are not multimodal in nature.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: These synthetic setting can be used for sanity check, but cannot be the main part of the experiments.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The author can perhaps consider the datasets used by Tsai et al. There are seven datasets, and they can all be modified to the setting of partially-observable multimodal data.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Also, since the synthetic image pairs are not multimodal in nature, it is unclear to me for what the messages are conveyed in Figure 3 and 4.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I do expect the paper be a strong submission after a significant effort in presentation and experimental designs.
label: none

sentence: Therefore, I vote for weak rejection at this moment.
label: none

sentence: The paper builds upon Deep Image Prior (DIP) - work which shows that one can optimize a neural generator to fit a single image without learning on any dataset, and the output of the generator (which approximates the image) can be used for denoising / super resolution / etc.
label: none

sentence: The paper proposes a new architecture for the DIP method which has much less parameters, but works on par with DIP.
label: none

sentence: Another contribution of the paper is theoretical treatment of (a simplified version of) the proposed architecture showing that it can’t fit random noise (and thus maybe better suited for denoising).
label: none

sentence: The paper is clearly written, and the proposed architecture has too cool properties: it’s compact enough to be used for image compression; and it doesn’t overfit thus making early stopping notnesesary (which was crucial for the original DIP model).
label: asp_originality

sentence: I have two main concerns about this paper.
label: none

sentence: First, it is somewhat misleading about its contributions: it's not obvious from abstract/introduction that the whole model is the same as DIP except for the proposed architecture.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Specifically, the first contribution listed in the introduction makes it look like this paper introduces the idea of not learning the decoder on the dataset (the one that starts with “The network is not learned and itself incorporates all assumptions on the data.”).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: My second concern is about the theoretical contribution.
label: none

sentence: On the one hand, I enjoyed the angle the authors tackled proving that the network architecture is underparameterized enough to be a good model for denoising.
label: asp_substance

sentence: On the other hand, the obtained results are very weak: only one layered version of the paper is analysed and the theorem applies only to networks with less than some threshold of parameters.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Roughly, the theorem states that if for example we fix any matrix B of size e.g. 256 x k and matrix U of size 512 x 256 and then compute U relu(B C) where C is the vector of parameters of size k x 1, AND if k < 2.5 (i.e. if we use at most 2 parameters), then it would be very hard to fit 512 iid gaussian values (i.e. min_C ||U relu(B C) - eta|| where eta ~ N(0, 1)).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This restriction of the number of parameters to be small is only mentioned in the theorem itself, not in the discussion of its implications.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Also, the theorem only applies to the iid noise, while most natural noise patterns have structure (e.g. JPEG artifacts, broken pixels, etc) and thus can probably be better approximated with deep models.
label: none

sentence: Since the paper manages to use very few parameters (BTW, how many parameters in total do you have? Can you please add this number to the text?), it would be cool to see if second order methods like LBFGS can be applied here.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Some less important points:
label: none

sentence: Fig 4 is very confusing.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: First, it doesn’t label the X axis.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Second, the caption mentions that early stopping is beneficial for the proposed method, but I can’t see it from the figure.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Third, I don’t get what is plotted on different subplots.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The text mentions that (a) is fitting the noisy image, (b) is fitting the noiseless image, and (c) is fitting noise. Is it all done independently with three different models?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Then why does the figure says test and train loss? And why DIP loss goes up, it should be able to fit anything, right? If not and it’s a single model that gets fitted on the noisy image and tested on the noiseless image, then how can you estimate the level of noise fitting? ||G(C) - eta|| should be high if G(C) ~= x.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Also, in this quote “In Fig. 4(a) we plot the Mean Squared Error (MSE) over the number of iterations of the optimizer for fitting the noisy astronaut image x + η (i.e., FORMULA ...” the formula doesn’t correspond to the text.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: And finally, the discussion of this figure makes claims about the behaviour of the model that seems to be too strong to be based on a single image experiment.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I don’t get the details of the batch normalization used: with respect to which axis the mean and variance are computed?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors claim that the model is not convolutional.
label: none

sentence: But first, it’s not obvious why this would be a good thing (or a bad thing for that matter)
label: asp_substance

sentence: Second, it’s not exactly correct (as noted in the paper itself): the architecture uses 1x1 convolutions and upsampling, which combined give a weak and underparametrized analog of convolutions.
label: asp_substance

sentence: > The deep decoder is a deep image model G: R N → R n, where N is the number of parameters of the model, and n is the output dimension, which is typically much larger than the number of parameters (N << n).
label: none

sentence: I think it should be vice versa, N >> n
label: arg_other

sentence: The following footnote
label: none

sentence: > Specifically, we took a deep decoder G with d = 6 layers and output dimension 512×512×3, and choose k = 64 and k = 128 for the respective compression ratios.
label: none

sentence: Uses unintroduced (at that point) notation and is very confusing.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It would be nice to have a version of Figure 6 with k = 6, so that one can see all feature maps (in contrast to a subset of them).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I’m also wondering, is it harder to optimize the proposed architecture compared to DIP?
label: asp_substance

sentence: The literature on distillation indicates that overparameterization can be beneficial for convergence and final performance.
label: none

sentence: *Summary*
label: none

sentence: This paper study the convergence of Hamiltonian gradient descent (HGD) on minmax games.
label: none

sentence: The paper show that under some assumption on the cost function of the min max that are (in some sense) weaker than strong convex-concavity.
label: none

sentence: More precisely, they use the ‘bilinearity’ of the objective (due to the interaction between the players) to prove that the squared norm of the vector field of the game follows some Polyak Lojasiewicz condition.
label: none

sentence: Thus the proof is concluded by the linear (resp. sublinear) convergence of gradient descent (resp. stochastic GD) under PL assumption.
label: none

sentence: *Decision*
label: none

sentence: I think that is work is clearly very interesting.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The fact to prove linear convergence rate without strong-convex-concavity is quite surprising. And this paper brings nice tools to analyse HGD.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Also the result on Stochastic HGD is very interesting.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: However, I am wondering whether this paper is perfectly suited to ICLR conference due to the lack of experiment, practical implication given by the theory, or theory in the non-convex setting (I know that the latter is a huge open question and I am not criticizing the absence of theory in the non-convex-concave setting).
label: asp_substance

sentence: One way to improve to work would be to provide practical takeaways from the theory or to provide experiments in the main paper.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Regarding the practical limitation of this work:
label: none

sentence: - the sufficient bilinearity condition are hard to meet in practice. (even for convex-concave problems)
label: none

sentence: - In a non-convex-concave setting, Hamiltonian gradient descent is attracted the any stationary point, even “local maxima” (or the equivalent in the minmax setting).
label: none

sentence: Making this algorithm not very practical.
label: asp_substance

sentence: (However, CO is)
label: none

sentence: However, I really think that the community is currently lacking of understanding on minmax optimization and that we need better training method in many practical emergent frameworks that are minmax (such as GANs or multi agent learning). That is why, I would vote for a weak accept.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: *Questions*
label: none

sentence: - What are the practical implication of your work ? for instance does it say anything on how to tune $\gamma$ for CO ?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: *Remarks*
label: none

sentence: - It is claimed that Theorem 3.4 gives the first linear convergence rate for minmax that does not require strong-convex or linearity.
label: none

sentence: Note that, recently [1] seem to propose a result on extragradient in the same vein (i.e. without strong convexity or linearity).
label: none

sentence: - (Minor) $\alpha$ not alway have the same unit: Thm 3.2 it is proportional to a strong convexity and in Lemma 4.7 it is proportional to a strong convexity squared (actually the PL of the squared norm of the gradient).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: For clarity it might be interesting to use the notation $\alpha^2$ in Lemma 4.7.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The same way for unit consistency I would use $L_H^2$ instead of $L_H$
label: asp_clarity

sentence: [1] Azizian, Waïss, et al. "A Tight and Unified Analysis of Extragradient for a Whole Spectrum of Differentiable Games." arXiv preprint arXiv:1906.05945 (2019).
label: none

sentence: === After rebuttal =
label: none

sentence: I've read the authors's response.
label: none

sentence: The concern raised by reviewer 3 is very important.
label: none

sentence: The descent lemma used by the author is not valid for the stochastic result.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The authors should address that in their revision.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I however maintain my grade.
label: none

sentence: The paper attempts to clarify the debate on large-batch neural network training, particularly on the relationship between learning rate, batch sizes and test performance.
label: none

sentence: The authors claim two contributions towards understanding how the hyper-parameters of SGD affect final training and test performance: (1) SGD exhibits two regimes with different behaviours and (2) large-batch training leads to degradation of test performance even with same step budgets.
label: none

sentence: Overall, the authors did a comprehensive study on large-batch training with the support of extensive experiments.
label: none

sentence: But I'm concerned with the novelty and contributions of this paper.
label: asp_originality

sentence: I tend to reject this paper because (1) the first contribution of the paper is not new as it has already been recognized by a few paper that SGD exhibits two different regimes; (2) this paper makes the debate of large-batch training even muddier.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Main argument:
label: none

sentence: The paper does not do a great job in clarify the debate.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Particularly, the authors mixed their observations up with the results of published works, making it hard to identify the contributions of this paper.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: For example, the two regimes mentioned in the paper has been identified by a few other works and the contribution of this paper is just to verify them again.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Also, I find the experiments done in section 3 and 4 are similar to previous works and even the conclusions are similar.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The only new observation I'm aware of in these two sections is that the training loss and test accuracy are independent of batch size in the noise dominated regime.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Back to introduction section, the goal of this paper (as claimed in the beginning of second paragraph) is to clarify the debate.
label: none

sentence: But does this paper really achieves this goal?
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: In terms of learning rate scaling, this paper gets similar conclusions as Shallue et al. (2018).
label: asp_originality

sentence: In terms of the difference between vanilla SGD and SGD with momentum, Zhang et al. (2019) already argued that the difference depends on specific batch sizes and SGD with momentum only outperforms SGD in the curvature dominated regime.
label: asp_originality

sentence: I think the authors should instead focus on the discussion of generalization performance and the observation that training loss and test accuracy are independent of batch size in noise dominated regime.
label: none

sentence: To my knowledge, this part is novel and interesting.
label: asp_originality

sentence: In summary, I'm inclined to reject this paper given the current version.
label: arg_other

sentence: However, I think the paper is still worth reading if the authors can reorganize the paper and I might increase my score if my concerns get resolved.
label: none

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: The authors present a video prediction model called SAVP that combines a Variational Auto-Encoder (VAE) model with a Generative Adversarial Network (GAN) to produce more realistic and diverse future samples.
label: none

sentence: Deterministic models and certain loss functions such as Mean Squared Error (MSE) will produce
label: none

sentence: blurry results when making uncertain predictions.
label: none

sentence: GAN predictions on the other hand usually are more visually appealing but often lack diversity, producing just a few modes.
label: none

sentence: The authors propose to combine a VAE model with a GAN objective to combine their strengths: good quality samples (GAN) that cover multiple possible futures (VAE).
label: none

sentence: Strengths:
label: none

sentence: [+] GANs are notoriously unstable to train, especially for video.
label: none

sentence: The authors formulate a VAE-GAN model and successfully implement it.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Weaknesses:
label: none

sentence: [-] The combination of VAEs and GANs, while new for videos, had already been proposed for image generation as indicated in the Related Work section and its formulation for video prediction is relatively straightforward given existing VAE (Denton & Fergus 2018) and GAN models (Tulyakov et al. 2018).
label: arg_other

sentence: [-] The results indicate that SAVP offers a trade-off between the properties of GANs and VAEs, but does not go beyond its individual parts.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For example, the experiment of Figure 5 does not show SAVP being significantly more diverse than GANs for KTH (as compared to VAEs).
label: none

sentence: Furthermore, Figure 6 and Figure 7 in general show SAVP performing worse than SVG (Denton & Fergus 2018), a VAE model with a significantly less complex generator, including for the metric (VGG cosine similarity) that the authors introduce arguing that PSNR and SSIM do not necessarily indicate prediction quality.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: While the use of a GAN in general will make the results less blurry and visually appealing, it does not necessarily mean that the samples it generates are going to be plausible or better.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Since a direct application of video prediction is model-based planning, it seems that plausibility might be as important as sample quality.
label: none

sentence: This work proposes to combine VAEs and GANs in a single model to get the benefits of both models.
label: none

sentence: However, the experiments conducted generally show that SAVP offers only a trade-off between the visual quality of GANs and the coverage of VAEs, and does not show a clear advantage over current VAE models (Denton & Fergus, 2018) that with simpler architectures obtain similar results.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: While the presentation is clear and the evaluation of the model is thorough, I am unsure of the significance of the proposed method.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: In order to better assess this model and compare it to its individual parts and other VAE models, could the authors:
label: none

sentence: 1) Compare SAVP to the SVG-LP/FP model on a controlled synthetic dataset such as Stochastic Moving MNIST (Denton & Fergus, 2018)?
label: asp_substance

sentence: 2) Comment on the plausibility of the samples generated by SAVP? Do some samples show imagined objects – implausible interactions for the robotic arm dataset? If so, what would be the advantage over blurry but plausible generations of a VAE?
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper proposed to use dropout to randomly choose only a subset of neural network as a potential way to perform exploration.
label: none

sentence: The dropout happens at the beginning of each episode, and thus leads to a temporally consistent exploration.
label: none

sentence: The paper shows that with small amount of Gaussian multiplicative dropout, the algorithm can achieve the state-of-the-art results on benchmark environments.
label: none

sentence: And it can significantly outperform vanilla PPO for environments with sparse rewards.
label: none

sentence: The paper is clearly written.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The introduced technique is interesting.
label: asp_originality

sentence: I wonder except for the difference of memory consumption, how different it is compared to parameter space exploration.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I feel that it is a straightforward extension/generalization of the parameter space exploration. But the stochastic alignment and policy space constraint seem novel and important.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The motivation of this paper is mostly about learning with sparse reward.
label: none

sentence: I am curious whether the paper has other good side effects.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For example, will the dropout cause the policy to be more robust?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Furthermore, If I deploy the learning algorithm on a physical robot, will the temporally consistent exploration cause less wear and tear to the actuators when the robot explores.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In addition, I would like to see some discussions whether this technique could be applied to off-policy learning as well.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Overall, I like this paper. It is well written.
label: arg_other

sentence: The method seems technically sound and achieves good results.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: For this reason, I would recommend accepting this paper.
label: arg_other

sentence: The paper presents a maximally expressive parameter-sharing scheme for hypergraphs, and in general when modeling the high order interactions between elements of a set.
label: none

sentence: This setting is further generalized to multiple sets.
label: none

sentence: The paper shows that the number of free parameters in invariant and equivariant layers corresponds to the different partitioning of the index-set of input and output tensors.
label: none

sentence: Experimental results suggest that the proposed layer can outperform existing methods in supervised learning with graphs.
label: none

sentence: The paper presents a comprehensive generalization of a recently proposed model for interaction across sets, to the setting where some of these sets are identical.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This is particularly useful and important due to its applications to graphs and hyper-graphs, as demonstrated in experiments.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Overall, I enjoyed reading the paper. My only concern is the experiments:
label: none

sentence: 1) Some of the benchmark datasets for the proposed task as well as some well-known methods (see Battaglia et al’18 and references in there) are missing.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: 2) Applying the model of Hartford et al’18 to problems where interacting sets are identical is similar to applying convolution layer to a feature vector that is not equivariant to translation.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: (In both cases the equivariance group of data is a strict subgroup of the equivariance of the layer.)
label: none

sentence: Do you agree that for this reason, all the experiments on the synthetic dataset is flawed?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I take issue with the usage of the phrase "skill discovery".
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In prior work (e.g. VIC, DIAYN), this meant learning a skill-conditional policy.
label: none

sentence: Here, there is only a single (unconditioned) policy, and the different "skills" come from modifications of the environment -- the number of skills is tied to the number of environments.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This is not to say that this way of doing things is wrong, but rather that it is misleading in the context of prior work.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Skill discovery in this context implies being able to have a single agent execute a variety of learned skills, rather than having one agent per environment with each environment designed to elicit a specific skill.
label: none

sentence: Rather than "skill discovery", I suggest the authors position MISC relative to earlier work on empowerment, wherein a single policy was used to maximize mutual information of the form I(a; s_t | s_{t-1}).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Modifying the objective to incorporate domain knowledge (as done in your DIAYN baseline) yields I(a; s_i | s_{t-1}) and is amenable to maximization by either of the lower bounds considered here.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Indeed, your DIAYN baseline with skill length set to 1 and the number of skills equal to the number of actions (or same parameterization in the case of continuous actions) should recover this approach.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I believe this would be a much more appropriate baseline, and I'd be curious to hear the intuition for why I(s_c ; s_i) should be superior.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Apart from this missing baseline, the experimental results seem convincing.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: However, it is unclear whether or not VIME and PER were modified to incorporate domain knowledge (i.e. s_i/s_c distinction).
label: asp_substance

sentence: Indeed, an appendix would be greatly appreciated, as many experimental details were omitted.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Ideally, an experimental setup with previously published results (e.g. control suite for DIAYN, Seaquest for DISCERN) would be considered, but I can understand why this wasn't done as incorporating domain knowledge is the main contribution of the paper.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: That said, the claims should be weakened to reflect this gap, and domain knowledge should be mentioned more prominently (e.g. states of interest vs context are given, not learned).
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Rebuttal EDIT:
label: none

sentence: The language around skills and the extent of prior knowledge still downplays things a bit too much for my liking.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Needing new environment variations to obtain new skills is a large step backwards from things like DIAYN (the MISC/DIAYN combination needs more evidence to be considered a possible solution), and the s_i/s_c distinction is non-trivial to specify or learn for harder problems (e.g. pixel observations).
label: none

sentence: That said, in the sort of settings under consideration (low dimensional state variables and environmental variations are simple to create) MISC does appear to be superior to prior work.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The empowerment baseline is much appreciated, and while modifications of PER and VIME that incorporate prior knowledge would've also been nice, the experimental results pass the bar for acceptance in my view.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper presents a world model-based approach in which behaviours are optimised by rollouts (i.e. imagination) in latent space.
label: none

sentence: The paper achieves impressive results across a large selection of tasks, both in terms of sample efficiency and final performance.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I found the paper interesting to read and well written.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The main contribution (backpropagating analytic gradients through imagined trajectories?) could potentially be highlighted more but otherwise the paper was clear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I wonder if the authors ever looked at how much the size of the latent vector determines the performance of the system?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Is there an optional latent vector size across domains or is that optimal size task dependent?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Additionally, how much variance is there in the imagined trajectories from a certain starting state? In other words, are the endpoints of most imagined trajectories similar or very different?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: There is actually not too much for me to critique and I would suggest this paper should be accepted.
label: none

sentence: Minor comment:
label: none

sentence: - On page 2 it says “We approach this limitation in latenby”, which I assume is a typo?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: #After rebuttal#
label: none

sentence: The authors' response addressed my remaining questions.
label: none

sentence: In this paper, the authors address representation learning in non-Euclidean spaces.
label: none

sentence: The authors are motivated by constant curvature geometries, that can  provide a useful trade-off between Euclidean representations and Riemannian manifolds, i.e. arriving at more suitable representations than possible in the Euclidean space, while not sacrifising closed-form formulae for estimating distances, gradients and so on.
label: none

sentence: The authors point out that an extension of the gyrovector space formalization to spaces of constant positive curvature (spherical) is required, and with the corresponding formalization for hyperbolic spaces, one can arrive at a unified formalism that can interpolate smoothly between all geometries of constant curvature.
label: none

sentence: The authors propose to do so by replacing  the curvature while flipping the sign in the standard Poincare model.
label: none

sentence: This is a strong point reagarding this work, as it seems that no such unification has been attempted in the past (although simply replacing the curvature in the Poincare model seems a bit too straightforward to not have been attempted, it seems to be the case).
label: none

sentence: The authors also provide extensive supplementary material (around 20 pages) with detailed derivations and descriptions of experiments.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This also makes me wonder if this paper is more suitable for a journal - both in terms of the extensive supplementary material (e.g., curvature sampling algorithm and other details can be found only in supplementary), as well as the more rigorous review process that a journal paper goes through.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In the main paper, only proof of concept experiments are provided (one experiment), that nevertheless show competitive performance under varying settings.
label: none

sentence: However, it seems to me that such contributions in the rising field of geometric deep learning, where several challenges are yet to be overcome, can be beneficial for future research.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Since in the supplementary experiments also, it seems that curvature does have small variance in the results, how would the authors assess the robustness of the curvature sampling method with respect to the results?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The authors propose in this paper an approach for learning models with tractable approximate posterior inference.
label: none

sentence: The paper is well motivated (fast and accurate posterior inference) and the construction of the solutions (invertible architecture, appending vectors to input and output, choice of cost function) well described.
label: asp_motivation-impact
