sentence: Paper summary.
label: none

sentence: The paper proposes Dreamer, a model-based RL method for high-dimensional inputs such as images.
label: none

sentence: The main novelty in Dreamer is to learn a policy function from latent representation-and-transition models in an end-to-end manner.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, Dreamer is an actor-critic method that learns an optimal policy by backpropagating re-parameterized gradients through a value function, a latent transition model, and a latent representation model.
label: none

sentence: This is unlike existing methods which use model-free or planning methods on simulated trajectories to learn the optimal policy.
label: none

sentence: Meanwhile, Dreamer learns the remaining components, namely a value function, a latent transition model, and a latent representation model, based on existing methods (the world models and PlaNet).
label: none

sentence: Experiments on a large set of continuous control tasks show that Dreamer outperforms existing model-based and model-free methods.
label: none

sentence: Comments.
label: none

sentence: Efficiently learning a policy from visual inputs is an important research direction in RL.
label: none

sentence: This paper takes a step in this direction by improving existing model-based methods (the world models and PlaNet) using the actor-critic approach.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: I am leaning towards weak accepting the paper.
label: none

sentence: I am reluctant to give a higher score due to its incremental contribution.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Specifically, the policy update in Dreamer resembles that of SVG (Heess et al., 2015), which also backpropagates re-parameterized gradients through a value function and a transition model.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The main difference between Dreamer and SVG is that Dreamer incorporates a latent representation model.
label: none

sentence: From this viewpoint, the actor-critic component in Dreamer is an incremental contribution.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Since the latent models are learned based on existing techniques, the paper presents an incremental contribution.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Besides the above comments, I have these additional comments.
label: none

sentence: - Effectiveness on very long horizon trajectories:
label: none

sentence: Simulating long-horizon trajectories with a probabilistic model is known to be unsuitable for model-based RL due to accumulated errors.
label: none

sentence: This is an open issue in model-based RL.
label: none

sentence: The paper attempts to solve this issue by backpropagating policy gradients through the transition model, which is known to be more robust against model errors (see e.g., PILCO (Deisenroth et al., 2011)).
label: none

sentence: However, the issue still exists in Dreamer, since there seems to be an upper limit of effective horizon length (perhaps around 40, according to Figure 4).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This horizon length is still short compared to the entire horizon length of many MDPs (e.g., 1000).
label: none

sentence: I think this point should be discussed in the paper.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: That is, the issue still exists, and Dreamer is less effective with very long horizon.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - Inapplicability to discrete controls:
label: none

sentence: One restriction of re-parameterized gradients is that the technique is not applicable to discrete random variables.
label: none

sentence: This restriction exists in Dreamer, and the method cannot be applied to discrete control tasks unless approximation techniques such as Gumbel-softmax are used.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Still, such approximations would make learning more challenging, especially with long-horizon backpropagation.
label: none

sentence: This restriction should be noted in the paper.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - There is no mention about variance of policy gradient estimates.
label: none

sentence: Dreamer does not use any variance reduction technique, so the gradient estimates could have very large variance.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - q_theta was introduced in Eq. (8) before it is defined in Eq. (11).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Also, I suggest moving Section 4 to be right after Section 2, since Section 4 presents existing techniques similarly to Section 2, while Section 3 presents the main contribution.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Update after authors' response.
label: none

sentence: I read the response.
label: none

sentence: The paper is more clear after authors' clarification.
label: none

sentence: Though, I still think the contribution is incremental, since back-propagating gradients through values and dynamics has been studied in prior works (albeit with less empirical successes compared to Dreamer).
label: asp_originality

sentence: Nonetheless, I am keen to acceptance. I would increase the rating from 6 to 7, but I will keep the rating of 6 since the rating of 7 is not possible.
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes an efficient zero-confidence attack algorithm, MARGINATTACK, which uses the modified Rosen's algorithm to optimize the same objective as CW attack.
label: none

sentence: Under a set of conditions, the authors proved convergence of the proposed attack algorithm.
label: none

sentence: My main concern about this paper is why this algorithm has a better performance than CW attack?
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: I would suggest comparing with CW attack under different sets of hyper-parameters.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Minor comment:
label: none

sentence: The theoretical proof depends on the convexity assumption, I would also suggest comparing the proposed attack with CW and other benchmarks on some simple models that satisfy the assumptions.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The paper proposes an approach to learn nonlinear causal relationship from time series data that is based on empirical risk minimization regularized by mutual information.
label: none

sentence: The mutual information at the minimizer of the objective function  is used as causal measure.
label: none

sentence: The paper is well written and the proposed method well motivate and intuitive.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: However I am concerned by the assumption that the lagged variables X_{t-1}^{(j)} follow a diagonal gaussian distribution.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This appears to be very restrictive, since typically the values of time series j at time t-1 are typically depending say of those that time t-2, t-3 etc.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Another key concern concerns scalability.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors mention gene regulatory networks , neuroscience etc as key applications.
label: none

sentence: Yet the experiments considered in the paper are limited to very few time series.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For instance the simulation experiments use  N=30,
label: none

sentence: which is much smaller than the number of time series usually involved say in gene regulatory network data
label: asp_substance

sentence: The real data experiments use N= 6 or N=2.
label: none

sentence: This is way to small.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The real data experiments (sections 4.2 and 4.3) are not very convincing, not only because of the very small size of N, but also because there is no comparison with the other approaches.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: How do these compare? Does the proposed approach offer  insights on these datasets which are not captured by the comparison methods?
label: asp_substance

sentence: *** Increased to weak accept after discussion of merits of ME bias was improved in the paper ***
label: none

sentence: This paper investigates whether neural networks exhibit a ‘mutual exclusivity (ME) bias’, whereby novel inputs tend to be associated with previously unseen outputs, an inductive bias that is cited to be present in children when learning to associate new words and objects.
label: none

sentence: Via three different sets of experiments, the authors conclude that, under standard training procedures, neural networks in fact display an anti-ME bias: when faced with a novel input, they tend to assign less probability mass to unobserved outputs than is justified by the incoming data.
label: none

sentence: The authors go on to argue that explicitly designing neural networks to reason by mutual exclusivity could lead to faster and more flexible learning.
label: none

sentence: While the experiments across several domains convincingly show the presence of an anti-ME bias in neural network training, I recommend that the paper be rejected because it falls short in demonstrating to what extent performance could be improved by correcting or reversing this bias.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors pose an interesting hypothesis, but it would gain a lot of credibility if they could provide an empirical analysis of an algorithm that uses ME reasoning to improve learning in a realistic setting or if they could at least perform some quantitative analysis of the effects of ME bias on task performance for a toy example.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Comments / questions:
label: none

sentence: * The authors duly acknowledge that ME bias is not necessarily desirable in all circumstances, namely in tasks that feature many-to-one mappings, citing polysemy and synonymy in machine translation as examples.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Without an empirical example in a realistic setting, it is hard to judge whether the benefits of introducing an ME bias for better classification of new inputs belonging to new classes can outweigh the negatives via a potential increase in misclassification of those belonging to old classes.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: * For the synthetic dataset one-to-one mapping of one-hot vectors it is clear that an ME bias would incur an advantage for classification on a zero-shot basis, i.e. an increased an accuracy for the first time a new input is observed. Is ME bias considered to be useful here because (i) we care directly about improving this type of zero-shot classification, or is it (ii) because it's implicitly assumed that a better initial prediction will lead to faster learning on these examples?
label: asp_substance

sentence: If it is (i) we care about, then it would be useful to quantify the advantage gained either empirically or analytically.
label: none

sentence: It’s not obvious to me how useful the ME bias would be when there is a large number of classes since the probability assigned to the true novel class with a perfect ME bias would be 1 / (# unseen classes).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: So at the beginning of training, while there are lots of new classes to benefit from the ME bias, the maximum advantage per example is small, and vice versa at the end of training - how do these conflicting effects balance each other out over the course of training and how do the benefits of ME bias scale with the number of classes?
label: asp_substance

sentence: Presumably, whether the benefit scales well will depend on the loss function - in any case, this warrants some analysis/discussion especially given that there are no experiments to test it.
label: asp_substance

sentence: * The authors say that “ME can be generalized from applying to 'novel versus familiar’ stimuli to instead handling ‘rare versus frequent’ stimuli” and they cite the fact that neural networks take longer to learn from rare stimuli, suggesting that ME could help for reason (ii) above.
label: none

sentence: It’s not obvious to me that ME bias will provide a significant advantage in a one-shot or few-shot learning setting - i.e. how useful is having made a better initial guess (which is random amongst the unseen classes) after you gain some specific information about the target class? Perhaps the benefit is small relative to that of the one-shot or few-shot information gained - I think this needs to be quantified empirically.
label: asp_substance

sentence: * It would be interesting to see a more detailed analysis of the predictions of the image classifiers in section 4.2.
label: asp_substance

sentence: When a new image is presented, how is the probability mass distributed across previously seen classes versus across unseen ones?
label: none

sentence: From a strategic standpoint, in a scenario where it is difficult to determine whether a new image belongs to a new class or not, could it plausibly be more sensible for the network to make a strong prediction on its best guess out of previously seen classes (that it knows more about) rather than a scattered prediction on the unseen classes?
label: none

sentence: Admittedly this is a difficult question to quantify, but my point is to question whether the anti-ME bias shown in Figure 6 is necessarily suboptimal, given the difficulty of classifying a new image as a new class or not.
label: none

sentence: Minor comments /questions not affecting review:
label: none

sentence: * Is the acronym ME pronounced like the word “me” or is it spelled out “M-E”? If the latter, then all cases of “a ME bias” should be corrected to “an ME bias”.
label: asp_substance

sentence: * Section 4.2 line 3: “sample the class [for the] from a power law distribution"
label: asp_substance

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: Many prior works have found that the features output by the final layer of neural networks can often be used as informative representations for many tasks despite being trained for one in particular.
label: none

sentence: These feature representations, however, are learned transformations of low-level input representations, e.g. RGB values of an image.
label: none

sentence: In this paper, they aim to learn useful feature representations without meaningful low-level input representations, e.g. just an instance ID.
label: none

sentence: Instead, meaningful representations are learned through gathered triplet comparisons of these IDs, e.g. is instance A more similar to instance B or instance C? Similar existing techniques fall in the realm of learning ordinal embeddings, but this technique demonstrates speed-ups that allow it to scale to large real world datasets.
label: none

sentence: The two primary contributions of the paper are given as:
label: none

sentence: - a showcase of the power of neural networks as a tool to approximately solve NP-hard optimization problems with discrete inputs
label: none

sentence: - a scalable approach for the ordinal embedding problem
label: none

sentence: After experimentation on synthetic data, they compare the effectiveness of their proposed method Ordinal Embedding Neural Network (OENN) against the baseline techniques of Local Ordinal Embedding (LOE) and t-distributed Stochastic Triplet Embedding (TSTE).
label: none

sentence: The test error given by the systems is comparable, but there are clear speed benefits to the proposed method OENN as the other techniques could not be run for a dataset size of 20k, 50k, or 100k.
label: none

sentence: Then, they gathered real-world data using MTurk applied to a subset of ImageNet and applied OENN to learning embeddings of different image instances using only the MTurk triplet information rather than the input RGB input features.
label: none

sentence: Decision: Weak Reject
label: none

sentence: 1. Interesting technique to take advantage of neural networks to efficiently learn ordinal embeddings from a set of relationships without a low-level feature representation, but I believe the experiments could be improved.
label: asp_substance

sentence: One of the main advantages of this approach is efficiency, which allows it to be used on large real-world datasets.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The MTurk experiment gives a qualitative picture, but it could be improved with comparisons to pairwise distances learned through alternative means using the RGB image itself (given that images would permit such a comparison).
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: By this I mean, that you may be able to use relationships learned using conventional triplet methods which use input RGB features as ground truth, and test your learned relationships against those.
label: none

sentence: However, since quantitative exploration of large real-world datasets may be challenging and expensive to collect, the synthetic experiments could have been more detailed.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The message of synthetic experiments would be stronger if more of them were available and if the comparison between LOE, TSTE, and OENN was made on more of them.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: 2. I think that the claim that the use of neural networks with discrete inputs can approximately solve NP-hard optimization problems is an exciting one, which likely necessitates more experiments (or theoretical results), but as it stands I don't think it is a fundamentally different conclusion from the fact that this method provides a great scalable solution for the ordinal embedding problem.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This claim can be made secondarily or as motivation for continued exploration along this direction, but I think listing them as two distinct contributions is necessary.
label: none

sentence: Additional feedback:
label: none

sentence: Since quantitative real-world results are challenging to obtain, improved presentation of the qualitative results would be helpful as well.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: You may be able to show more plots which help display the quality of the embedding space varying with the number of triplets used.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: For example, an additional plot after Figure 5 (b) which shows a few scatter plots of points (color coded by class) for training with different numbers of collected triplets.
label: none

sentence: Also, since it should be fairly easy to distinguish between cars and animals or cars and food, it may be more interesting to focus on the heat-maps from along the block diagonal of Figure 5 (a) and talk about what relationships may have been uncovered within the animal or food subsets.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Very minor details:
label: none

sentence: In Figure 5, a legend indicating the relationship between color intensity and distance would be helpful.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In Figure 6 there seem to be unnecessary discrepancies between the y-axis and colorbar of subplots (a) and (b), and keeping those more consistent would improve readability.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper proposes an approach to construct surrogate objectives for the effective application of policy gradient methods to combinatorial optimization without known neighborhood structure.
label: none

sentence: The surrogate is constructed with the goal of reducing the need of hyper-parameter tuning and evaluated on a clique finding task.
label: none

sentence: The proposed approach is very similar to the CE method by Rubinstein (as stated by the authors in the related work section), limiting the contributions of this paper.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The proposed sampling distributions assumes independence between the random variables over which the authors optimize — I find it surprising that this leads to good empirical results
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: are relatively little structure can be captured using this distribution.
label: none

sentence: Can the authors elaborate on this?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: However, as also observed by the authors, the sampling distribution can also be replaced by more sophisticated distributions.
label: none

sentence: The empirical evaluation is limited in considering only one task (clique finding), and the results seem to be quite sensitive to the chosen optimizer.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Summary: The paper focuses on comparing the impact of explicit modularity and structure on systematic generalization by studying neural modular networks and “generic” models.
label: none

sentence: The paper studies one instantiation of this systematic generalization for the setting of binary “yes” or “no” visual question answering task.
label: none

sentence: They introduce a new dataset called in which model has to answer questions that require spatial reasoning about pairs of randomly scattered letters and digits in the image.
label: none

sentence: While the models are evaluated on all possible object pairs, they are trained on a smaller subset.
label: none

sentence: They observe that NMNs generalize better than other neural models when an appropriate choice of layout and parametrization is made.
label: none

sentence: They also show that current end-to-end approaches for inducing model layout or learning model parametrization fail to generalize better than generic models.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: - The conclusions of the paper regarding the generalization ability of neural modular networks is timely given the widespread interest in these class of algorithms.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: - Additionally, they present interesting observations regarding how sensitive NMNs are to the layout of models.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Experimental evidence (albeit on specific type of question) of this behaviour will be helpful for the community and hopefully motivate them to incorporate regularizers or priors that steer the learning towards better layouts.
label: none

sentence: - The authors provide a nice summary of all the models analyzed in Section 3.1 and Section 3.2.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Cons:
label: none

sentence: - While the results on SQOOP dataset are interesting, it would have been very exciting to see results on other synthetic datasets.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Specifically, there are two datasets which are more complex and uses templated language to generate synthetic datasets similar to this paper:
label: none

sentence: - CLEVR environment or a modification of that dataset to reflect the form of systematic the authors are studying in the paper.
label: none

sentence: - Abstract Scenes VQA dataset introduced in“Yin and Yang: Balancing and Answering Binary Visual Questions” by Zhang and Goyal et al. They provide a balanced dataset in which there are a pairs of scenes for every question, such that the answer to the question is “yes” for one scene, and “no” for the other for the exact same question.
label: none

sentence: - Perhaps because the authors study a very specific kind of question, they limit their analysis to only three modules and two structures (tree & chain).
label: none

sentence: However, in the most general setting NMN will form a DAG and it would have been interesting to see what form of DAGs generalize better than other.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - It is not clear to me how the analysis done in this paper will generalize to other more complex datasets where the network layout NMN might be more complex, the number of modules and type of modules might also be more.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Because, the results are only shown on one dataset, it is harder to see how one might extend this work to other form of questions on slightly harder datasets.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Other Questions / Remarks:
label: none

sentence: - Given that the accuracy drop is very significant moving from NMN-Tree to NMN-Chain, is there an explanation for this drop?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - While the authors mention multiple times that #rhs/#lhs = 1 and 2 are more challenging than #rhs/#lhs=18, they do not sufficiently explain why this is the case anywhere in the paper.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - Small typo in the last line of section 4.3 on page 7. It should say: This is in stark contrast with “NMN-Tree” …
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - Small typo in the “Layout induction” paragraph, line 6 on Page 7:
label: asp_clarity

sentence: and for $p_0(tree) = 0.1$ and when we use the Find module
label: none

sentence: This paper studies backdoor attacks under federated learning setting.
label: none

sentence: To inject a certain backdoor pattern, existing work generate poisoning samples by blending the same pattern with different input samples.
label: none

sentence: Even for federated learning where the adversary can control multiple parties, such as [1], all parties still use the same global backdoor pattern to generate poisoning samples locally.
label: none

sentence: On the contrary, in this work, they decompose the global pattern into several small local patterns, and each adversarial party only uses a local pattern to generate poisoning samples.
label: none

sentence: In their evaluation, they show that the backdoor attacks generated in this way are more effective, resilient to benign model parameter updates, and also survive better against existing defense algorithms against attacks in federated learning settings.
label: none

sentence: I think the topic studied in this paper is very important and meaningful, and I am convinced that by decomposing a global pattern into several smaller local pieces, the model parameter updates computed by each party should be more similar to benign updates and thus can better bypass the defense algorithms.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Meanwhile, the evaluation is pretty comprehensive and it is good to see that the conducted backdoor attacks are effective.
label: asp_substance

sentence: However, when there is no defense deployed in the training process, it is not intuitive to see why the proposed attack is more effective and persistent than the centralized attack, given that a smaller trigger usually results in a worse attack performance.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Thus, I would like to see more possible explanation on it.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Specifically, I have the following questions for clarification:
label: none

sentence: 1. For the evaluation of DBA, I assume that there are 4 adversarial parties, controlling each of the 4 local triggers. When using centralized attacks, are there still 4 adversarial parties, although they share the same global trigger, or if there is only 1 adversarial party?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: 2. To evaluate A-S setting, I understand that it may be tricky to enable a fair comparison between the centralized attack and DBA.
label: none

sentence: However, one explanation of why DBA is more persistent in this case is because the adversarial parameter updates happen 4x times compared to the centralized attack.
label: none

sentence: Therefore, another baseline to check is to conduct centralized attacks with the same number of times as DBA, but each update includes 1/4 number of poisoning samples, so that the total number of poisoning samples included to compute the gradient update still stays the same.
label: none

sentence: 3. Can the authors show if the decomposition is also useful for trigger patterns that are not necessarily regular shapes?
label: asp_substance

sentence: For backdoor attacks, a line of work studies physical triggers, e.g., glasses in [2].
label: none

sentence: It is not natural to decompose such kind of patterns into several smaller pieces, unless the performance is significantly boosted.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 4. Can the authors show concrete examples on how the attacks are generated?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: The details are especially unclear on LOAN.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Specifically, which features are perturbed, what are the values assigned as the trigger, and what is the corresponding target label?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: [1]  Bagdasaryan et al., How to backdoor federated learning.
label: none

sentence: [2] Chen et al., Targeted Backdoor Attacks on Deep Learning Systems Using Data Poisoning.
label: none

sentence: Post-rebuttal comments
label: none

sentence: I appreciate the authors' great effort to address my concerns! I think the evaluation in the current version of the paper is pretty comprehensive and provides a valuable study, and I am happy to raise my score accordingly.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper proposed to train a network with training curves and corresponding parameters, and use policy search to find optimal parameter to replace hundreds or thousands of training in real case scenario, and it is clearly much faster using the trained network to infer parameters, instead of tuning the network manually.
label: none

sentence: The first point would be: what's the meaning of synthetically generating training curves other than proving that transformer achieves good performance in modeling discrete distribution? Most practical problems would not have the same distribution as the previously gathered public dataset, thus the data is not representative, and synthetic training curves just does not make sence.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The cited paper 'Learning an adaptive learning rate schedule' does not appear online.
label: arg_other

sentence: The paper propose to incorporate an additional class for adversarial and out-distribution samples in CNNs.
label: none

sentence: The paper propose to incorporate natural out-distribution images and interpolated images to the additional class, but the problem of selecting the out-distribution images is itself an important problem.
label: none

sentence: The paper presents a very simple approaches for selecting the out-distribution images that relies on many hidden assumptions on the images source or the base classier, and the interpolation mechanism is also too simple and there is the implicit assumption of low complexity images.
label: none

sentence: There exists more principled approaches for selecting out-distribution images that has not considered here like those based on uncertainty estimation or recently proposed direct out-distribution detectors.
label: asp_originality

sentence: In summary, the quality of the paper is poor and the originality of the work is low.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The paper is easily readable.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This is an interesting paper with a new approach to learn a sparse, positive (and hence interpretable) semantic space that maximizes human similarity judgements, by training to specifically maximize the prediction of human similarity judgements.
label: none

sentence: The authors have collected the dataset themselves and have rating of sets of 3 objects from 1854 unique objects.
label: none

sentence: They end up with a space (SPoSE) with relatively low dimensionality with respect to usual word embeddings (49 dimension) but perhaps not surprising when considering the small size of the words to embed.
label: none

sentence: The authors run a set of experiment to show the usefulness of SPoSE.
label: none

sentence: The most interesting one is the prediction of its dimensions by the CSLB features, which reveals a nice clustering in the different SPoSE dimensions.
label: none

sentence: Perhaps the results would be a little more convincing if additional common word embeddings were also tested.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Due to the different objects used in the different datasets, some of the experiments have a smaller set of words.
label: asp_substance

sentence: A good extension of this work would be to combine a text-derived embedding  or the synsets to interpolate the SPoSE dimensions for missing words in the original set.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Or perhaps the object similarity ratings could be used in a semi-supervised setting to inform the learning of a co-occurence word embedding.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This will allow the model to better describe a larger set of words.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Another possible extension is to test this larger set of words on a non-behavioral NLP task to show possible improvements that the behavioral data and the interpretable space give.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper formulates a new inference method called DDGC for noise labels and adversarial attacks.
label: none

sentence: Their main idea is to induce a generative classifer on top of hidden feature spaces of the discriminative deep model.
label: none

sentence: To improve the robustness, their DDGC model leverages the minimum covariance determinant (MCD) estimator.
label: none

sentence: Besides, the author proposes Theorem 1 to justify their MCD-based generative classifer.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: 1. The authors find a new angle for learning with noisy labels.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Motivated by the fact that LDA-like generative classifer assuming the class-wise unimodal distribution might be robust, they introduce a generative classifer on top of hidden feature spaces of the discriminative deep model.
label: none

sentence: 2. The authors perform numerical experiments to demonstrate the effectiveness of their framework in benchmark datasets. And their experimental result support their previous claims.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Cons:
label: none

sentence: We have two questions in the following.
label: none

sentence: 1. Related works: In deep learning with noisy labels, there are three main directions, including small-loss trick [1-3], estimating noise transition matrix [4-6], and explicit and implicit regularization [7-9].
label: none

sentence: I would appreciate if the authors can survey and compare more baselines in their paper instead of listing some basic ones.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: 2. Experiment:
label: none

sentence: 2.1 Baselines: For noisy labels, the authors should add MentorNet [1] as a baseline https://github.com/google/mentornet From my own experience, this baseline is very strong.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: At the same time, they should compare with VAT [7].
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: For adversarial attacks, the author should compare with data type from [10], and list L-FBGS [11] as a basic baseline.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: 2.2 Datasets: For datasets, I think the author should first compare their methods on symmetric and aysmmetric noisy data.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Besides, the current paper only verifies on vision datasets.
label: none

sentence: The authors are encouraged to conduct 1 NLP dataset.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper studies the properties of SGD as a function of batch size and learning rate.
label: none

sentence: Authors argue that SGD has two regimes:  a noise dominated regime (small batch size) and curvature dominated regime (large batch size).
label: none

sentence: Authors conduct through numerical experiments highlighting how learning rate changes as a function of batch size (initially linear growth and then saturates).
label: none

sentence: The critical contribution of this work appears to be the observation that large batch size can be worse than small under same number of steps demonstrating implicit regularization of small batch size.
label: none

sentence: The two regime claim of the paper is not really novel.
label: asp_originality

sentence: These regimes are fairly well covered by previous works (e.g. Belkin et al as well as others).
label: asp_originality

sentence: When it comes to experiments, constant epoch budget is also fairly well understood and the behavior in Figure 1 is not really surprising (as the eventual training performance gets worse with large batches).
label: asp_originality

sentence: The interesting part in my opinion is the experiments on constant steps.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Authors verify large batch size reduces test accuracy while improving train.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I believe these experiments are novel and the results are interesting.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Besides CIFAR 10, authors test this hypothesis in two other datasets while tuning the learning rate.
label: none

sentence: On the other hand, contribution is somewhat incremental given observations made by related literature (Keskar et al and others).
label: asp_originality

sentence: Some remarks:
label: none

sentence: 1) In Table 1, batch size 16k has effective LR of 32.
label: none

sentence: However in Figure 1c SGD with momentum at batch size 8k uses an effective LR of 4.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Can you explain this inconsistency i.e. why is there such a huge jump from 4 to 32 (in reality we expect the effective LR to stay constant in the curvature regime).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I also understand that one is constant epoch and other is constant step.
label: none

sentence: However 4 to 32 seems a bit inconsistent.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 2) Does momentum help in constant step budget (with sufficiently large steps so that training loss is small)?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 3) Readability: Consider explaining what is meant by "warm-up", "epoch budget", "step budget" clearly and upfront.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors introduce the idea of distributed backdoor attacks in the FL framework, in which the dishonest participants in FL add local triggers to their training data to influence the global model to classify triggered images in a desired way.
label: none

sentence: They show empirically that the learned models then are more likely to be successfully forced to misclassified images in which all the local triggers are present at test time, than are models learned using centralized backdoor attacks, where all attackers use the same trigger pattern (one of the same size as the concatenation of the local triggers, to be fair in the comparison).
label: none

sentence: They then demonstrate that because the local triggers cause smaller corruptions in the model coefficients, these distributed attacks survive robust FL training algorithms (namely FoolsGold, and a recent robust regression based method) more often than centralized attacks.
label: none

sentence: Similar experiments are conducted on the Loan text dataset, using appropriate analogs of local triggers, with similar results.
label: none

sentence: The paper contributes a novel model for conducting backdoor attacks in the FL setup, and shows that this model is more successful at attacking when training using robust FL algorithms than the standard centralized backdoor attack model.
label: none

sentence: I lean towards accept, as this is a realistic attack model, and as such can further stimulate research into the robustification of FL model aggregation algorithms.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: The authors present a empirical investigation of methods for scaling GANs to complex datasets, such as ImageNet, for class-conditioned image generation.
label: none

sentence: They first build and describe a strong baseline based on recently proposed techniques for GANs and push the performance on large datasets with several modifications presented sequentially, to obtain strong state-of-the-art IS/FID scores, as well as impressive visual results.
label: none

sentence: The authors propose a simple truncation trick to control the fidelity/variance which is interesting on its own but cannot always scale with the architecture.
label: none

sentence: The authors further propose a orthogonalization-based regularization to mitigate this problem.
label: none

sentence: An investigation of training collapse at large scale is also performed; the authors investigate some regularization schemes based on gathered empirical evidence.
label: none

sentence: As a result, they explore and discard Spectral Normalization of the generator as a way to prevent collapse and show that a severe tradeoff between stability and quality can be controlled when using zero-centered gradient penalties in the Discriminator.
label: none

sentence: In the end, no solution that can ensure quality and stability is found, except having prohibitively large amounts of data (~300M images).
label: none

sentence: Models are evaluated on the ImageNet and on this internal, bigger dataset.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: - This investigation gives a significant amount of insights on GAN stability and performance at large scales, which should be useful for anyone working with GANs on complex datasets (and that have access to great computational resources).
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Even though commonly used evaluations metrics for GANs are still not fully adequate, the authors obtain quantitative performance significantly beyond previous work, which seems indeed correlated with remarkable visual results.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - The baseline and added modifications are well presented and clearly explained.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The Appendices also have great value in that regard.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Cons:
label: none

sentence: - Discussions sometimes lack depth or are absent.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For example, it is unclear to me why some larger models are not amenable to truncation.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Besides visible artifacts, what does it mean? Why does a smoother G reduces those artifacts?
label: asp_substance

sentence: Were samples from those networks better without using truncation? Why would this be?
label: none

sentence: Authors report how wider networks perform best, and how deeper networks degrade performance.
label: none

sentence: Again, discussions are lacking, and it doesn’t seem the authors tried to understand why such behaviors were shown.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Even though this is mostly an empirical investigation, I think some more efforts should be put in understanding and explaining why some of those behaviors are shown, as I think it can bootstrap future work more easily.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - In Section 3.1 : “Across runs in Table 1, we observe that without Orthogonal Regularization, only 16% of models are amenable to truncation compared to 60% with Orthogonal Regularization.” For me, this is not particularly clear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Is this something the reader should understand from Table 1?
label: none

sentence: - I question the choice of sections chosen to be in the main paper/appendices.
label: arg_other

sentence: I greatly appreciated the negative results reported in the main text as well as in the appendices and this has significant value.
label: asp_substance

sentence: However, as this is to me mostly a detailed empirical investigation and presentation of high-performance GANs on large scales, I would be likely to share this with colleagues who want to tackle similar problems.
label: none

sentence: In this case, if future readers limit themselves to the main text, I think it can have more value to present some content form Appendix B and C than to have more than a full page on stability investigations and attempted tricks that turned out not to be used to reach maximal performance.
label: asp_substance

sentence: However I do not want to discourage publishing of negative results, and I definitely wish to see this investigation in the paper, but I merely question the positioning of such information.
label: none

sentence: With regard to my first negative point above about the lack of discussions, it seems the analysis of Section 4 is disproportionate compared to other places.
label: arg_other

sentence: Suggestions/Comments:
label: none

sentence: - Regarding the diversity/fidelity tradeoff using different truncation thresholds, I think constraining the norm of the sampled noise vectors to the exact threshold value (by projecting the samples on the 0-centered hyper-sphere of radius = threshold) could yield even more interesting or more informative Figures, as obtained scores or samples on the edge of that hyper-sphere might provide information on the ‘guaranteed’ (not proven) quality/fidelity of samples mapped from inside that hyper-sphere.
label: none

sentence: - In Appendix D, the Figures could be slightly clarified by using a colored heatmap to color the curve, with colors corresponding to the threshold values.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Similar curves could also be produced with the hyper-sphere projection proposed above to have a slightly clearer idea of the behavior on the limit of that hyper-sphere.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - In Section 4.2, in the second paragraph, you refer to Appendix F and describe “sharp upward jump at collapse” in D’s loss.
label: none

sentence: However, it seems the only Figure showing D’s loss when unconstrained is Figure 26, in which it is hard to notice any significant jump in the loss.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - In Appendix F, Figure 20 d), the title seems wrong. It seems to report sigma^2 values, but the title says “losses”.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This investigation of GAN scalability is successful results-wise even though the inability to stabilize training without sacrificing great performance on ImageNet is disappointing.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The improvement over previous SOTA is definitely significant.
label: none

sentence: This work thus shows a modern GAN architecture for complex datasets that could be a strong basis for future work.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: However, I think the paper could and should be improved with some more detailed analysis and discussions of exhibited behaviors in order to further guide and encourage future work.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It could also be clarified on some aspects, and potentially re-structured a bit to be better align with its probable impact directions.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I would also be curious to see the proposed techniques applied on simpler datasets.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Can this be useful for someone having less compute power and working on something similar to CelebA?
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper tackles the problem of semi-supervised classification using GAN-based models.
label: none

sentence: They proposed a manifold regularization by approximating the Laplacian norm using the stochastic finite difference.
label: none

sentence: The motivation is that making the classifier invariant to perturbations along the manifold is more reasonable than random perturbations.
label: none

sentence: The idea is to use GAN to learn the manifold.
label: none

sentence: The difficulty is that (the gradient of) Laplacian norm is impractical to compute for DNNs.
label: none

sentence: They stated that another approximation of the manifold gradient, i.e. adding Gaussian noise \delta to z directly (||f(z) - f(g(z+\delta))||_F) has some drawbacks when the magnitude of noise is too large or too small.
label: none

sentence: The authors proposed another improved gradient approximation by first computing the normalized manifold gradient \bar r(z) and then adding a tunable magnitude of \bar r(z) to g(z), i.e., ||f(z) - f(g(z) +\epsilon \bar r(z) )||_F. Since several previous works Kumar et al. (2017) and Qi et al. (2018) also applied the idea of manifold regularization into GAN, the authors pointed out several advantages of their new regularization.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: - The paper is clearly written and easy to follow. It gives some intuitive explanations of why their method works.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - The idea is simple and easy to implement based on a standard GAN.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - The authors conduct various experiments to show the interaction of the regularization and the generator.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Cons:
label: none

sentence: - For semi-supervised classification, the paper did not report the best results in other baselines.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: E.g., in Table 1 and 2,  the best result of VAT (Miyato et al., 2017) is VAT+Ent, 13.15 for CIFAR-10 (4000 labels) and 4.28 for SVHN (1000 labels).
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The performance of the proposed method is worse than the previous work but they claimed "state-of-the-art" results.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The paper also misses several powerful baselines of semi-supervised learning, e.g. [1,2].
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The experimental results are not very convincing because many importance baselines are neglected.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: - The paper does not have a significant novel contribution, but rather extends GANs (improved-GAN mostly) with a manifold regularization, which has been explored in many other works Kumar et al. (2017) and Qi et al. (2018).
label: asp_originality

sentence: I'm wondering whether other smoothness regularizations can achieve the same effect when applied to semi-supervised learning, e.g. spectral normalization[3].
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It would be better to compare with them.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: References:
label: none

sentence: [1] Adversarial Dropout for Supervised and Semi-Supervised Learning, AAAI 2018
label: none

sentence: [2] Smooth Neighbors on Teacher Graphs for Semi-supervised Learning, CVPR 2018
label: none

sentence: [3] Spectral Normalization for Generative Adversarial Networks, ICLR 2018
label: none

sentence: This paper points out that the traditional way of model selection is flawed due to that the validation/test set is often small.
label: none

sentence: The authors also attribute the existence of adversarial examples to the small validation/test set, which I agree to some degree.
label: none

sentence: Hence, the authors proposed an alternative approach to comparing different classification models by the notion of inter-model discrepancy.
label: none

sentence: The main idea is reasonable, but it requires that the models to compare all perform reasonably well.
label: none

sentence: Otherwise, some poorly performed models could lead to near-random or adversarial inter-model discrepancies, failing the proposed approach.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Another potential issue is that the proposed approach cannot handle training set bias. If all models are biased in similar ways (e.g., toward a particular class or domain), they will not reveal informative discrepancies for the images over which they all make similar mistakes.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Another question which is not answered in the paper is the number $k$ of images to select for each pair of classifiers. Is this number task-dependent? Is it related to the number of classes?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: What is a general guideline for one to choose this number $k$ given a new application scenario?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The unlabeled set is not "unlabeled" in essence. If my understanding was correct, it cannot contain open-set images which do not belong to any of the classes of interest.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It is also nontrivial to control that the images contain only one salient object per image.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Hence, while I agree with the authors that existing approaches to comparing deep neural network classifiers could be improved, I think the proposed solution is not a good alternative yet.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The authors propose a notion of conductance to attribute the deep neural network’s prediction to its hidden units.
label: none

sentence: The conductance is the flow of attribution via the hidden unit(s) in consideration.
label: none

sentence: The paper proposes using conductance to not only evaluate importance of hidden unit to the prediction for a specific input but also over a set of inputs.
label: none

sentence: The strongest part of the analysis of conductance is that conductance naturally couples  the path at the base features with that of the hidden layer.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors position their work well within the existing approaches in the community and generalizes the efficient use of measuring hidden activation wrt to specific input or set of inputs.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The analysis makes efficient use of mean value theorem in the context of  parametrization of the loss function.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Conductance seems to satisfy the completeness of hidden features.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Further, it also satisfies the layer-wise conservation principle with the outputs completely redistributed  to the inputs.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It would be good to see more analysis on the axioms 1 through to 4 for the sake of completeness in the light of partial axiomatization of conductance.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors provide empirical evaluation of conductance over a variety of tasks.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It would be good to see some more insight in order to relate to interpretability of the importance of neurons, although there has been no claims made on it as its hard to measure importance without interpretability.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In this work the authors propose an extension of mixture density networks to the continuous domain, named compound density networks.
label: none

sentence: Specifically the paper builds on top of the idea of the ensemble neural networks (NNs) and introduces a stochastic neural network for handling the mixing components.
label: none

sentence: The mixing distribution is also parameterised by a neural network.
label: none

sentence: The authors claim that the proposed model can result in better uncertainty estimates and the experiments attempt to demonstrate the benefits of the approach, especially in cases of having to deal with adversarial attacks.
label: none

sentence: The paper in general is well written and easy to follow.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I have some concerns regarding the presentation of the main objective and the lack of justification in certain parts of the methodology.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Let me elaborate.
label: none

sentence: First of all, I don’t understand how the main equation of the compound density network in Equation (3) is different from the general case of a Bayesian neural network? Can the authors please comment on that?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: I also find weird the way that the authors arrive to their final objective in Equation (5).
label: asp_replicability

sentence: They start from Equation (4) which is incorrectly denoted as the log-marginal distribution while it is the same conditional distribution introduced in Equation (3) with the extra summation for all the available data points.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Then they continue to Equation (5) which they present as the combination of the true likelihood with a KL regularisation term.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: However, what the authors implicitly did was to perform variational inference for maximising their likelihood by introducing a variational distribution q(\theta) = p(\theta | g(x_n; \psi).
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Is there a reason why the authors do not introduce their objective by following the variational framework?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Furthermore, in the beginning of Section 3.1 the authors present their idea on probabilistic hypernetoworks which “maps x to a distribution over parameters instead of specific value \theta.” How is this different from the case that we were considering so far? If we had a point estimate for \theta we would not require to take an expectation in Equation (3) in the first place.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: My biggest concern in the methodology, however, has to do with the selection of the matrix variate normal prior for the weights and the imposition of diagonal covariances (diag(a) and diag(b)).
label: asp_replicability

sentence: The Kronecker product between two diagonal matrices results in another diagonal matrix, i.e., diagonal covariance, which implies that the weights within a layer are given by an independent multivariate Gaussian.
label: none

sentence: What is the purpose then for introducing the matrix variate Gaussian?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: I would expect that you would like to impose additional structure to the weights.
label: none

sentence: I expect the authors to comment on that.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Regarding the experimental evaluation of the model rather confusing.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors have proposed a model that due to the mixing is better suited for predictions with heteroscedastic noise and can better quantify the aleatoric uncertainty.
label: none

sentence: However, the selected experiments on the cubic regression toy data (Section 5.1) and the out-of-distribution classification (Section 5.2) are clear examples of system’s noise, i.e. epistemic uncertainty.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The generative process of the toy data clearly states that there is no heteroscedastic noise to handle.
label: none

sentence: The same applies for the notMNIST data which belong to a completely different data set compared to MNIST and thus out of sample prediction cannot benefit from the mixing; i.e., variations have to be explained by system’s noise.
label: none

sentence: So overall I have the feeling that the authors have not succeeded to evaluate the model’s power with these two experiments and we cannot draw any strong conclusions regarding the benefit of the proposed mixing approach.
label: asp_substance

sentence: To continue with the experimental evaluation, I found the plots with the predictive uncertainty in Figure 3 a bit confusing.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The plot by itself, as I understood, quantifies the model’s uncertainty in in- and out-of sample prediction.
label: none

sentence: While I agree with the authors that it is generally desirable for a model to be more confident when predicting in MNIST (since it has already seen samples of it) compared to when predicting in notMNIST (completely different data), these plots tells us nothing regarding the predictive power of the model.
label: asp_substance

sentence: There is no value in being very confident if you are wrong and vice-versa, so unless there is an accompanying plot/table reporting the accuracy I see not much value from this plot alone.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Finally, it is unclear how the authors have picked the best \lambda parameter for their approach? On page 5 they state that they “pick the value that results in a good trade-off between high uncertainty estimates and high prediction accuracy.” Does this mean that you get to observe the performance in the test in order to select the appropriate value for \lambda? If this is the case this is completely undesirable and is considered a bad practice.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes a generative point cloud model based on adversarial learning and definitti’s representation theorem of exchangeable variables.
label: none

sentence: The main focus in experiments and the exposition is on 3D point clouds representing object shapes (seems the surface, but could also be the interior of objects, please clarify).
label: none

sentence: The main idea is to represent a point cloud using a global latent variable that captures the overall shape, and a collection of local latent variables that code for the position of a point on the shape.
label: none

sentence: The model consists of thee components:
label: none

sentence: (i) an “encoder” that takes a point cloud as input and maps it to a (point estimate of) the global latent variable of the shape represented by the input cloud, a point-net architecture is used here
label: none

sentence: (ii) a “decoder” that takes the estimated global latent variable, and a local latent variable, and maps it to an “output” point in the cloud to be produced by the model.
label: none

sentence: (iii) a “discriminator” network that aims to distinguish points from a *given* shape, and the points produced by pipe-lining the encoder and decoder.
label: none

sentence: Critically different from conventional GANs, the discriminator is optimized *per shape*, ie each point cloud is considered as a *distribution* over R^3 specific to that shape.
label: none

sentence: (iv) a “shape prior” that, once the encoder-decoder model from above is trained, is used to model the distribution over the global latent variables.
label: none

sentence: This model is trained, presumably, in a conventional GAN style using the global latent variable representations inferred across the different training point clouds.
label: none

sentence: As compared to prior work by Achiloptas et al (2017), the proposed approach has the advantage to allow for sampling an arbitrary number of points from the target shape, rather than a fixed pre-defined number.
label: none

sentence: In addition, the authors propose to minimize a weighted average of a lower bound and upper bound on the Wasserstein distance between the distributions of points corresponding to given shapes.
label: none

sentence: This approach translates to improved quantitative evaluation measures,
label: none

sentence: Experiments are conducted on a simple toy data set, as  a proof of concept, and on data from ModelNet10 and ModelNet40.
label: none

sentence: Two performance metrics are introduced to assess the auto-encoding ability of the model: to what extent does the encoder-decoder pipeline result in point clouds similar to the shape from which the input point-cloud is generated.
label: none

sentence: Overall I find the idea of the paper interesting and worth publishing, but the exposition of the paper is less than ideal and needs further work.
label: none

sentence: The experimental validation of the proposed approach can also be further improved, see more specific comments below.
label: none

sentence: Specific comments:
label: none

sentence: - The counter example at the bottom of page 2 is limited, in the sense that the oracle assumption seems highly non-realistic, casting doubt on the relevance of the argument.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The notation in section 3 (before 3.1) is rather sloppy.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For example,
label: none

sentence: - please define P and G, the elements of the divergence D(P||G) that appears in the first paragraph of section 3.
label: none

sentence: - it is not defined in which space theta lives, it is not clear what the authors intend with the notation G_theta(u) \sim p(theta).
label: none

sentence: - what prior distributions p(z) and p(u) are used? What is the choice based on?
label: asp_substance

sentence: - abbreviation IPM is referred several times in the paper, but remains undefined in the paper until end of page 4, please define earlier.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The model G_theta does not appear in the training objective function (4), how is this module trained precisely?
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Lack of clarity in the following passage: “In our setting, each point xi in the point cloud can be considered to correspond to single images when we train GANs over images”
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - The notion of divergence D(P|G) is not made concrete in section 3 and 3.1, which makes the notation of rather little use.
label: arg_other

sentence: - The following paper merits a discussion in the related work section:
label: none

sentence: “TOWARDS A NEURAL STATISTICIAN”, ICLR’17,
label: none

sentence: https://openreview.net/pdf?id=HJDBUF5le
label: none

sentence: - The manuscript contains many typos.
label: none

sentence: For example
label: none

sentence: “vedio” op page 4, “circile” on page 5, “condct” on page 8, etc.
label: arg_other

sentence: Please proof read your paper and fix these.
label: none

sentence: The refenence to  Bengio 2018 is incomplete: what do you refer to precisely?
label: asp_substance

sentence: - There seems to be no mention of the dimension of the “local” latent variables z_i.
label: none

sentence: Please comment on the choice, and its impact on the behavior of the model.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The quantitative evaluation in table 1 is interesting and useful.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: It is limited, however, in the sense that it (only) measures auto-encoding capabilities: to what extent can the shape be reproduced given a sample point cloud from the given shape.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Quantitative evaluation of generative modeling performance is unfortunately missing from this paper, as it is in much of the GAN literature.
label: arg_other

sentence: Could you please comment on how this can/will be fixed?
label: none

sentence: - The toy data set experiments could be dropped  to make room for experiments suggested below.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - An experimental study of the effect of the mixing parameter “s” would be useful to include.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For example, by taking s on a grid from 0 to 1, one could plot the coverage and distance-to-face measures.
label: none

sentence: - Experimental evaluation of auto-encoding using a variable number of input points is interesting to add: ie how do the two evaluation measures evolve as a function of the number of points in the input point cloud?
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Similar, it is interesting to evaluate how auto encoding performs when non-uniform decimation of the input cloud is performed, eg what happens if we “chop off” part of the input point cloud (eg the legs of the chair), does the model recover and add the removed parts?
label: asp_substance

sentence: This is potentially useful to practitioners which have to deal with incomplete point clouds acquired by range scanners.
label: none

sentence: - Analysis of shapes with different genus and dimensions would be interesting.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Does the model manage to capture that some shapes have holes, or consists of a closed 2D surface (ball) vs an open surface (disk),
label: asp_substance

sentence: despite a simple prior on the local latent variables z?
label: none

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes a suite of tricks for training large-scale GANs, and obtaining state-of-the-art results for high-resolution images.
label: none

sentence: The paper starts from a self-attention GAN baseline (Zhang 2018), and proposes:
label: none

sentence: -	Increasing batch size (8x) and model size (2x)
label: none

sentence: -	Splitting noise z in multiple chunks, and injecting it in multiple layers of the generator
label: none

sentence: Sampling from truncated normal distribution, where samples with norms that exceed a specific threshold are resampled.
label: none

sentence: This seems to be used only at test-time and is used to control variety-fidelity tradeoff.
label: none

sentence: The generator is encouraged to be smooth using an orthogonal regularization term.
label: none

sentence: In addition, the paper proposes practical recipes for characterizing collapse in GANs.
label: none

sentence: In the generator, the exploding of the top 3 singular values of each weight matrix seem to indicate collapse.
label: none

sentence: In the discriminator, the sudden increase of the ratio of first/second singular value of weight matrices indicate collapse in GANs.
label: none

sentence: Interestingly, the paper suggests that various regularization methods which can improve stability in GAN training, do not necessarily correspond to improvement in performance.
label: none

sentence: Strengths:
label: none

sentence: -	Proposed techniques are intuitive and very well motivated
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: -	One of the big pluses of this work is that authors try to "quantify" each proposed technique with training speed and/or performance improvement. This is really a good practice.
label: asp_substance

sentence: -	Detailed analysis for detecting collapse and improving stability in large-scale GAN
label: asp_substance

sentence: -	Probably no need to mention that, but results are quite impressive
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Weaknesses:
label: none

sentence: -	Computational budget required is massive.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: The paper mentions model use from 128-256 TPUs, which severely limits reproducibility of results.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Comments/Questions:
label: none

sentence: -	Can you elaborate more on why BatchNorm statistics are computed across all devices as opposed to per-device? Was this crucial for best performance?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: -	It is not clear if provided analysis for large-scale GANs apply for small-medium sized GANs.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Providing such analysis would be also helpful for the community.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: -	How do you see the impact of the suggested techniques on tackling harder data-modalities for GANs, e.g. text or sequential data in general?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Overall recommendation:
label: none

sentence: The paper is well written, ideas are well motivated/justified and results are very compelling.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: This is a good paper and I higly recommend acceptance.
label: arg_other

sentence: This paper is clearly written and in an interesting domain.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The question asked is whether or not pretrained mean-field RBMs can help in preventing adversarial attacks.
label: none

sentence: However, there are some key issues with the paper that are not clear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The first is regarding the structure of the paper.
label: none

sentence: The authors combine two ideas, 1: the training of MF RBMs and 2: the the ability to prevent adversarial attacks.
label: none

sentence: The combination of ideas is ok, however, it is unclear how novel or how good is the proposed MF training of the RBMs.
label: asp_originality

sentence: It would make the paper much stronger if the authors perform quantitative + qualitative evaluation on the MF training of RBMs first.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Without doing so, it leaves the reader wondering why not simply a standard RBM trained using a standard method (e.g. contrastive divergence).
label: asp_substance

sentence: In a related note, using MF for training BMs have been proposed previously and found to not work due to various reasons:
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: see paragraph after equation 8 of the Deep BM paper: http://proceedings.mlr.press/v5/salakhutdinov09a/salakhutdinov09a.pdf
label: none

sentence: It would be very interesting to contrast the proposed method with other previously proposed MF based method, in particular using Free energy to approximate the expectation of the model without constraints.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It is also unclear how the calculation of relative entropy "D" was performed in figure 3.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Obtaining the normalized marginal density in a BM is very challenging due to the partition function.
label: none

sentence: The second part of the paper associate good performance in preventing adversarial attacks with the possibility of denoising by the pretrained BM.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This is a very good point, however the paper do not compare or contrast with existing methods.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For example, it is curious to see how denoising Auto encoders would perform.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In addition, it could be worthwhile to compare and benchmark on existing evaluations: https://arxiv.org/pdf/1802.06806.pdf
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The authors should make a distinction on what kinds of attack is considered: white box, black box or grey box.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Defending against black box attacks is considerably easier than defending against white-box attacks.
label: none

sentence: In summary, the paper is interesting, however, more experiments could be added to concretely demonstrate the advantage
label: none

sentence: of the proposed MF BMs in increasing robustness against adversarial attacks.
label: none

sentence: The paper shows that Bayesian neural networks, trained with Dropout MC (Gal et al.) struggle to fully capture the posterior distribution of the weights.
label: none

sentence: This leads to over-confident predictions which is problematic particularly in an active learning scenario.
label: none

sentence: To prevent this behavior, the paper proposes to combine multiple Bayesian neural networks, independently trained with Dropout MC, to an ensemble.
label: none

sentence: The proposed method achieves better uncertainty estimates than a single Bayesian neural networks model and improves upon the baseline in an active learning setting for image classification.
label: none

sentence: The paper addresses active deep learning which is certainly an interesting research direction since in practice, labeled data is notoriously scarce.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: However, the paper contains only little novelty and does not provide sufficiently new scientific insights.
label: asp_originality

sentence: It is well known from the literature that combining multiply neural networks to an ensemble leads to better performance and uncertainty estimates.
label: none

sentence: For instance, Lakshminarayanan et al.[1] showed that Dropout MC can produce overconfident wrong prediction and, by simply averaging prediction over multiple models, one achieves better performance and confidence scores.
label: none

sentence: Also, Huand et al. [2] showed that by taking different snapshots of the same network at different timesteps performance improves.
label: none

sentence: It would also be great if the paper could related to other existing work that uses Bayesian neural networks in an active learning setting such as Bayesian optimization [3, 4] or Bandits[5].
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Another weakness of the paper is that the empirical evaluation is not sufficiently rigorous:
label: asp_substance

sentence: 1) Besides an comparison to the work by Lakshminarayanan et. al, I would also like to have seen a comparison to other existing Bayesian neural network approaches such as stochastic gradient Markov-Chain Monte-Carlo methods.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: 2) To provide a better understanding of the paper, it would also be interesting to see how sensitive it is with respect to the ensemble size M.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 3) Furthermore, for the experiments only one neural network architecture was considered and it remains an open question, how the presented results translate to other architectures.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The same holds for the type of data, since the paper only shows results for image classification benchmarks.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 4) Figure 3: Are the results averaged over multiple independent runs? If so, how many runs did you perform and could you also report confidence intervals? Since all methods are close to each other, it is hard to estimate how significant the difference is.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: [1] Simple and Scalable Predictive Uncertainty Estimation using Deep Ensembles
label: none

sentence: Balaji Lakshminarayanan, Alexander Pritzel, Charles Blundel
label: none

sentence: NIPS 2017
label: none

sentence: [2] Gao Huang and Yixuan Li and Geoff Pleiss and Zhuang Liu and John E. Hopcroft and Kilian Q. Weinberger
label: none

sentence: Snapshot Ensembles: Train 1, get {M} for free}
label: none

sentence: ICLR 2017
label: none

sentence: [3] Bayesian Optimization with Robust Bayesian Neural Networks
label: none

sentence: J. Springenberg and A. Klein and S.Falkner and F. Hutter
label: none

sentence: NIPS 2016
label: none

sentence: [4] J. Snoek and O. Rippel and K. Swersky and R. Kiros and N. Satish and N. Sundaram and M. Patwary and Prabhat and R. Adams
label: none

sentence: Scalable Bayesian Optimization Using Deep Neural Networks
label: none

sentence: ICML 2015
label: none

sentence: [5] Deep Bayesian Bandits Showdown: An Empirical Comparison of Bayesian Deep Networks for Thompson Sampling
label: none

sentence: Carlos Riquelme, George Tucker, Jasper Snoek
label: none

sentence: ICLR 2018
label: none

sentence: The main contributions of this work are essentially on the theoretical aspects.
label: none

sentence: It seems that the proposed algorithm is not very original because its two parts, namely prediction (coefficient estimation) and learning (dictionary update) have been widely used in the literature, using respectively a IHT and a gradient descent.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The authors need to describe in detail the algorithmic novelty of their work.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The definition of “recovering true factor exactly” need to be given.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The proposed algorithm involves several tuning parameters, when alternating between two updating rules, an IHT-based update for coefficients and a gradient descent-based update for the dictionary.
label: none

sentence: Therefore, an appropriate choice of their values need to be given.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: In the algorithm, the authors need to define the HT function in (3) and (4).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In the experiments, the authors compare the proposed method to only the one proposed by Arora et al. 2015.
label: none

sentence: We think that this is not enough, and more extensive experimental results would provide a better paper.
label: asp_substance

sentence: There are some typos that can be easily found, such as “of the out algorithm”.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The paper devises a pipeline that aims to address catastrophic forgetting in continual learning (CL) by the well-known generative replay (GR) technique.
label: none

sentence: The key ingredient of the pipeline is a modern variational auto-encoder (VAE) that is trained with class labels with respect to a mutual information maximization criterion.
label: none

sentence: The paper does not follow a smooth story line, where an open research question is presented and a solution to this problem is developed in steps.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The flowchart in Fig 1 is rather a system design consisting of many components, the functionality of which is not clearly described and existence of which is not justified.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This complex flowchart does not even describe the complete task.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It is in the end plugged into a continual learning algorithm which also performs domain transformation.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: All of these pieces are very well-known methods (e.g. VAEs, conditional VAEs, CL, catastrophic forgetting, domain transformation) in the literature and this paper puts them together in a straightforward way.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Hence, I kindly do not think the outcome is truly a research result.
label: asp_originality

sentence: It is more system engineering than science.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The next submission of the paper could choose one or few of these pieces as target research problems and develop a thoroughly analyzed novel technical solution for them.
label: asp_substance
