sentence: If this solution can be proven to improve a valuable metric (e.g. accuracy, interpretability, theoretical understanding, or computational efficiency) of a setup, it is then worthwhile being published.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Minor: The abstract could be improved by providing more clear pointers to the presented novelty.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: The authors propose using non-Euclidean spaces for GCNs.
label: none

sentence: This is inspired by the recent work into non-Euclidean, and especially hyperbolic, embeddings.
label: none

sentence: A few papers have recently tried to go past embeddings into building non-Euclidean models, requiring the lifting of standard operations in Euclidean space to non-Euclidean settings.
label: none

sentence: This has been done in particular in hyperbolic space, but some datasets benefit from more complex spaces.
label: none

sentence: The authors combine the mixed-curvature product formalism that uses products of Euclidean, hyperbolic, and spherical spaces for embeddings, but use these for GCN operations.
label: none

sentence: Doing this requires, in particular, developing a reasonable way to perform these operations in spherical space (since Euclidean is trivial and hyperbolic has been recently worked on).
label: none

sentence: The authors do a nice lifting via complex operations, and both the hyperbolic and spherical spaces can devolve into the flat Euclidean space when their curvature goes to 0.
label: none

sentence: The authors implement these GCNs, train the curvatures, and demonstrate performance improvements over Euclidean only versions on node classification on benchmark datasets.
label: none

sentence: They also give a fairly nice introduction to all of these ideas in an extended appendix.
label: none

sentence: Strengths, Weaknesses, Recommendation:
label: none

sentence: This paper is reasonably interesting---it joins an effort to produce non-Euclidean models in a tractable way, which is fairly challenging, but could have a good impact.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: On the plus side, it's great that the authors added the nice development for the spherical operations, since that will come in handy for many models.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The experiments are also good.
label: asp_substance

sentence: On the downside, everything here is an extension of existing work, and the body of the paper is hard to read (though this may be inevitable, there's a lot of background to go over here).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Overall I recommend accepting it; I think it's a solid contribution.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Comments:
label: none

sentence: - I don't understand why the authors say that their space "interpolates smoothly" just because the limit in the curvature is the same from the left and right side.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: For example, the absolute value function has the same limit from the left and the right at 0, but it's not differentiable there. Is it actually true that if we take the derivatives of the piecewise hyperbolic/spherical distance function that it's differentiable at c=0?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - There are a couple of recent papers that also consider hyperbolic GCNs, and in fact use  similar ideas for the aggregation and update steps (i.e., same lift to hyperbolic space).
label: none

sentence: However, these were recently NeurIPS papers, and the text is not yet out, so I don't think this should affect the authors' independent work (and also the product part is new).
label: none

sentence: I do recommend that the authors compare against those results in a future update of this work.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The papers are "Hyperbolic Graph Convolutional Neural Networks" by Chami et al and Hyperbolic Graph Neural Networks by Liu et al.
label: none

sentence: - One thing that I didn't see discussed by the authors is that there are subtle difference between hyperbolic and spherical spaces.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: For example, the weighted midpoint of Def. 3.2 doesn't immediately extend to spherical space (or at least won't be unique).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: As an example, consider S^2 and the mean of two antipodal points on it---there's many choices for the midpoint.
label: none

sentence: You probably have to limit the operation to a half-sphere (there's some ideas for this in Gu et al).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - For the synthetic tree, why is the number of edges 2(|V|-1) rather than |V|-1?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - Are the curvatures the same for each layer for the GCNs?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This is an interesting point to discuss (some of the NeurIPS papers I mentioned train the curvature for each layer).
label: asp_substance

sentence: Also, how do you select the number of factors of each type?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - Minor, but some of these citations can be updated.
label: none

sentence: The "De Sa" et al 2018 arxiv citation is really Sala et al and is an ICML '18 paper.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Similarly, Gulcehre et al is a 2019 ICLR paper, and so on. It's always good to get these right.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - Is there any actual empirical importance from recovering the Euclidean case exactly for 0 curvature?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The reason I ask is that my experience is that the hyperboloid is typically easier to work
label: none

sentence: with
label: none

sentence: - One useful thing to point out in B.3.3 is that in general, it need not be a diffeomorphism for all of M for any manifold, which leads to non-uniqueness.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In differential geometry, the "cut locus" is the region beyond which there is this non-uniqueness.
label: none

sentence: - In the appendix, the statement "Sarkar (2011) show that a similar statement as in Theorem 2 holds for a very general class of trees" is confusing to me. The "general class", as far as I know, is actually *all* trees, weighted or unweighted.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This work extends Schlichtkrull et al. (2018) by adding attention in two distinct ways: attention between pairs of nodes per relation, and attention between pairs of nodes averaged over all relations.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The paper is well written and the equations easy to follow.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The results are not strong. And, unfortunately, the model contribution currently is too modest.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Inductive task results: Wu et al. (2018) reports that for Tox21 (Duvenauld et al. 2015) is the best-performing approach.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: We should see the performance on other datasets  (e.g., some of the other datasets in Wu et al. (2018)).
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: My introduction suggestion: do not talk about Convolutional neural networks (CNNs). There is a *lot* of work on graph convolutional networks (GCNs).
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Reading it feels like reading about lattices when the work is about general graphs, and lattices provide no intuition about the proposed solution.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: --- After rebuttal ---
label: none

sentence: Still not convinced of the value of the work to the community. Will keep my score the same.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Description
label: none

sentence: The work is motivated by the empirical performance of Batch Normalization and in particular the observed better robustness of the choice of the learning rate.
label: none

sentence: Authors analyze theoretically the asymptotic convergence rate for objectives involving normalization, not necessarily BN, and show that for scale-invariant groups of parameters (appearing as a result of normalization) the initial learning rate may be set arbitrary while still asymptotic convergence is guaranteed with the same rate as the best known in the general case.
label: none

sentence: Offline gradient descent and stochastic gradient descent cases are considered.
label: none

sentence: * Strengths
label: none

sentence: The work addresses better theoretical understanding of successful heuristics in deep learning, namely batch normalization and other normalizations.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The technical results obtained are non-trivial and detailed proofs are presented.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Also I did not verify the proofs the paper appears technically correct and technically clear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The result may be interpreted in the following form: if one chooses to use BN or other normalization, the paper gives a recommendation that only the learning rate of scale-variant parameters need to be set, which may have some practical advantages.
label: none

sentence: Perhaps more important than the rate of convergence, is the guarantee that the method will not diverge (and will not get stuck in a non-local minimum).
label: none

sentence: * Criticism
label: none

sentence: This paper presents non-trivial theoretical results that are worth to be published but as I argue below its has a weak relevance to practice and the applicability of the obtained results is unclear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: -- Concerns regarding the clarity of presentation and interpretation of the results.
label: none

sentence: The properties of BN used as motivation for the study, are observed non-asymptotically with constant or empirically decreased learning rate schedules for a limited number of iterations.
label: none

sentence: In contrast, the studied learning rates are asymptotic and there is a big discrepancy.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: SGD is observed to be significantly faster than batch gradient when far from convergence (experimental evidence), and
label: none

sentence: this is with or without normalization.
label: none

sentence: In practice, the training is stopped much before convergence, in the hope of finding solutions close to minimum with high probability.
label: none

sentence: There is in fact no experimental evidence that the practical advantages of BN are relevant to the results proven.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It makes a nice story that the theoretical properties justify the observations, but they may be as well completely unrelated.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: As seen from the formal construction, the theoretical results apply equally well to all normalization methods.
label: none

sentence: It occludes the clarity that BN is emphasized amongst them.
label: none

sentence: Considering theoretically, what advantages truly follow from the paper for optimizing a given function? Let’s consider the following cases.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 1. For optimizing a general smooth function with all parameters forming a single scale-invariant vector.
label: none

sentence: In this case, the paper proves that no careful selection of the learning rate is necessary.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This result is beyond machine learning and unfortunately I cannot evaluate its merit.
label: none

sentence: Is it known / not known in optimization?
label: asp_substance

sentence: 2. The case of data-independent normalization (such as weight normalization).
label: none

sentence: Without normalization, we have to tune learning rate to achieve the optimal convergence.
label: none

sentence: With normalization we still have to tune the learning rate (as scale-variant parameters remain or are reintroduced with each invariance to preserve the degrees of freedom), then we have to wait for the phase two of Lemma 3.2 so that the learning rate of scale-invariant parameters adapts, and from then on the optimal convergence rate can be guaranteed.
label: none

sentence: 3. The case of Batch Normalization.
label: none

sentence: Note that there is no direct correspondence between the loss of BN-normalized network (2) and the loss of the original network because of dependence of the normalization on the batches.
label: none

sentence: In other words, there is no setting of parameters of the original network that would make its forward pass equivalent to that of BN network (2) for all batches.
label: none

sentence: The theory tells the same as in case 2 above but with an additional price of optimizing a different function.
label: arg_other

sentence: These points remain me puzzled regarding either practical or theoretical application of the result. It would be great if authors could elaborate.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: -- Difference from Wu et al. 2018
label: none

sentence: This works is cited as a source of inspiration in several places in the paper.
label: none

sentence: As the submission is a theoretical result with no immediate applicability, it would be very helpful if the authors could detail the technical improvements over this related work.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Note, ICLR policy says that arxiv preprints earlier than one month before submission are considered a prior art. Could the authors elaborate more on possible practical/theoretical applications?
label: asp_substance

sentence: * Side Notes (not affecting the review recommendation)
label: none

sentence: I believe that the claim that “BN reduces covariate shift” (actively discussed in the intro) was an imprecise statement in the original work.
label: none

sentence: Instead, BN should be able to quickly adapt to the covariate shift when it occurs.
label: none

sentence: It achieves this by using the parameterization in which the mean and variance statistics of neurons (the quantities whose change is called the covariate shift) depend on variables that are local to the layer (gamma, beta in (1)) rather than on the cumulative effect of all of the preceding layers.
label: none

sentence: * Revision
label: none

sentence: I took into account the discussion and the newly added experiments and increased the score.
label: none

sentence: The experiments verify the proven effect and make the paper more substantial.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Some additional comments about experiments follow.
label: none

sentence: Training loss plots would be more clear in the log scale.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Comparison to "SGD BN removed" is not fair because the initialization is different (application of BN re-initializes weight scales and biases).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The same initialization can be achieved by performing one training pass with BN with 0 learning rate and then removing it, see e.g. Gitman, I. and Ginsburg, B. (2017).
label: none

sentence: Comparison of batch normalization and weight normalization algorithms for the large-scale image classification.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The use of Glorot uniform initializer is somewhat subtle.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Since BN is used, Glorot initialization has no effect for a forward pass.
label: none

sentence: However, it affects the gradient norm.
label: none

sentence: Is there a rationale in this setting or it is just a more tricky method to fix the weight norm to some constant, e.g. ||w||=1?
label: asp_substance

sentence: In this paper the authors introduce a new technique for softmax inference.
label: none

sentence: In a multiclass setting, the idea is to take the output of a NN and turn it into a gating function to choose one expert.
label: none

sentence: Then, given the expert, output a particular category.
label: none

sentence: The first level of sparsity comes from the first expert.
label: none

sentence: The second level of sparsity comes from every expert only outputting a limited set of output categories.
label: none

sentence: The paper is easy to understand but several sections (starting from section 2) could use an english language review (e.g. "search right" -> "search for the right", "predict next word" -> "predict the next word", ...) In section 3, can you be more specific about the gains in training versus inference time?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I believe the results all relate to inference but it would be good to get an overview of the impact of training time as well.
label: asp_substance

sentence: You motivate some of the work by the fact that the experts have overlapping outputs.
label: none

sentence: Maybe in section 3.7 you can address how often that occurs as well?
label: asp_substance

sentence: Nits:
label: none

sentence: - it wasn't clear how the sparsity percentage on page 3 was defined?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: - can you motivate why you are not using perplexity in section 3.2?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In this paper, the authors focus on alleviating the catastrophic forgetting problem in continual learning.
label: none

sentence: The authors propose a discriminative variational autoencoder (DiVA) to solve this problem under the generative replay framework.
label: none

sentence: DiVA modifies the objective function of VAE by introducing an additional term that maximizes the mutual information between the latent variables and the class labels.
label: none

sentence: The authors do not thoroughly explain the motivation of this paper.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The authors do not explicitly define continual learning, incremental learning, and catastrophic forgetting problem.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It is also not clear to me why these problems are important.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The idea that introduces labels in VAE is not novel.
label: asp_originality

sentence: For example, Narayanaswamy et al. [1] also propose to utilize labels to VAE.
label: asp_originality

sentence: I do not understand why making use of labels is important for solving the catastrophic forgetting problem and how the labels are useful in the generative replay process.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: It is also not clear to me how domain translation is relevant to continual learning.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: In terms of modeling, since the input into the prior network has finite possible discrete values, we do not need a fully connected network to generate $\hat{\mu}_c$ and $\hat{\sigma}_c$. Instead, we can directly optimize $\hat{\mu}_c$ and $\hat{\sigma}_c$ for each $c$ as parameters.
label: arg_other

sentence: The paper provides some good experimental results.
label: asp_substance

sentence: But the problem settings are not clear to me.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I do not understand how the model is trained to solve multiple tasks.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Do the same model is trained for multiple tasks? Is each of the tasks trained sequentially or simultaneously?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: It is also not clear to me why CIFAR datasets involve two domains and how these domains are relevant in each of the tasks.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: In summary, since DiVA gives a good experimental performance, the proposed method might be promising.
label: asp_substance

sentence: However, it looks to me that the authors need to better explain the motivation of DiVA, the differences of DiVA from existing supervised VAE, and the experimental settings, before the acceptance of this paper.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: References
label: none

sentence: [1]Narayanaswamy, Siddharth, T. Brooks Paige, Jan-Willem Van de Meent, Alban Desmaison, Noah Goodman, Pushmeet Kohli, Frank Wood, and Philip Torr. "Learning disentangled representations with semi-supervised deep generative models." In Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems, pp. 5925-5935. 2017.
label: none

sentence: In this paper, the authors presented a large experimental study of curiosity-driven reinforcement learning on various tasks.
label: none

sentence: In the experimental studies, the authors also compared several feature space embedding methods, including identical mapping (pixels), random embedding, variational autoencoders and inverse dynamics features.
label: none

sentence: The authors found that in many of the tasks, learning based on intrinsic rewards could generate good performance on extrinsic rewards, when the intrinsic rewards and extrinsic rewards are correlated.
label: none

sentence: The authors also found that random features embedding, somewhat surprisingly, performs well in the tasks.
label: none

sentence: Overall, the paper is well written with clarity.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Experimental setup is easy to understand.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors provided code, which could help other researchers reproduce their result.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Weaknesses:
label: none

sentence: 1) as an experimental study, it would be valuable to compare the performance of curiosity-based learning versus learning based on well-defined extrinsic rewards.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The author is correct that in many tasks, well-behaved extrinsic rewards are hard to find.
label: none

sentence: But for problems with well-defined extrinsic rewards, such a comparison could help readers understand the relative performance of curiosity-based learning and/or how much headroom there exists to improve the current methods.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: 2) it is surprising that random features perform so well in the experiments.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The authors did provide literature in classification that had similar findings, but it would be beneficial for the authors to explore reasons that random features perform well in reinforcement learning.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This paper proposed a new pooling method (Frequency pooling) which is strict shift equivalent and anti-aliasing in theory.
label: none

sentence: The authors first derived the theory of F-pooling to be optimal anti-aliasing down sampling and is shift-equivalent in sec 2, and then demonstrated the experimental results of 1D signals and image classification tasks.
label: none

sentence: The experimental results are actually less impressive than what are claimed in contribution and conclusion.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors stated that "F-pooling remarkably increases accuracy and robustness w.r.t. shifts of moderns CNNs"; however, in Table 1-3, the winning margin of accuracy is actually quite small (<2%), and the consistency (<3.5% compared to the second best baseline except resnet-18 on CIFAR 100 has large improvement ~7-8%).
label: asp_substance

sentence: Questions:
label: none

sentence: 1. For the experiment of 1D signal on sine wave, the AA-pooling and F-pooling give the same result?
label: none

sentence: 2. Compared to AA-pooling, it seems that F-pooling has a better theoretical guarantee (i.e. the optimal anti-aliasing down sampling operation given U).
label: asp_substance

sentence: But other than this, the empirical performance seem not showing particular advantage over AA-pooling.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Are there any other advantages for F-pooling s.t. people might want to use it as opposed to AA-pooling?
label: asp_substance

sentence: 3. What are the limitations of the F-pooling? It is good to me that the authors discuss one limitation on the imaginary part of output and I would like to hear more on other potential limitations for this method.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - also, if the authors can explain more on sec 2.5 it will be helpful. If we simply ignore the imaginary part, although the theory is not applicable, but what would the empirical performance be?
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper presents a new way to represent a dense matrix in a compact format.
label: none

sentence: First, the method prunes a dense matrix based on the Viterbi-based pruning.
label: none

sentence: Then, the pruned matrix is quantized with alternating multi-bit quantization.
label: none

sentence: Finally, the binary vectors produced by the quantization algorithm are further compressed with the Viterbi-based algorithm.
label: none

sentence: It spots the problem of each existing approach and solve the problems by combining each method.
label: none

sentence: The combination is new and the result is encouraging.
label: asp_originality

sentence: I find this paper is interesting and I like the strong results.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It is an interesting combination of methods.
label: asp_substance

sentence: However, the experiments are not enough to show that the proposed method is really needed to achieve the results. If these are answered well, I'd be happy to change my evaluation.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 1. The method should be compared with other combinations of components.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: At least, it should be compared with "Multi-bit quantization only (Xu et al., 2018)" and "Multi-bit-quantization + Viterbi-based binary code encoding".
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: 2. The experiments with "Don't Care" should go to the experiment section, and the end-to-end results should be present but not the ratio of incorrect bits.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 3. Similarly, the paper will become stronger if it has some experimental results that compare quantization methods.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: In Section 3.3.
label: none

sentence: , it mentions that the conventional k-bit quantization was tried and significant accuracy drops were observed.
label: none

sentence: I feel that this is a kind of things which support the proposed method if it is properly assessed.
label: none

sentence: 4. When you say "slow" form something and propose a method to address it, I'd like to see some benchmark numbers. There is an experiment with simulation, but that does not seem to simulate the slow "sequential sparse matrix decoding process".
label: none

sentence: Minor comments:
label: none

sentence: * It was a bit hard to understand how a matrix is processed through the flowchart in Fig. 1 at first glance.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It would help readers to understand it better if it has a corresponding figure which shows how a matrix is processed through the flowchart.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This paper proposes meta dropout, which leverages adaptive dropout training for regularizing gradient based meta learning models, e.g., MAML and MetaSGD.
label: none

sentence: Experiments on few shot learning show that meta dropout achieves better performance.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Overally, I think this paper is well motivated and experiments on few shot learning are impressive.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: I have only two major concerns.
label: none

sentence: 1. Sec 3.2. According to my understanding, Meta dropout introduces a learnable prior for latent $z$, but the training objective does not require posterior inference and thus no variational inference is needed.
label: none

sentence: I think it is ok to say that meta dropout tries to optimize a lower bound of log p(Y|X;\theta,\phi^*), but meta dropout does not regularize the variational framework because there is no variational inference framework.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Experiments on adversarial robustness can be further improved.
label: asp_substance

sentence: (1) the settings and the analysis of adversarial robustness experiment can be discussed in details.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For example, how to build ''adversarial learning baseline'' in meta learning settings and why the result implies the perturbation directions for generalization and robustness relates to each other; (2) how other regularization methods (e.g., Mixup, VIB and Information dropout) perform on adversarial robustness? Does Meta dropout performs better than them?
label: asp_substance

sentence: (3) FGSM is a quite weak adversarial attack method, which makes evaluating adversarial robustness on FGSM may be misleading.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I suggest trying some other STOA attack methods (e.g., iterative methods).
label: asp_substance

sentence: Some typos:
label: none

sentence: Page 3, Regularization methods, 3rd line, ````wwwdiscuss
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Page 7, 2nd line from the bottom, FSGM->FGSM
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I read the other reviewers' comments as well as the rebuttal.
label: none

sentence: I think that the other reviewers make a number of valid points, especially with regards to the theoretical analysis of the paper.
label: none

sentence: Therefore, I do not feel confident in championing this paper.
label: none

sentence: PS: I am downgrading my confidence in my evaluation.
label: none

sentence: Paper 93 proposes an empirical evaluation of the memorization properties of convnets.
label: none

sentence: More specifically, it evaluates three aspects:
label: none

sentence: First it evaluates whether convnets can learn to distinguish images from two different sets by training a binary classifier.
label: none

sentence: The conclusion is that, indeed, deep convnets can learn to make such a decision. As could be guessed from intuition, the larger the capacity of the network and the smaller the size of the sets, the higher the accuracy.
label: none

sentence: Second, it evaluates whether we can detect that a group of samples of a dataset was used to train a model.
label: none

sentence: For this purpose, it is proposed to compute the distribution of maximal activation scores of the output softmax layer and to make use of the Kolmogorov-Smirov distance between the cumulative distributions.
label: none

sentence: It is shown experimentally that one can detect (even partial) leakage with such a technique.
label: none

sentence: Third, it evaluates whether we can detect that a single images was used to train a convnet.
label: none

sentence: Two simple techniques are proposed.
label: none

sentence: The first one considers that a sample is part of the training set if it correctly classified.
label: none

sentence: The second one considers that a sample is part of the training set if its loss is below a threshold.
label: none

sentence: It is shown experimentally that one can make such a decision with moderate accuracy.
label: none

sentence: On the positive side:
label: none

sentence: -	This is a topic that should be of broad interest to the ICLR community.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: -	The paper is generally well-written.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: -	The experiments are reported on large-scale datasets on high-capacity networks which is more realistic than small-scale settings.
label: asp_substance

sentence: On the negative side:
label: none

sentence: It is unclear whether the data augmentation techniques is applied only at training time or also at test time.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: In other words: at test time, do you present the original images only or transformed images too?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: -	In section 4, it is unclear why only the maximal activation of the softmax layer is used to characterize a sample? Why not considering the full distribution that should contain richer information? Why just focusing on the output layer and why not using the info available at intermediate layers?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: -	Section 5 is somewhat less clear than the previous sections.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors should more clearly define what the private, public and evaluation sets are, right from the beginning.
label: none

sentence: The purpose of the public set is explained only in section 5.2.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: -	The experimental results of section 5.2 are somewhat disappointing.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Even with no data augmentation, and even with the original networks, membership can only be assessed with a 90% accuracy.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Results are much lower in less favorable cases, sometimes close to random (see last line of Table 3).
label: asp_substance

sentence: This seems to be too low to be of practical use.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This might be because the Bayes and MAT attacks are too simplistic.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Again, why not using the distribution of the outputs of all layers? Why focusing only on the output of the last layer?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The authors argue that not knowing the distribution of rewards observed in the policy gradient algorithm hinders learning (and the tuning process).
label: none

sentence: They propose to replace the reward term in the policy gradient algorithm with its centered empirical cumulative distribution, which has a fixed and known U[-1, 1] distribution.
label: none

sentence: They test their methods on a toy task that consists in finding inclusion maximal cliques (which tests for local optimality) against REINFORCE (including their variants: centering the rewards with a mean baseline or normalizing them), the cross-entropy method and Exp3.
label: none

sentence: I think that the current draft lacks strong experimental results to properly demonstrate the usefulness of the method.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The method is only evaluated on a single task and many confounding variables (the design of the reward function, factorizing the parametric distribution into marginals, reporting results for a single (non-tuned?) learning rate, etc.) make evaluation difficult.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The usefulness of the approach is also lessened by the greater importance of the choice of the optimizer.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I would like the method to be applied on other domains such as continuous non-convex optimization and reinforcement learning.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Additionally, I find the motivation for caring about local optimality unconvincing.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I take exception that people care more about local optimality than the actual objective.
label: none

sentence: From a practical point of view, local optimality is a mean (that can be achieved via heuristic algorithms) to an end (the objective itself).
label: none

sentence: This also holds for k-means, which is usually run multiple times with different starting conditions.
label: none

sentence: Some comments:
label: none

sentence: - Table 3 is a bit confusing as-is (lower is only better when controlling on the quality of the best sample.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: e.g: REINFORCE has lower best-sample to total-sample ratio but its solutions are worse)
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - It isn't clear from the tables that OCE_0.1 outperforms REINFORCE_Z (as is mentioned in the discussion).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - The paper should refer to 1) the reward shaping literature, 2) the growing line of works concerned with control variates for REINFORCE (such as VIMCO, MuProp, REBAR) and 3) the growing line of works concerned about combinatorial optimization with reinforcement learning (Neural Combinatorial Optimization with Reinforcement Learning, etc.)
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: - I would also encourage the authors to come up with a more descriptive name for the approach.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: * Strengths:
label: none

sentence: - The paper gives theoretical insight into why Batch Normalization is useful in making neural network training more robust and is therefore an important contribution to the literature.
label: none

sentence: - While the actual arguments are somewhat technical as is expected from such a paper, the motivation and general strategy is very easy to follow and insightful.
label: asp_substance

sentence: * Weaknesses:
label: none

sentence: - The bounds do not immediately apply in the batch normalization setting as used by neural network practitioners, however there are practical ways to link the two settings as pointed out in section 2.4
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - As the authors point out, the idea of using a batch-normalization like strategy to set an adaptive learning rate has already been explored in the WNGrad paper.
label: none

sentence: However it is valuable to have a similar analysis closer to the batch normalization setting used by most practitioners.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: - Currently there is no experimental evaluation of the claims, which would be valuable given that the setting doesn't immediately apply in the normal batch normalization setting.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I would like to see evidence that the main benefit from batch normalization indeed comes from picking a good adaptive learning rate.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Overall I recommend publishing the paper as it is a well-written and insightful discussion of batch normalization. Be aware that I read the paper and wrote this review on short notice, so I didn't have time to go through all the arguments in detail.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The paper introduces a generative model for video prediction.
label: none

sentence: The originality stems from a new training criterion which combines a VAE and a GAN criteria.
label: none

sentence: At training time, the GAN and the VAE are trained simultaneously with a shared generator; at test time, prediction conditioned on initial frames is performed by sampling from a latent distribution and generating the next frames via an enhanced conv LST .
label: none

sentence: Evaluations are performed on two movement video datasets classically used for benchmarking  this task - several quantitative evaluation criteria are considered.
label: none

sentence: The paper clearly states the objective and provides a nice general description of the method.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The proposed model extends previous work by adding an adversarial loss to a VAE video prediction model.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The evaluation compares different variants of this model to two recent VAE baselines.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: A special emphasis is put on the quantitative evaluation: several criteria are introduced for characterizing different properties of the models with a focus on diversity.
label: asp_substance

sentence: w.r.t. the baselines, the model behaves well for the “realistic” and “diversity” measures.
label: none

sentence: The results are more mitigated for measures of accuracy.
label: none

sentence: As for the qualitative evaluation, the model corrects the blurring effect of the reference SV2P baseline, and produces quite realistic predictions on these datasets.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The difference with the other reference model (SVG) is less clear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: While the general description of the model is clear, details are lacking.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It would probably help to position the VAE component more precisely w.r.t. one of the two baselines, by indicating the differences.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: This would also help to explain the difference of performance/ behavior  w.r.t. these models (Fig. 5).
label: none

sentence: It seems that the discriminator takes a whole sequence as input, but some precision on how this done could be added.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Similarly, you did not indicate what the deterministic version of your model is.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The generator model with its warping component makes a strong hypothesis on the nature of the videos: it seems especially well suited for translations or for other simple geometric transformations characteristics of the benchmarking videos .
label: asp_substance

sentence: Could you comment on the importance of this component? Did you test the model on other types of videos where this hypothesis is less relevant?
label: asp_substance

sentence: It seems that the baseline SVG makes use of simpler ConLSTM for example.
label: none

sentence: The description of the generator in the appendix is difficult to follow.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I missed the point in the following sentence: “For each one-step prediction, the network has the freedom to choose to copy pixels from the previous frame, used transformed versions of the previous frame, or to synthesize pixels from scratch” .
label: none

sentence: Also, it is not clear from the discussion on z, whether sampling is performed once for each video of for each frame.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Overall, the paper proposes an extension of VAE based video prediction models and produces an extensive evaluation.
label: none

sentence: While the model seems to perform well, the originality and the improvement w.r.t. baselines are somewhat limited.
label: asp_originality

sentence: This paper presents  a controllable model from a video of a person performing a certain
label: none

sentence: activity. It generates novel image sequences of that person, according
label: none

sentence: to user-defined control signals, typically marking the displacement of the moving
label: none

sentence: body. The generated video can have an arbitrary background, and effectively
label: none

sentence: capture both the dynamics and appearance of the person.
label: none

sentence: It has two networks, Pose2Pose, and Pose2Frame.
label: none

sentence: The overall pipeline makes sense; and the paper is well written.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The main problems come from the experiments, which I would ask for more things.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It has two components, i.e., Pose2Pose and Pose2Frame.
label: none

sentence: So how importance of each component to the whole framework? I would ask for the ablation study/additional experiments of using each component.
label: asp_substance

sentence: How about combining only Pose2Pose/ Pose2Frame  with pix2pixHD? Whether the performance can get improved?
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper first provides a generalization bounds for adversarial training, showing that the error bound depends on Lipschitz constant.
label: none

sentence: This motivates the use of spectral regularization (similar to Miyato et al 2018) in adversarial training.
label: none

sentence: Using spectral regularization to improve robustness is not new, but it's interesting to combine spectral regularization and adversarial training.
label: none

sentence: Experimental results show significant improvement over vanilla adversarial training.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The paper is nicely written and the experimental results are quite strong and comprehensive. I really like the paper but I have two questions about the results:
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 1. The numbers reported in Figure 5 do not match with the performance of adversarial training in previous paper.
label: none

sentence: In PGM L_inf adversarial training/attack (column 3 of Figure 5), the prediction accuracy is roughly 50% under 0.1 infinity norm perturbation.
label: none

sentence: However, previous papers (e.g., "Obfuscated Gradients Give a False Sense of Security") reported 55% accuracy under 0.031 infinity norm perturbation.
label: none

sentence: I wonder why the numbers are so different.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Maybe it's because of different scales? Previous works usually scale each pixel to [0,1] or [-1,1], maybe the authors use the [0, 255] scale? But 0.1/255 will be much smaller than 0.031.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Another factor might be the model structure. If Alexnet has much lower accuracy, it's probably worthwhile to conduct experiments on the same structure with previous works (Madry et al and Athalye et al) to make the conclusion more clear.
label: none

sentence: 2. What's the training time of the proposed method compared with vanilla adversarial training?
label: asp_substance

sentence: 3. The idea of using SN to improve robustness has been introduced in the following paper:
label: none

sentence: "Lipschitz-Margin Training: Scalable Certification of Perturbation Invariance for Deep Neural Networks"
label: none

sentence: (but this paper did not combine it with adv training).
label: none

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: This paper is built on the top of DNC model.
label: none

sentence: Authors observe a list of issues with the DNC model: issues with deallocation scheme, issues with the blurring of forward and backward addressing, and issues in content-based addressing.
label: none

sentence: Authors propose changes in the network architecture to solve all these three issues.
label: none

sentence: With toy experiments, authors demonstrate the usefulness of the proposed modifications to DNC.
label: none

sentence: The improvements are also seen in more realistic bAbI tasks.
label: none

sentence: Major Comments:
label: none

sentence: The paper is well written and easy to follow.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The proposed improvements seem to result in very clear improvements.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The proposed improvements also improve the convergence of the model.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I do not have any major concerns about the paper.
label: none

sentence: I think that contributions of the paper are good enough to accept the paper.
label: none

sentence: I also appreciate that the authors have submitted the code to reproduce the results.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: I am curious to know if authors observe similar convergence gains in bAbI tasks as well. Can you please provide the mean learning curve for bAbI task for DNC vs proposed modifications?
label: asp_substance

sentence: Summary
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes a meta-learning framework that leverages unlabeled data by learning the graph-based label propogation in an end-to-end manner.
label: none

sentence: The proposed approaches are evaluated on two few-shot datasets and achieves the state-of-the-art results.
label: none

sentence: Pros.
label: none

sentence: -This paper is well-motivated.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Studying label propagation in the meta-learning setting is interesting and novel.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Intuitively, transductive label propagation should improve supervised learning when the number of labeled instances is low.
label: none

sentence: -The empirical results show improvement over the baselines, which are expected.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Cons.
label: none

sentence: -Some technical details  are missing.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In Section 3.2.2, the authors only explain how they learn example-based \sigma, but details on how to make graph construction end-to-end trainable are missing.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Constructing the full weight matrix requires the whole dataset as input and selecting k-nearest neighbor is a non-differentiable operation. Can you give more explanations?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: -Does episode training help label propagation? How about the results of label propagation without the episode training?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: [Summary]:
label: none

sentence: This paper tackles the problem of automatic robot design.
label: none

sentence: The most popular approach to doing this has been evolutionary methods which work by evolving morphology of agents in a feed-forward manner using a propagation and mutation rules.
label: none

sentence: This is a non-differentiable process and relies on maintaining a large pool of candidates out of which best ones are chosen with the highest fitness.
label: none

sentence: In robot design for a given task using rewards, training each robot design using RL with rewards is an expensive process and not scalable.
label: none

sentence: This paper uses graph network to train each morphology using RL.
label: none

sentence: Thereby, allowing the controller to share parameters and reuse information across generations.
label: none

sentence: This expedites the score function evaluation improving the time complexity of the evolutionary process.
label: none

sentence: [Strengths]:
label: none

sentence: This paper shows some promise when graph network-based controllers augmented with evolutionary algorithms.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Paper is quite easy to follow.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: [Weaknesses and Clarifications]:
label: none

sentence: => Robot design area has been explored extensively in classical work of Sims (1994) etc. using ES.
label: none

sentence: Given that, the novelty of the paper is fairly incremental as it uses NerveNet to evaluate fitness and ES for the main design search.
label: asp_originality

sentence: => Environment: The experimental section of the paper can be further improved.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The approach is evaluated only in three cases: fish, walker, cheetah. Can it be applied to more complex morphologies? Humanoid etc. maybe?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: => Baselines: The comparison provided in the paper is weak.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: At first, it compares to random graph search and ES.
label: none

sentence: But there are better baselines possible.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: One such example would be to have a network for each body part and share parameters across each body part.
label: none

sentence: This network takes some identifying information (ID, shape etc.) about body part as input.
label: none

sentence: As more body parts are added, more such network modules can be added.
label: none

sentence: How would the given graph network compare to this?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This baseline can be thought of a shared parameter graph with no message passing.
label: none

sentence: => The results shown in Figure-4 (Section-4.2) seems unclear to me.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: As far as I understand, the model starts with hand-engineered design and then finetuned using evolutionary process.
label: none

sentence: However, the original performance of the hand-engineered design is surprisingly bad (see first data point in any plot in Figure-4).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Does the controller also start from scratch? If so, why? Also, it is not clear what is the meaning of generations if the graph is fixed, can't it be learned altogether at once?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: [Recommendation]:
label: none

sentence: I request the authors to address the comments raised above.
label: none

sentence: Overall, this is a reasonable paper but experimental section needs much more attention.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In this paper, the authors propose a method for dimensionality reduction of image data.
label: none

sentence: They provide a structured and deterministic function G that maps a set of parameters C to an image X = G(C).
label: none

sentence: The number of parameters C is smaller than the number of free parameters in the image X, so this results in a predictive model that can be used for compression, denoising, inpainting, superresolution and other inverse problems.
label: none

sentence: The structure of G is as follows: starting with a small fixed, multichannel white noise image, linearly mix the channels, truncate the negative values to zero and upsample.
label: none

sentence: This process is repeated multiple times and finally the output is squashed through a sigmoid function for the output to remain in the 0..1 range.
label: none

sentence: This approach makes sense and the model is indeed more principled than the one taken by Ulyanov et al. In fact, the DIP of Ulyanov et al. can hardly be considered "a model" (or a prior, for that matter), and instead should be considered "an algorithm", since it relies on the early stopping of a specific optimization algorithm.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This means that we are not interested in the minimum of the cost function associated to the model, which contradicts the very concept of "cost function".
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: If only global optimizers were available, DIP wouldn't work, showing its value is in the interplay of the "cost" function and a specific optimization algorithm.
label: none

sentence: None of these problems exist with the presented approach.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The exposition is clear and the presented inverse problems as well as demonstrated performance are sufficient.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: One thing that I missed while reading the paper is more comment on negative results.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Did the authors tried any version of their model with convolutions or pooling and found it not to perform as well? Measuring the number of parameters when including pooling or convolutions can become tricky, was that part of the reason?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Minor:
label: none

sentence: "Regularizing by stopping early for regularization,"
label: asp_substance

sentence: In this paper "large compression ratios" means little compression, which I found confusing.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This paper tackles the question generation problem from a logical form and proposes an addition called Scratchpad Encoder to the standard seq2seq framework.
label: none

sentence: The new model has been tested on the WebQuestionsSP and the WikiSQL datasets, with both automatic and human evaluation, compared to the baselines with copy and coverage mechanisms.
label: none

sentence: Major points:
label: none

sentence: Overall, I think this paper is not good enough for an ICLR paper and the presentation is confusing in both its contributions and its technical novelty.
label: asp_originality

sentence: I don’t recommend to accept this paper, at least in the current format.
label: none

sentence: The paper states two major contributions (the last paragraph of Introduction), one is the new model Scratchpad Encoder, and the other is “possible to generate a large high quality (SPARQL query, local form) dataset”.
label: none

sentence: For the second contribution, there isn’t any evaluation/justification about the quality of the generated questions and how useful this dataset would be in any KB-QA applications.
label: none

sentence: I believe that this paper is not the first one to study question generation from logical form (cf. Guo et al, 2018 as cited), so it is unclear what is the contribution of this paper in that respect.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: For the modeling contribution, although it shows some improvements on the benchmarks and some nice analysis, the paper really doesn’t explain well the intuition of this “write” operation/Scratchpad (also the improvement of Scratchpad vs coverage is relatively limited). Is this something tailored to question generation? Why does it expect to improve on the question generation or it can improve any tasks which build on top of seq2seq+att framework (e.g., machine translation, summarization -- if some results can be shown on the most competitive benchmarks, that would be much more convincing)?
label: asp_substance

sentence: In general I find Section 3 pretty difficult to follow.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: What does “keeping notes” mean?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It seems that the goal of this model is to keep updating the encoder hidden vectors (h_0, .., h_T) instead of fixing them at the decoder stage.
label: none

sentence: I think it is necessary to make it clearer how s_{post_read} and attn_copy are computed with the updated {h^i_t} and what u^i is expected to encode.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: \alpha^i_t and u^i are also pretty complex and it would be good to conduct some ablation analysis.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Minor points:
label: none

sentence: - tau Yih et al, 2016 --> Yih et al, 2016
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - It is unclear why the results on WikiSQL is presented in Appendix. Combining the results on both datasets in the experiments section would be more convincing.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - Table 1: Not sure why there is only one model that employs beam search (with beam size = 2) among all the comparisons. It looks strange.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper presents a gradient estimator for expectation-based objectives, which is called Go-gradient.
label: none

sentence: This estimator is unbiased, has low variance and, in contrast to other previous approaches, applies to either continuous and discrete random variables.
label: none

sentence: They also extend this estimator to problems where the gradient should be "backpropagated" through a nested combination of random variables and a (non-linear) functions.
label: none

sentence: Authors present an extensive experimental evaluation of the estimator on different challenging machine learning problems.
label: none

sentence: The paper addresses a relevant problem which appears in many machine learning settings, as it is the problem of estimating the gradient of an expectation-based objective.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: In general, the paper is well written and easy to follow. And the experimental evaluation is extensive and compares with relevant state-of-the-art methods.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The main problem with this paper is that it is difficult to identify its main and novel contributions.
label: asp_originality

sentence: 1. In the case of continuous random variables, Go-gradient is equal to Implicit Rep gradients (Figurnov et al. 2018) and pathwise gradients (Jankowiack & Obermeyer,2018).
label: none

sentence: Furthermore, for the Gaussian case, Implicit Rep gradients (and Go-gradient too) are equal to the standard reparametrization trick estimator (Kingma & Welling, 2014).
label: none

sentence: This should be made crystal-clear in the paper.
label: asp_originality

sentence: What happens is that the authors arrive at this solution using a different approach.
label: none

sentence: In this sense, claims about the low-variance of GO-gradient wrt to other reparametrization baed estimators should be removed, as they are the same.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Moreover, I don't think some of the presented experiments are necessary.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Simply because for continuous variables similar experiments have been reported before
label: asp_originality

sentence: (Figurnov et al. 2018, Jankowiack & Obermeyer,2018).
label: none

sentence: 2. It seems that the main novel contribution of the paper is to extend the ideas of (Figurnov et al. 2018, Jankowiack & Obermeyer,2018) to discrete variables. And this is a relevant contribution.
label: asp_originality

sentence: And the experimental evaluations of this part are convincing and compare favourably with other state-of-the-art methods.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 3. Authors should be much more clear about which is their original contribution to the problems stated in Section 4 and Section 5.
label: asp_originality

sentence: As authors acknowledge in Section 6
label: none

sentence: <<Stochastic back-propagation (Rezende et al., 2014; Fan et al., 2015), focusing mainly on re-parameterizable Gaussian random variables and deep latent Gaussian models, exploits the product rule for an integral to derive gradient backpropagation through several continuous random variables.
label: none

sentence: This is exactly what authors do in these sections.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Again it seems that the real contribution of this paper here is to extend this stochastic back-propagation (Rezende et al., 2014; Fan et al., 2015) ideas to discrete variables.
label: none

sentence: Although this extension seems to be easily derived using the contributions made at point 2.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Summarizing, the paper addresses a relevant problem but they do not state which their main contributions are, and reintroduce some ideas previously published in the literature.
label: asp_originality

sentence: This paper builds a new graph convolutional network (GCN) based on hyperbolic representations of the graph nodes: all latent representations of the nodes are points on Poincare disks.
label: none

sentence: The authors adapted the Hyperbolic Neural Networks by Ganea et al. (2018) into the Kipf & Welling's (2016) version of GCN.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, the authors variated the right matrix multiplication in GCN with Ganea et al.'s Mobius matrix-vector multiplication (that can be regarded as a transformation between two Poincare disks).
label: none

sentence: Moreover, as a non-trivial adaptation, the author defined the left matrix multiplication in GCN (that can be regarded as a weighted linear combination of several points on the same Poincare disk) with Ungar's (2010) weighted barycenter, which is from computational geometry but not the machine learning community.
label: none

sentence: The resulting method is tested on a toy problem and semi-supervised node classification of commonly used datasets, showing the possibility of improvement.
label: none

sentence: This is a practical contribution but not a theoretical contribution, as there is no main theorem (or equivalent statements), and the main novelty is on using Ungar's (2010) weighted barycenter to perform neighborhood features aggregations.
label: none

sentence: There are some general discussions on how to adapt gyrovector space theory into spherical spaces.
label: none

sentence: This is interesting but no formal results are presented.
label: none

sentence: I vote for rejection for four major weaknesses explained as follows.
label: arg_other

sentence: (1) The experimental results cannot show the usefulness of the proposed GCN.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The results on real datasets are similar to the regular GCN.
label: asp_substance

sentence: As the authors themselves remarked, "it can be seen that our models sometimes outperform the two Euclidean GCN".
label: none

sentence: The experimental settings, e.g. how the train:test datasets are split, and hyperparameter settings, are not clearly given.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: (2) The method is not well motivated.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The motivation, based on the writing, is that constant curvature spaces are more general where the computation is easy to handle.
label: none

sentence: This is too general and not enough as a motivation.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: After reading, the reviewer cannot understand why the user should bother to use hyperbolic representations that are more complex to compute in GCNs, given that the experimental results are roughly the same.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: (3) A large body of graph neural network literature is omitted.
label: arg_other

sentence: The authors start from a very high-level description of machine learning in constant curvature spaces.
label: none

sentence: Such high-level introductions require more comprehensive literatures to support.
label: arg_other

sentence: In the first mentioning of Graph Neural Networks, the authors only cited Kipf & Welling's GCN.
label: none

sentence: This is misleading.
label: arg_other

sentence: For example, the original GNN, ChebNet, etc. that leads to GCN can be mentioned.
label: arg_other

sentence: The reviewer recommends the authors to read some literature review of the topic of GCN and re-organize the references, and use search engines to have a better view on the state of the art of (hyperbolic) geometric theories and graph convolutional networks.
label: arg_other

sentence: This is a thriving area that requires a careful literature review.
label: arg_other

sentence: (4) The writing quality is not satisfactory.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Here are a few examples: The ICLR citation style needs to use sometimes \citep.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors instead used \cite everywhere, making the paper hard to read.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors are suggested to use unified notations to denote vectors/matrices (e.g. all bold).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The introduction can start at a lower level (such as flat/hyperbolic neural networks).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Section 3.4, as the main technical innovation, can be extended and includes some demonstrations.
label: none

sentence: The authors propose to use the combination of model ensemble and MC dropout in Bayesian deep active learning.
label: none

sentence: They empirically show that there exists the mode collapse problem due to the MC dropout which can be regarded as a variational approximation.
label: none

sentence: The authors introduce an ensemble of MC-Dropout models with different initialization to remedy this mode collapse problem.
label: none

sentence: The paper is clearly written and easy to follow.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It is interesting to empirically show that the mode collapse problem of MC-Dropout is important in active learning.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The major concern I have is that the ensemble of MC-Dropout models is not an approximation of the posterior anymore.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Each MC-Dropout model is an approximation of the posterior, but the ensemble of them may not.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Therefore, it is a little misleading to still call it Bayesian active learning.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Also, the ensemble of MC-Dropout models does not have the theoretic support from the Bayesian perspective.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The motivation for the proposed method is to solve the mode collapse problem of MC-Dropout, but using ensemble loses the Bayesian support benefit of MC-Dropout.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: So it seems not a reasonable solution for the mode collapse problem of MC-Dropout.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It is not clear to me why we need to add MC-Dropout to the ensemble.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: What is the benefit of DEBAL over an ensemble method if both of them do not have Bayesian theoretic support?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In terms of the empirical results, the better performance of DEBAL compared to a single MC-Dropout model is not supervising as Beluch et al. (2018) already demonstrated that an ensemble is better than a single MC-Dropout.
label: none

sentence: While the improvement of DEBAL compared to an ensemble is marginal but is reasonable.
label: none

sentence: The labels of figures are hard to read.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This paper proposed a general method for image restoration based on GAN.
label: none

sentence: In particular, the latent variable z is optimized based on the MAP framework.
label: none

sentence: And the results are obtained by G(z).
label: none

sentence: This method looks reasonable to achieve good results.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: However, the idea is very related to Yeh et al.’s work which has already published but not mentioned at all.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Yeh, Raymond A., et al. "Image Restoration with Deep Generative Models." 2018 IEEE International Conference on Acoustics, Speech and Signal Processing (ICASSP). IEEE, 2018.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Both the proposed method and Yeh et al.’s method optimize the latent variable z of the generator using MAP, although the loss functions are slightly different.
label: asp_originality

sentence: In addition, the applications are very similar: image inpainting, denoising, super-resolution etc. Yeh et al.’s method should be the right baseline instead of the nearest neighbor algorithm.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: In addition, the results seem very weak.
label: asp_substance

sentence: There are tons of algorithms for image inpainting, denoising, and super-resolution, but the proposed method was not compared with them.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The paper claims that only the nearest neighbor algorithm can handle different degradations.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This is not true.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For example, total variation regularization can do all these tasks.
label: none

sentence: Some other comments: what are the parameters of the degradation in the applications? For example, in image inpainting, does the proposed method learn the mask as well? So it is blind inpainting?
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper proposes to relax the assumption of disentangled representation and encourage the model to learn linearly manipulable representations.
label: none

sentence: The paper assumes that the latent canonicalizers are predefined for each task and that it is possible to obtain the ground-truth image of different latent canonicalizations.
label: none

sentence: I find these assumptions too strong for the task of learning disentangled representation.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Firstly, most prior works such as beta-vae, info-gan do not assume that the factors / canonicalizers are known beforehand.
label: none

sentence: In fact, this is a very difficult part of learning disentangled representation.
label: none

sentence: Secondly, if it is possible to obtain the ground-truth image of different latent canonicalizations, you can simply train a network to predict the canonicalizations by simple supervised learning.
label: none

sentence: Hence, these overly simplified and unrealistic assumptions make the task too trivial.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The proposed method is very simple and frames the problem basically as a supervised learning problem.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Although experiments show that learning such representations are beneficial for low-shot setting of SVHN, it is not clear whether such improvement generalizes to more realistic datasets such as ImageNet.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: If the goal is to learn representation for low-shot setting, the method needs to be compared with other representation learning methods such as jigsaw[1], colorization[2] and rotation[3].
label: asp_substance

sentence: [1] Noroozi, Mehdi, and Paolo Favaro. "Unsupervised learning of visual representations by solving jigsaw puzzles." European Conference on Computer Vision. Springer, Cham, 2016.
label: none

sentence: [2] Zhang, Richard, Phillip Isola, and Alexei A. Efros. "Colorful image colorization." European conference on computer vision. Springer, Cham, 2016.
label: none

sentence: [3] Gidaris, Spyros, Praveer Singh, and Nikos Komodakis. "Unsupervised representation learning by predicting image rotations." arXiv preprint arXiv:1803.07728 (2018).
label: none

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: The paper, considers methods for solving smooth unconstrained min-max optimization problems.
label: none

sentence: In particular, the authors prove that the Hamiltonian Gradient Descent (HGD) algorithm converges with linear convergence rate to the min-max solution.
label: none

sentence: One of the main contributions of this work is that the proposed analysis is focusing on last iterate convergence guarantees for the HGD.
label: none

sentence: This result, as the authors claim can be particularly useful in the future for analyzing more general settings (nonconvex-nonconcave min-max problems).
label: none

sentence: In addition, two preliminary convergence theorems were provided for two extensions of HGD: (i) a stochastic variant of HGD and (ii)  Consensus Optimization Algorithm (CO) (by establishing connections of CO and HGD).
label: none

sentence: Main Comments:
label: none

sentence: The paper is well written and the main contributions are clear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I believe that the idea of the paper is interesting and the convergence analysis seems correct, however i have some concerns regarding  the presentation and the combination of different assumptions used in the theory.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 1) I think definition 2.5 of Higher order Lipschitz is very strong assumption to have. What exactly means? Essentially the authors upper bounded any difficult term appear in the theorems. Is it possible to avoid having something so strong? Please elaborate.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 2) In assumption 3.1 is not clear what $L_H$ is.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This quantity never mentioned before.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Reading the Lemmas of Section 4 (Lemma 4.4) you can see that it is the smoothness parameter of function $H$. Thus, is not necessary to have it there (not important for the definition).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 3) What is the main difference on the combination of assumptions on Theorems 3.2, 3.2 and 3.4. Which one is stronger. Is there a reason for the existence of Theorem 3.3?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 4) All the results heavily depend on the PL condition.
label: none

sentence: I think having this in mind, showing the convergence of Theorems 3.2-3.4 is somehow trivial.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In particular, one can propose several combinations of assumptions in order for the function H to satisfy the PL condition.
label: none

sentence: Can we avoid having the PL condition?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The authors need to elaborate more on this.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 5) In Theorem 5.2, the term 1/sqrt(2) is missing from the final bound.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Minor Suggestions:
label: none

sentence: In first paragraph of page 5 where the authors divide the existing literature into the three particular cases, I am suggesting to add the refereed papers inside each one of this cases (which papers assumed function g bilinear , which papers strongly convex-concave etc.)
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: I understand that the main contribution of the work is the theoretical analysis of the proposed method but would like to see some numerical evaluation in the main paper.
label: asp_substance

sentence: There are some preliminary results in the appendix but it will be useful for the reader if there are are some plots showing the benefit of the method in comparison with existing methods that guarantee convergence (which method is faster?).
label: asp_substance

sentence: In the current experiments there is a comparison only with CO algorithm and SGDA.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In general i find the paper interesting, with nice ideas and I believe that will be appreciated from researchers that are interested on smooth games and their connections to machine learning applications.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: I suggest weak accept but I am open to reconsider in case that my above concerns are answered.
label: none

sentence: **********after rebuttal
label: none

sentence: I would like to thank the authors for their reply and for the further clarification.
label: none

sentence: I will keep my score the same but I highly encourage the authors to add some clarification related to my last comment on the globally bounded gradient.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In their response they mentioned that the analysis only requires that  H is smooth and that $\|\xi(x^{(0)})\|$ is sufficient bound.
label: none

sentence: This needs to be clear in the paper (add clear arguments and related references).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In addition, in their response they highlight the non-increasing nature of function H over the course of the algorithm which is important for their argument.
label: none

sentence: Having this in mind note that the theoretical results on stochastic variant presented in the paper are wrong.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In SGD,  function H does not necessarily decrease over the course of the algorithm.
label: none

sentence: The authors either need to remove these results or restate them in a different way in order to satisfy the assumed conditions.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 1. I had hard time to understand latent canonicalization.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Do you mean that each latent variable is fixed to a value, such that this factor of variation is disabled? Are the canonicalizers pre-specified using meta-labels? Are they updated/learned during model training?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: More explanation of canonicalization is needed.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Perhaps an example in linear algebra is needed.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 2. The learning of the proposed model relies on meta-data description such that the learning is supervised. Can the method be applicable to situations where no meta-data and no class labels are available?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 3. How can the proposed method be generalized to non-image data?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The experiments were only done on simple image datasets.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I am wondering this method can be applied to other complex datasets whose latent factors are unknown.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 4. I do not understand this: "to fit well the method overfitting rate" in Section 3.3.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Minors:
label: none

sentence: (1) than -> that
label: asp_clarity

sentence: (2) Eq. (3): is there a superscription "(j)" on z_canon in decoder?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: i have change my rating from 5 to 6 after reading the numerous and thorough rebuttals from the authors.
label: none

sentence: I hope they will incorporate these clarifications and additional experiments into the final version of the paper if accepted.
label: none

sentence: The purpose of this paper is presumably to approximate the margin of a sample as accurately as possible.
label: none

sentence: This is clearly an intractable problem.
label: none

sentence: Thus all attacks make some kind of approximation, including this paper.
label: none

sentence: I am still a bit confused about the difference between "zero-confidence attacks" and those that don't fall into that category such as PGD.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Since all of these are approximations, and we cannot know how far we are from the true margin, I don't see why these categories help.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The authors spend two paragraphs in the introduction trying to draw a distinction but I am still not convinced.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The proofs provided by the authors assume that convexity and many assumptions, which makes it not very useful for the real world case.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: What would have been helpful is to show the accuracy of their margin for simple binary toy 2D problems, where the true margin and their approximation can be visualized.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This was not done.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This reduces the paper to an empirical exercise rather than a true understanding of their method's advantages and limitations.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Finally, the experimental results do not show any significant advantage over PGD, either in running time (they are slower) or norm perturbation.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Thus their novelty rests on the definition of zero confidence attack, and of the importance of such a attack.
label: none

sentence: So clarifying the above question will help to judge the paper's novelty.
label: asp_originality
