sentence: This paper proposes a method for unsupervised learning  of data representations that can be manipulated to remove factors of variation via linear transformations.
label: none

sentence: These transformations are called canonicalizations in the paper.
label: none

sentence: The canonicalizations are trained such that images for arbitrary values of the corresponding factor of variation are transformed into images with a fixed, canonical, value for that factor.
label: none

sentence: The paper proposes a model architecture based on a denoising autoencoder, where the canonicalizations are applied to the encoded representation.
label: none

sentence: It also proposes a loss function and sampling scheme for training the model.
label: none

sentence: The paper demonstrates the method on the dSprites dataset, showing that it can effectively learn linear canonicalizations, and that multiple of these canonicalizations can be applied to the same image representation.
label: none

sentence: The paper goes on to test the method on a digit classification task, where the model is trained to learn a representation in a simulator for SVHN data where the transformations to be canonicalized can be controlled, and  used to train a classifier on unseen real data from the SVHN test set.
label: none

sentence: I think this paper should be accepted as it proposes a novel idea, which does not seem too difficult to reproduce, describes a simulator for synthetic data for digit recognition, and proposes it as a benchmark for learning representations, and provides experimental results that help in better understanding the representation learned by the model.
label: asp_originality

sentence: A couple things I thought were missing in the paper:
label: none

sentence: Did you try applying the classification loss to both the encoded representation and the canonicalized representation at the same time?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: For Figure 2, Did you try applying canonicalizations in different orders? Do they give the same results?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Instead of trying to learn idempotency by gradient descent, you could try to parametrize the canonicalizations with a matrix X, such that C =  X (X^T X)^{-1} X^T. C will be idempotent (although restricted to be symmetric).
label: none

sentence: There might be other constructions that are more efficient and less restrictive.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I'm not sure I understand the PCA figures. Can you please explain how the first principal component was used to generate them?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Minor comments:
label: none

sentence: * "data  tripets" on page 2
label: asp_clarity

sentence: * Figure 5 should appear after Figure 4.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This paper proposes a new application of embedding techniques for mathematical problem retrieval in adaptive tutoring.
label: none

sentence: The proposed method performs much better than baseline sentence embedding methods.
label: none

sentence: Another contribution is on using negative pre-training to deal with an imbalanced training dataset.
label: none

sentence: To me this paper is just not good enough - the method essentially i) use "a professor and two teaching assistants" to build a "rule-based concept extractor" for problems, then ii) map problems into this "concept space" and simply treat them as words. There are several problems with this approach.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: First, doing so does not touch the core of the proposed application.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: For tutoring applications, the most important thing is to select a problem that can help students improve; even if you can indeed select a problem that is the most similar to another problem, is it the best one to show a student? There are no evaluations on real students in the paper.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Moreover, the main difference between math problems and other problems is that there are math expressions; I do not think that using words/concept labels only is enough without touching on the math expressions.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Second, the proposed method does not sound scalable - the use of a professor and two teaching assistants to construct the concept extractor, and the use of an expert TA to select a small set of informative words.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I am not sure how this will generalize to a larger number of problem spanning many different domains.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I also had a hard time going through the paper - there aren't many details.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Section 2.1 is where the method is proposed, yet most of the descriptions there are unclear. Without these details it is impossible to judge the novelty of the "rule-based concept extractor", which is the key technical innovation.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This paper studies the generalization properties of Recurrent Neural Networks (RNN) and its variants for the sequence to sequence multiclass prediction problem.
label: none

sentence: The problem is important to understand in the theoretical machine learning community.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The paper is written well overall, clearly explaining the results obtained.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I would like to raise several important points:
label: none

sentence: 1. Missing comparison with parameter counting bounds: there has been a long line of research on generalization bounds for RNNs by obtaining bounds on the VC dimension of the function class [1, 2] which provide generalization bounds for various non-linearities.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The bounds obtained are polynomial in the sequence length T (often sublinear or linear) and should be compared with the existing bounds for a thorough comparison.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 2. Vacuous bounds in the regime \beta >1: Most recurrent architectures with no restrictions on the transition matrices work in the regime where they are more expressive and \beta >1.
label: none

sentence: A quick glance at Table 1 suggests that the bounds obtained through Theorem 3 are exponential in t and are mostly vacuous.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: They can indeed be subsumed by generalization bounds based on VC theory.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The bound obtained in Theorem 2 comes rather easily from the bounded assumption on the non-linearity and is this not very interesting.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 3. Technical contribution: While the authors propose the first bounds for LSTMs and MGUs, most of the analysis seems to be a marginal contribution over the work of Bartlett et al. [3]
label: asp_originality

sentence: 4. Missing experiments to validate nature of bounds: Bartlett et al. [3] performed extensive experiments to exhibit the correct scaling of the generalization bounds with the "model complexity" introduced upto numerical constants.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It would be good to have some experiments in the sequence to sequence setting to understand if the obtained complexities are in fact what one would expect in practice.
label: asp_substance

sentence: [1] Koiran, Pascal, and Eduardo D. Sontag. "Vapnik-Chervonenkis Dimension of Recurrent Neural Networks." Discrete Applied Mathematics 86.1 (1998): 63-79.
label: none

sentence: [2] Dasgupta, Bhaskar, and Eduardo D. Sontag. "Sample complexity for learning recurrent perceptron mappings." Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems. 1996.
label: none

sentence: [3] Bartlett, Peter L., Dylan J. Foster, and Matus J. Telgarsky. "Spectrally-normalized margin bounds for neural networks." Advances in Neural Information Processing Systems. 2017.
label: none

sentence: PROS:
label: none

sentence: * Original idea of using separate "discriminator" paths for unknown classes
label: asp_originality

sentence: * Thorough theoretical explanation
label: asp_substance

sentence: A variety of experiments
label: asp_substance

sentence: * Very well-written, and clear paper
label: asp_clarity

sentence: CONS:
label: none

sentence: * The biggest problem for me was the unconvincing results.
label: asp_substance

sentence: MNIST-to-MNIST-M has better baselines  (PixelDA performed better on this task for example), Office is not suitable for domain adaptation experiments anymore unless one wants to be in a few-datasample regime or work with data with noisy labels(the dataset is plagued with label pollution, and there are too few examples per class per domain for NN-based domain adaptation); the results on CELL were not convincing, I don't know the dataset but it seems that baseline NN does better than DA most of the times.
label: none

sentence: * Comparison with other methods did not take into account a variety of hyperparameters.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Although I do understand the problem of evaluation in unsupervised DA, this should have at least been done in the semi-supervised case, and some analysis/discussion should be included for the unsupervised one.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: What if the proposed method performs that much better than baselines but they hyperparameters are not set correctly?
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper shows that Hamiltonian gradient descent (HGD), which is gradient descent on the norm of the squared norm of the vector field, achieves linear convergence for a broader range of problems than bilinear and convex-strongly concave formulations.
label: none

sentence: In particular, the authors show the result for convex-concave problems satisfying a “sufficiently bilinear” condition that is related to the PL conditions.
label: none

sentence: Finally, the authors argue that consensus optimization (CO) can be viewed as a perturbation of HGD when the parameter choice is big enough.
label: none

sentence: From this viewpoint they derive convergence rates for CO on the broader set of problems.
label: none

sentence: This provides some further theoretical justification of the success of CO on large scale GAN problems.
label: none

sentence: The paper is presented in a clear manner, with the objectives and analysis techniques delineated in the main paper.
label: none

sentence: This was helpful to get a sense of the main points before going through the appendix.
label: none

sentence: The objective of the paper is to extend the problem settings for which there is last iterate min-max convergence rates, which now exist for bilinear, strongly convex-strongly concave, and convex-strongly concave problems.
label: none

sentence: The authors achieve this by analyzing HGD and giving convergence rates for when a “sufficiently bilinear condition is satisfied”.
label: none

sentence: The primary idea behind the proof techniques is to show that the objective (Hamiltonian) satisfies the PL condition.
label: none

sentence: I found this to be an interesting approach.
label: none

sentence: As a result, the main question in evaluating this paper is on the significance of the result and the generality of the “sufficiently bilinear” condition.
label: none

sentence: I tend to lean toward the result carrying some significance since it does extend the class of problems for which the convergence rates exists.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: However, the weakness is that the condition is opaque and it is not entirely clear how broad of class of problems this condition would apply to.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I do acknowledge that the authors did a reasonable job of trying to clear this up in section 3.2 and section G of the appendix.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It did still leave me wanting more with respect to the practical significance though.
label: none

sentence: Finally, I found the connection to CO valuable.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In particular, since this paper does not show large-scale experiments, the connection serves to provide some more theoretical evidence for they CO performs well in practice.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Post Author Response: Thanks for the response. I agree with your perspective and think this paper should be accepted.
label: none

sentence: The main contributions of the submission are:
label: none

sentence: 1. A comprehensive empirical comparison of deep learning optimizers, with their performance compared under different amount of hyper-parameter tuning (they perform hyper-parameter tuning using random search).
label: none

sentence: 2. The introduction of a novel metric that tries to capture the "tunability" of an optimizer.
label: none

sentence: This metric attempts to trade off the performance of an optimizer when tuned only with a small number of hyper-parameter trials, and its performance when carefully tuned.
label: none

sentence: The metric is defined as a weighted average of the performance after tuning with i random trials, with i that goes from 1 to K.
label: none

sentence: The weights of this weighted average and K are "hyper-parameters" of the metric itself.
label: none

sentence: They use K=100 and suggest 3 possible choices of weights.
label: none

sentence: The paper appears to treat 2. as the main contribution.
label: none

sentence: However, I do not think the metric they introduce is good enough to be recommended in future work, when comparing tunability of optimizers (or other algorithms with hyperparameters).
label: asp_substance

sentence: The reason is that simpler methods provide just as much information, and do not rely on the need of interpreting the choice of the weights and K. This point is proven in the paper itself, where for example Figure 2 provides a more concrete and easier to interpret information than the tunability metric, similar graphs could be easily provided per dataset.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Similarly, figure 3 as well as figures 5-7 and 8 in the appendix provide very good information about the tunability of the various optimizers without using the introduced metrics.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Information similar (although not identical) to that summarized in table 5 could be captured by substituting the 3 metrics with the best performance after tuning for 4, 16 and 64 iterations respectively (just as examples).
label: asp_substance

sentence: A stronger contribution is 1., which however is somewhat incremental compared to similar comparisons made in the past.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Comparisons which, while mentioned, should perhaps have been discussed and compared more in detail in this work.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Overall, I do not feel the comparisons dramatically change the qualitative understanding the field has of the different optimizers and their tunability.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: They also suggest that when the tuning budget is low, using Adam but tuning only the learning rate is beneficial, which could be a valuable and practical suggestion.
label: asp_originality

sentence: I enjoyed reading the submission, which is very clearly written, but due to the relatively limited value of the contributions, and excessive focus on the tunability metric which I do not feel is giustified, I slightly lean against acceptance here at ICLR. I do think, however, that it would make a great submission to a smaller venue or workshop.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Other comments/notes:
label: none

sentence: * One aspects that is mostly left out of the discussion (except from one side comment) is the wallclock time, as some optimizers might be on average quicker to train (for example due to quicker convergence), this can easily lead it to be quicker to tune even though it requires a higher budget of trials.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I think it would be worth discussing this more.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: * minor: in figure 8 in the appendix, the results after 100 iterations is, as far as I understand, over a single replication, so is not particularly reliable (and will always be 100% of a single optimizer)
label: asp_substance

sentence: * similarly to the above, if the configurations are always sampled from the same 100, confidence intervals in the graphs become less reliable as the budget increases.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Review for MANIFOLD REGULARIZATION WITH GANS FOR SEMISUPERVISED LEARNING
label: none

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: The paper proposed to incorporate a manifold regularization penalty to the GAN to adapt to semi-supervised learning.
label: none

sentence: They approximate this penalty empirically by calculating stochastic finite differences of the generator’s latent variables.
label: none

sentence: The paper does a good job of motivating the additional regularization penalty and their approximation to it with a series of experiments and intuitive explanations.
label: none

sentence: The experiment results are very through and overall promising.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper is presented in a clear manner with only minor issues.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Novelty/Significance:
label: none

sentence: The authors’ add a manifold regularization penalty to GAN discriminator’s loss function.
label: none

sentence: While this is a simple and seemingly obvious approach, it had to be done by someone.
label: none

sentence: Thus while I don’t think their algorithm is super novel, it is significant and thus novel enough.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Additionally, the authors’ use of gradients of the generator as an approximation for the manifold penalty is a clever.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Questions/Clarity:
label: none

sentence: It would be helpful to note in the description of Table 3 what is better (higher/lower).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Also Table 3 seems to have standard deviations missing in Supervised DCGANs and Improved GAN for 4000 labels. And is there an explanation on why there isn’t an improvement in the FID score of SVHN for 1000 labels?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: What is the first line of Table 4? Is it supposed to be combined with the second? If not, then it is missing results. And is the Pi model missing results or can it not be run on too few labels? If it can’t be run, it would be helpful to state this.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: On page 11, “in Figure A2” the first word needs to be capitalized.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In Figure A1, why is there a dark point at one point in the inner circle? What makes the gradient super high there?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: What are the differences of the 6 pictures in Figure A7? Iterations?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The paper focuses on the generalization performance of RNNs and its variant in a theoretical perspective.
label: none

sentence: Compared to the previous result (Zhang et al., 2018) for RNNs, this paper refines the generalization bounds for vanilla RNNs in all cases and fills the blank for RNN variants like MGU and LSTM.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, in the work of Zhang et al. (2018), the complexity term quadratically depends on the layer (or say, current sequence length, denoted by t in original paper), making it less instructive.
label: none

sentence: This paper improves it to at most linear dependence and can achieve at logarithmic dependence in some cases, which should be accredited.
label: none

sentence: The key step in the proof is Lemma 2.
label: none

sentence: In Lemma 2, the spectral norms of weight matrices and the number of weight parameters are decoupled.
label: none

sentence: With Lemma 2, it is natural to construct a epsilon-net for RNNs and then upper bound the empirical Rademacher complexity by Dudley’s entropy integral, since such methodology is not so novel.
label: none

sentence: Bartlett, et al. (2017) developed this technique to analyze the generalization bound for neural networks in a margin-based multiclass classification.
label: none

sentence: However, it seems a little unexplainable to apply a technique developed from classification to analyze RNNs, since the main task of RNNs never should be classification.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I wonder the motivation of analyzing generalization of RNNs by the techniques established by Bartlett.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This paper seeks to understand the AlphaGo Zero (AGZ) algorithm and extend the algorithm to regular sequential decision-making problems.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, the paper answers three questions regarding AGZ: (i) What is the optimal policy that AGZ is trying to learn?
label: none

sentence: (ii) Why is cross-entropy the right objective?
label: none

sentence: (iii) How does AGZ extend to generic sequential decision-making problems?
label: none

sentence: This paper shows that AGZ’s optimal policy is a Nash equilibrium, the KL divergence bounds distance to optimal reward, and the two-player zero-sum game could be applied to sequential decision making by introducing the concept of robust MDP.
label: none

sentence: Overall the paper is well written.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: However, there are several concerns about this paper.
label: none

sentence: In fact, the key results obtained in this paper is that minimizing the KL-divergence between the parametric policy and the optimal policy (Nash equilibrium) (using SGD) will converge to the optimal policy.
label: none

sentence: It is based on a bound (2), which states that when the KL-divergence between a policy and the optimal policy goes to zero then the return for the policy will approach that of the optimal policy.
label: none

sentence: This bound is not so surprising because as long as certain regularity condition holds, the policies being close should lead to the returns being close.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Therefore, it is an overclaim that the KL-divergence bound (2) provides an immediate justification for AGZ’s core learning algorithm.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: As mentioned earlier, the actual conclusion in Section 4.2 is that minimizing the KL-divergence between the parametric policy and the optimal policy by SGD will converge to the optimal policy, which is straightforward and is not what AlphaGo Zero does.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This is because there is an important gap: the MCTS policy is not the same as the optimal policy.
label: none

sentence: The effect of the imperfection in the target policy is not taken into account in the paper.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: A more interesting question to study is how this gap affect the iterative algorithm, and whether/how the error in the imperfect target policy accumulates/diminishes so that iteratively minimizing KL-divergence with imperfect \pi* (by MCTS) could still lead to optimal policy (Nash equilibrium).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Furthermore, the robust MDP view of the AGZ in sequential decision-making problems is not so impressive either.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It is more or less like a reformulation of the AGZ setting in the MDP problem. And it is commonly known that two-player zero-sum game is closely related to minimax robust control. Therefore, it cannot be called as “generalizing AlphaGo Zero” as stated in the title of the paper.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The paper proposes to use the triplet loss as a convex relaxation of the ordinal embedding problem.
label: none

sentence: The loss is solved using feed-forward neural network with the input to the network being the ids of the items encoded in binary codes.
label: none

sentence: The benefit of using a deep network is to exploit its optimization capability and the parallelism on GPUs.
label: none

sentence: The experiments presented in the paper include a set of simulation experiments and a real-world task.
label: none

sentence: I am giving a score of 3.
label: none

sentence: This work is an interesting application of deep learning, but it gives little insight as to why deep networks are able to solve the problem and how to solve ordinal embedding itself.
label: asp_substance

sentence: To elaborate, the problem is known to be NP-hard in the worst case, while the data sets used in the paper seem to have certain nice properties.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It would be interesting to see how deep networks do for the hard cases.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It would also be interesting to see if additional assumptions, such as the existence of clusters or separation between clusters, make ordinal embedding simpler and thus tractable.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Another approach is to assume the solution to have low surrogate loss (4), and any convex solver with sufficiently large number of points is able to find such a solution.
label: none

sentence: Then the question becomes how deep networks solve the particular convex optimization problem.
label: none

sentence: Thinking along these directions would bring more insight and impact to both the ordinal embedding problem and optimization in deep networks.
label: asp_substance

sentence: one quick question:
label: none

sentence: equations (3) and (4)
label: none

sentence: --> isn't this the same as using the hinge loss to bound the zero-one loss?
label: asp_substance

sentence: Summary
label: none

sentence: The paper proposes to modify the "Dual Learning" approach to supervised (and unsupervised) translation problems by making use of additional pretrained mappings for both directions (i.e. primal and dual).
label: none

sentence: These pre-trained mappings ("agents") generate targets from the primal to the dual domain, which need to be mapped back to the original input.
label: none

sentence: It is shown that having >=1 additional agents improves training of the BLEU score in standard MT and unsupervised MT tasks.
label: none

sentence: The method is also applied to unsupervised image-to-image "translation" tasks.
label: none

sentence: Positives and Negatives
label: none

sentence: +1 Simple and straightforward method with pretty good results on language translation.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: +2 Does not require additional computation during inference, unlike ensembling.
label: none

sentence: -1 The mathematics in section 3.1 is unclear and potentially flawed (more below).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: -2 Diversity of additional "agents" not analyzed (more below).
label: asp_substance

sentence: -3 For image-to-image translation experiments, no quantitative analysis whatsoever is offered so the reader can't really conclude anything about the effect of the proposed method in this domain.
label: asp_substance

sentence: -4 Talking about "agents" and "Multi-Agent" is a somewhat confusing given the slightly different use of the same term in the reinforcement literature. Why not just "mapping" or "network"?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: -1: Potential Issues with the Maths.
label: none

sentence: The maths is not clear, in particular the gradient derivation in equation (8).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Let's just consider the distortion objective on x (of course it also applies to y without loss of generality).
label: none

sentence: At the very least we need another "partial" sign in front of the "\delta" function in the numerator.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: But again, it's not super clear how the paper estimates this derivative.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Intuitively the objective wants f_0 to generate samples which, when mapped back to the X domain, have high log-probability under G, but its samples cannot be differentiated in the case of discrete data.
label: none

sentence: So is the REINFORCE estimator used or something? Not that the importance sampling matter is orthogonal.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In the case of continuous data x, is the reparameterization trick used?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This should at the very least be explained more clearly.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Note that the importance sampling does not affect this issue.
label: none

sentence: -2: Diversity of Agents.
label: none

sentence: As with ensembles, clearly it only helps to have multiple agents (N>2) if the additional agents are distinct from f_1 (again without loss of generality this applies to g as well).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The paper proposes to use different random seeds and iterate over the dataset in a different order for distinct pretrained f_i.
label: none

sentence: The paper should quantify that this leads to diverse "agents".
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I suppose the proof is in the pudding; as we have argued, multiple agents can only improve performance if they are distinct, and Figure 1 shows some improvement as the number of agents are increase (no error bars though).
label: none

sentence: The biggest jump seems to come from N=1 -> N=2 (although N=4 -> N=5 does see a jump as well).
label: none

sentence: Presumably if you get a more diverse pool of agents, that should improve things.
label: none

sentence: Have you considered training different agents on different subsets of the data, or trying different learning algorithms/architectures to learn them?
label: asp_substance

sentence: More experiments on the diversity would help make the paper more convincing.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper develops a mean field theory for batch normalization (BN) in fully-connected networks with randomly initialized weights.
label: none

sentence: There are a number of interesting predictions made in this paper on the basis of this analysis.
label: none

sentence: The main technical results of the paper are Theorems 5-8 which compute the statistics of the covariance of the activations and the gradients.
label: none

sentence: Comments:
label: none

sentence: 1. The observation that gradients explode in spite of BN is quite counter-intuitive. Can you give an intuitive explanation of why this occurs?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 2. In a similar vein, there a number of highly technical results in the paper and it would be great if the authors provide an intuitive explanation of their theorems.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 3. Can the statistics of activations be controlled using activation functions or operations which break the symmetry?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: For instance, are BSB1 fixed points good for training neural networks?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 4. Mean field analysis, although it lends an insight into the statistics of the activations, needs to connected with empirical observations.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For instance, when the authors observe that the structure of the fixed point is such that activations are of identical norm equally spread apart in terms of angle, this is quite far from practice.
label: none

sentence: It would be good to mention this in the introduction or the conclusions.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: This paper introduces a generative model for 3D point clouds.
label: none

sentence: Authors aim at theoretically showing the difficulties of using existing generative models to learn distributions of point clouds, and propose a variant that supposedly solves the issues.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: + The problem of designing generative models for 3D data is important.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Cons:
label: none

sentence: - Paper is often hard to follow, and contains a significant number of typos.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - Authors claim to identify a fundamental problem with the existing generative models for point clouds, yet Section 2 tries to show that a _specific version_ that uses DeepSet does not satisfy theoretical guarantees. What if we use e.g. a recurrent network instead?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: As is, the counter example proof itself is quite confusing: it would really help if the proof was more formal.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - Jointly learning an inference network (Q) has certainly been done before, and I am not sure authors provide an elaborate enough explanation of what is the difference with adversarially learned inference /  adversarial feature learning.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: - It is not clear why authors did not follow the evaluation protocol of [Achlioptas’17] or [Wu’16] more closely.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In particular, evaluation for the classification task should be compatible with the proposed model, which would give a much better picture of the learned representations.
label: none

sentence: Authors propose a novel combination of RBM feature extractor and CNN classifiers to gain robustness toward adversarial attacks.
label: none

sentence: They first train a small mean field boltzmann machine on 4x4 patches of MNIST, then combine 4 of these into a larger 8x8 feature extractor.
label: none

sentence: Authors use the RBM 8x8 feature representation as a fixed convolutional layer and train a CNN on top of it.
label: none

sentence: The intuition behind the idea is that since RBMs are generative, the RBM layer will act as a denoiser.
label: none

sentence: One question which is not addressed is the reason for only one RBM layer.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In "Stacks of convolutional Restricted Boltzmann Machines for shift-invariant feature learning" by Norouzi et al, several RBM layers are trained greedily (same as here, only difference is contrastive loss vs mean field) and they achieve 0.67% error on MNIST.
label: none

sentence: Attacking CRBMs is highly relevant and should be included as a baseline.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The only set of experiments are comparisons on first 500 MNIST test images.
label: asp_substance

sentence: If the test set is not shuffled (by emphasis on first I assume not) these images are from training NIST (cleaner) set and may not include samples of all digits.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Authors should clarify the justification behind experimenting only on 'first 500 test images'.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Furthermore, as authors discussed the iterative weight sharing which increases the depth can vanish the gradient toward input.
label: none

sentence: Including at least one set of black box attacks is necessary to verify to what degree the vanishing gradient is the case here.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The iterative architecture is similar to the routing in CapsNet (Hinton 2018) in terms of weight sharing between successive layers.
label: none

sentence: Although their network was resilient toward white box attacks they suffered from black box attacks.
label: none

sentence: The boundary method on MNIST could be  weaker than a black box attack.
label: none

sentence: The idea is nice.
label: asp_originality

sentence: It is well aligned with tools that are needed to understand neural networks.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: However, the experiments feel like they are missing motivation as to why this method is being used.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper does not provide very significant evidence that this method is useful.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The negation example is nice but this doesn't seem to display the potential power of the method to understand a neural network.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: More motivation for experimental section is needed.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: If the authors don't discuss a motivation then how will a reader know how to apply the tool?
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: It seems there is no conclusion to take away from the experiments in section 5 (convolutions).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors should rethink the structure of the experimental section from the standpoint of convincing someone to use this method.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In section 4.1 the authors have a good discussion on what is wrong with other methods in order to motivate their approach but then they don't deliver significant evidence in the later part of the section.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper needs more discussion and experiments to explain how and why to use this approach.
label: asp_substance

sentence: While the authors say "attributing a deep network’s prediction to its input is well-studied" they don't compare directly against these methods.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: There are many typos and grammar errors

sentence: While I think the paper could be much more impactful if the experimental section was greatly reworked; I believe the first 5 pages of the paper are a very good contribution and it should be accepted.

sentence: This paper proposed an aggregation algorithm (DARN) for the multi-source domain adaptation problem which is highly useful in real-world applications.
label: none

sentence: The proposed method is based on the theoretical extension of the single-source domain discrepancy measure proposed by Mansour et al. 2009 to the multi-source setting.
label: none

sentence: This paper also showed the effectiveness of the proposed method on some real-world datasets.
label: none

sentence: Strengths
label: none

sentence: The paper introduces new technical insights to understand their bound, e.g. effective sample size.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The paper proposed the way to estimate coefficient, optimal \alpha, with theoretical justification, and I think this is the biggest contribution of this paper and is interesting.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The proposed method is also able to be used in the regression task since it is based on the disc which can be estimated in the regression task.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Weakness
label: none

sentence: The main theorem of this paper is an extension of existing methods, so the novelty of theoretical analysis is somewhat limited.
label: asp_originality

sentence: A naive approach to estimate coefficient with single-source domain discrepancy measures such as [1]Mansour (2009), [2,3] Ben-David(2007, 2010), [4] Kuroki et al (2019), and W1-distance is not considered.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Experimental results itself are fine but not complete.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Although disc can be easily estimated in the regression task (differently from d_A distance which is a special case of disc), there are no experimental results of the regression task even in the synthetic data.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - It would be also better to show the coefficient of existing methods that have no theoretical justification.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - It would be better to compare with a naive approach that uses domain discrepancy between each source and target as (fixed) coefficient since this approach such as Mansour (2009), Ben-David(2007, 2010) and Kuroki et al (2019) which explicitly consider the hypothesis class has theoretical justification in the form of generalization error bound in the target domain.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Overall, I like the approach of the proposed method, especially tuning coefficient during training procedure although novelty in the theoretical analysis is somewhat limited.
label: asp_originality

sentence: So this work has to be supported with more detailed experimental results to express the potential of this approach fully.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For this reason, I think it is okay but not good enough at this time.
label: arg_other

sentence: This paper presents a new method to measure the importance of hidden neurons in deep neural networks.
label: none

sentence: The method integrates notions of activation value, input influence to a neuron and neuron influence to the network's output.
label: none

sentence: They provide results confirming that this measure is able to identify neurons that are important for specific tasks.
label: none

sentence: Quality
label: none

sentence: The experiments are well designed to verify their hypothesis, although there could be more to make sure those results are not particular to the few selected problems.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Nevertheless, the results are consistent across those experiments.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Clarity
label: none

sentence: The text is well written in general, but the structure could be improved.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The introduction contains too much related work, which should be divided in another section.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Section 2 contains mostly high level explanations of the work, which should be integrated in the introduction, and thus before the related work section, to improve readability.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: See minor comments for more specific suggestions.
label: none

sentence: It is difficult to understand the goal of Section 4.2.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Section 2 states that section 4.2 proves that a "path method" must be used in order to satisfy the axioms, but why such axioms are important is not stressed enough.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Also, it is not clear why those are called axioms since they are not use to build anything else.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It seems to me that those are rather "desirable properties" than axioms.

sentence: Originality
label: none

sentence: Although the proposed measure is close to what is proposed by Datta et al., this paper makes the distinction clear and benchmarks its results properly against it.

sentence: Significance
label: none

sentence: There is an increasing need to interpretability of deep neural networks as they get more and more applied to real-world problems.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Measures as the one proposed in this paper are a very important building block towards this.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Conclusion
label: none

sentence: For its original importance measure and the proper experiment benchmarks, I believe this paper should be accepted.

sentence: There is however many minor issues that should be fixed for the camera-ready version.

sentence: Although the recommended length is 8 pages, the strict limit is 10, so I would recommended to use a bit of the remaining extra space to conclude the paper properly with a discussion on the results and their consequences, as well as a conclusion to wrap up the paper.

sentence: The paper presents algorithms for solving computational problems in a datastream model augmented with an oracle learned from data.
label: none

sentence: The authors show that under this model, there exist algorithms that have significantly better time and space complexity than the current best known algorithms that do not use an oracle.
label: none

sentence: The authors support their theoretical analysis with experiments in which the oracle is represented by a deep neural network and demonstrate improvement over classical algorithms that do not use machine learning.
label: none

sentence: Overall, this paper seems like a solid contribution to the literature.
label: asp_substance

sentence: However, in its current state it does seem to be presented and motivated in a way that is appropriate for the audience of ML researchers at ICLR.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: It reads very much like a STOC theory paper, and a lot of the key ML details that would be relevant to audience at this conference seem to have been shoved under the rug in a way.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Therefore my score for now is a weak reject, but I am very happy to increase the score if the authors address my presentations concerns.
label: none

label: none

sentence: A key point of interest is the following: very exciting recent work (GraphRNN: Generating Realistic Graphs with Deep Auto-regressive Models by You et al ICML2018) has proposed neural generative models of networks with a high degree of fidelity and much less hand-picked features.

sentence: This paper builds upon the assumption that GANs successfully approximate the data manifold, and uses this assumption to regularize semi-supervised learning process.
label: none

sentence: The proposed regularization strategy enforces that a discriminator or a given classifier should be invariant to small perturbations on the data manifold z. It is empirically shown that naively enforcing such a constraint by randomly adding noise to z could lead to under-smoothing or over-smoothing in some cases which can harm the final classification performance.
label: none

sentence: Consequently, the proposed regularization technique takes a step of tunable size in the direction of the manifold gradient, which has the effect of smoothing along the direction of the gradient while ignoring its norm.
label: none

sentence: Extensive experiments have been conducted, showing that the proposed approach
label: none

sentence: outperforms or is comparable with recent state-of-the-art approaches on cifar 10, especially in presence of fewer labelled data points.
label: none

sentence: On SVHN however, the proposed approach fails in comparison with (Kumar et al 2017) but performs better than other approaches.
label: none

sentence: Furthermore, it has been shown that adding the proposed manifold regularization technique to the training of GAN greatly improves the image quality of generated images (in terms of FID scores and inception scores).
label: none

sentence: Also, by combining the proposed regularizer with a classical supervised classifier (via pre-training a GAN and using it for regularization) decreases classification error by 2 to 3%.
label: none

sentence: Finally, it has also been shown that after training a GAN using the manifold regularization, the algorithm is able to produce similar images giving a low enough perturbation of the data manifold z.
label: none

sentence: Overall, this paper is well written and show significant improvements especially for image generation.
label: none

sentence: However, the novelty is rather limited as similar ideas have been undertaken (e.g., Mescheder et al 2018), but in different contexts.
label: asp_originality

label: none

label: asp_substance

sentence: It should be stated that bold values in tables do not represent best results (as it is usually the case) but rather results for the proposed approach.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: [Summary]
label: none

sentence: The paper presents a video classification framework that employs 4D convolution to capture longer term temporal structure than the popular 3D convolution schemes.
label: none

sentence: This is achieved by treating the compositional space of local 3D video snippets as an individual dimension where an individual convolution is applied.
label: none

sentence: The 4D convolution is integrated in resnet blocks and implemented via first applying 3D convolution to regular spatio-temporal video volumes and then the compositional space convolution, to leverage existing 3D operators.
label: none

sentence: Empirical evaluation on three benchmarks against other baselines suggested the advantage of the proposed method.
label: none

sentence: [Decision]
label: none

sentence: Overall, the paper addresses an important problem in computer vision (video action recognition) with an interesting.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: I found the motivation and solution are reasonable (despite some questions pending more elaboration), and results also look promising, thus give it a weak accept (conditional on the answers though).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: [Comments]
label: none

sentence: At the conceptual level, the idea of jointly modeling local video events is not novel, and can date back to at least ten years ago in the paper “Learning realistic human actions from movies”, where the temporal pyramid matching was combined with the bag-of-visual-words framework to capture long-term temporal structure.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The problem with this strategy is that the rigid composition only works for actions that can be split into consecutive temporal parts with prefixed duration and anchor points in time, which is clearly challenged by many works later when more complicated video events are studied.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It seems to me that the proposed framework also falls in this category, with a treatment from deep learning.
label: none

sentence: It is definitely worth some discussion on this path.
label: none

sentence: That said, I would like to see more analysis on the behavior of the proposed method under various interesting cases not tested yet.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Despite the claim that the proposed method can capture long-term video patterns, the static compositional nature seems to work best for activities with well-defined local events and clear temporal boundaries.
label: none

sentence: These assumptions hold mostly true for the three datasets used in the experiment, and also are suggested by results in table 2(e), where 3 parts are necessary to achieve optimal results.
label: none

sentence: How does the proposed method perform in more complicated tasks such as
label: asp_replicability

sentence: - action detection or localization (e.g., in benchmarks JHMDB or UCF101-24).
label: none

sentence: - complex video event modeling (e.g., recognizing activities in extended video of TRECVID).
label: none

sentence: Will it still be more favorable than other concerning baselines?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Besides, on the computation side, it would be complexity, an explicit comparison of complexity makes it easier to evaluate the performance when compared to other state-of-the-art methods.
label: none

sentence: [Area to improve]
label: none

sentence: Better literature review to reflect the relevant previous video action recognitions, especially those on video compositional models.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Proof reading
label: none

sentence: - The word in the title should be “Convolutional”, right?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This paper presents a method for unsupervised representation learning of speech.
label: none

sentence: The idea is to first learn discrete representation (vector quantization is done by Gumbel softmax or k-means) from audio samples with contrastive prediction coding type objective, and then perform BERT-style pre-training (borrowed from NLP).
label: none

sentence: The BERT features are used as inputs to ASR systems, rather than the usual log-mel features.
label: none

sentence: The idea, which combines those of previous work (wav2vec and BERT) synergetically, is intuitive and clearly presented, significant improvements over log-mel and wav2vec were achieved on ASR benchmarks WSJ and TIMIT.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Based on these merits, I suggest this paper to be accepted.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: On the other hand, I would suggest directions for investigation and improvements as follows.
label: none

sentence: 1. While I understand that vector quantization makes the use of NLP-style BERT-training possible (as the inputs to NLP models are discrete tokens),  there are potential disadvantages as well.
label: none

sentence: One observation from the submission is that the token set may need to very large (from tens of thousands to millions) for the system to work well, making the BERT training computationally expensive (I noticed that the BERT model is trained on 128 GPUs)
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Also, without BERT pre-training, using directly the discrete tokens seems to consistently give worse performance for ASR.
label: none

sentence: I think some more motivations or explorations (what kind of information did BERT learn) are needed to understand why that is the case.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 2. Besides the computational expensive-ness of the three-step approach (vector quantization, BERT, acoustic model training), the combined model complexity is large because these steps do not share neural network architecture.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: A more economical approach is to use BERT-trained model as initialization for acoustic model training, which is the classical way how RBMs pre-training were used in ASR.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 3. One concern I have with discrete representation is how robust they are wrt different dataset.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The ASR datasets used in this work are relatively clean (but there does exists domain difference between them).
label: none

sentence: It remains to see how the method performs with more acoustically-challenging speech data, and how universally useful the learned features are (as is the case for BERT in NLP).
label: none

sentence: 4. Another curious question is whether the features would still provide as much improvement when a stronger ASR system than AutoSeg (e.g., Lattice-free MMI) is used.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Overall, while I think the computational cost of the proposed method is high, rendering it less practical at this point, I believe the approach has potential and the result obtained so far is already significant.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: This paper proposes a Self-Modulation framework for the generator network in GANs, where middle layers are directly modulated as a function of the generator input z.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, the method is derived via batch normalization (BN), i.e. the learnable scale and shift parameters in BN are assumed to depend on z, through a small one-hidden layer MLP.
label: none

sentence: This idea is something new, although quite straight-forward.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Extensive experiments with varying losses, architectures, hyperparameter settings are conducted to show self-modulation improves baseline GAN performance.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper is mainly empirical, although the authors compute two diagnostic statistics to show the effect of the self-modulation method.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It is still not clear why self-modulation stabilizes the generator towards small conditioning values.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The paper presents two loss functions at the beginning of section 3.1 - the non-saturating loss and the hinge loss.
label: none

sentence: It should be pointed out that the D in the hinge loss represents a neural network output without range restriction, while the D in the non-saturating loss represents sigmoid output, limiting to take in [0,1].
label: asp_substance

sentence: It seems that the authors are not aware of this difference.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In addition to report the median scores, standard deviations should be reported.
label: asp_substance

sentence: comments after reading response ===========
label: none

sentence: I do not see in the updated paper that this typo (in differentiating D in hinge loss and non-saturating loss) is corrected.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Though fundamental understanding can happen asynchronously, I reserve my concern that such empirical method is not substantial enough to motivate acceptance in ICLR, especially considering that in (only) 124/144 (86%) of the studied settings, the results are improved. And there is no analysis of the failure settings.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Second update:
label: none

sentence: We thank the authors for updating their paper.
label: none

sentence: The work is now improving, and is on the right track for publication at a future conference.
label: none

sentence: There are a few comments on the new results, and suggestions for further improvement:
label: none

sentence: * The issue of possible false positives due to sample dependence in fMRI data has again been ignored in the rebuttal.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Without careful treatment of this effect, these results are vacuous.
label: none

sentence: * There is still no comparison with competing nonparametric tests on the fMRI data.
label: asp_substance

sentence: * the results linking the COCO and MINE estimators are interesting.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Some statements don't make sense, however, eg. "HSIC-based estimators tend to have loose confidence intervals due to the need to bound generalization error of kernels f and g on unseen data points.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: " First, f and g are functions, not kernels.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Second, testing with HSIC or COCO does not require generalisation to unseen data points: this is why testing is an easier problem than regression.
label: none

sentence: For HSIC testing, I am surprised to read in the footnote that the Gamma approximation report significantly more than 5% errors, especially given the Table 4 results that show the correct level.
label: none

sentence: In any case, I very strongly suggest using a permutation approach to obtain the test threshold for HSIC, which is by far the most robust and reliable method.
label: none

sentence: The Gamma approximation has no statistical guarantees, as stated explicitly in the HSIC testing paper of NeurIPS 2007.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Permutation gives a guarantee of the correct level.
label: none

sentence: See the NeurIPS paper for details.
label: none

sentence: Once you have verified the correct false positive rate for the permutation threshold, then you can compute the p-value on the alternative.
label: none

sentence: While the comparison with HSIC is a helpful one, it is also required to compare with the competing method closest to yours, i.e.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: the Berrett  and Samworth test.
label: none

sentence: In addition, HSIC is a non-adaptive test, but your test is adaptive, so a fairer comparison would be to a modern adaptive test such as "An Adaptive Test of Independence with Analytic Kernel Embeddings."
label: none

sentence: The false positive rate in the sanity check is far below the design level of 0.05.
label: none

sentence: This is as I expected, given the use of the Hoeffding bound.
label: none

sentence: This should be stated clearly in the main text, and not disclosed in the final sentence of the final page of the appendix.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Update: thank you for your rebuttal.
label: none

sentence: "the necessary and sufficient condition of dependency, is more general and is complementary to other techniques that make stronger assumptions about the data. "
label: none

sentence: The alternative tests listed are nonparametric.
label: none

sentence: That is to say, unlike Pearson correlation, they do not make specific parametric assumptions on the nature of the dependence.
label: none

sentence: Rather they make generic smoothness assumptions (your test also makes such assumptions by the choice of neural network architecture).
label: none

sentence: Thus, comparison with the prior work in Statistics and Machine Learning is relevant, since these tests have the same aims and scope as your tests.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The cited Berrett and Samworth MI test uses a permutation approach to obtaining the test threshold, not an asymptotic approach  (see the results of Section 4 of that paper).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Several of the other cited tests also use a permutation approach for the test threhsold.
label: none

sentence: These tests are therefore relevant prior work.
label: none

sentence: " If things change very little from one second to the next, the signals could be very similar and may not really be, intuitively, independent samples and may bias result of the study.
label: none

sentence: However, which independence assumptions to use is not in scope for our paper,
label: none

sentence: because our fMRI study is trying to show that dependency testing works "
label: none

sentence: In the work cited by Chwialkowski et al, failure to account for the dependence between samples results in excessive false positives.
label: none

sentence: This is because, for dependent data, the effective sample size is reduced, and the tests must be made more conservative to correct for this effect.
label: none

sentence: It is therefore the case that the fMRI results may be false positives.
label: none

sentence: Re level:"This proof could be experimentally verified ..."  This should be verified. In particular, Hoeffding can be very loose in practice, which is likely to be observed in experiments.
label: none

sentence: The authors propose a procedure for improving neural mutual information estimates, via a combination of data augmentation and cross validation.
label: none

sentence: They then use these estimates in hypothesis testing, on low dimensional toy datasets and on high dimensional real-world fMRI data.
label: none

sentence: The improved training procedures for MI estimation are of interest, however the hypothesis testing parts of the paper could still be improved.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In hypothesis testing, it is important to verify that the test has the correct level (false positive rate).
label: none

sentence: This is all the more essential when the estimate has required optimisation over parameters.
label: none

sentence: It is not clear from the presentation that this has been confirmed.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: There are a number of prior approaches to testing for multivariate statistical dependence in the machine learning and statistics literature (including a 2017 paper which uses mutual information).
label: none

sentence: A small selection is given below, although a literature search will reveal many more papers.
label: none

sentence: In the absence of citation or comparison with any of the prior work on multivariate statistical dependence testing, the current submission is not suitable for publication.
label: asp_substance
