sentence: Overall:
label: none

sentence: This paper introduces the Scratchpad Encoder, a novel addition to the sequence to sequence (seq2seq) framework and explore its effectiveness in generating natural language questions from a given logical form.
label: none

sentence: The proposed model enables the decoder at each time step to modify all the encoder outputs, thus using the encoder as a “scratchpad” memory to keep track of what has been generated so far and to guide future generation.
label: none

sentence: Quality and Clarity:
label: none

sentence: -- The paper is well-written and easy to read.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: -- Consider using a standard fonts for the equations.
label: arg_other

sentence: Originality :
label: none

sentence: The idea of question generation: using logical form to generate meaningful questions for argumenting data of QA tasks is really interesting and useful.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Compared to several baselines with a fixed encoder, the proposed model allows the decoder to attentively write “decoding information” to the “encoder” output.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The overall idea and motivation looks very similar to the coverage-enhanced models where the decoder also actively “writes” a message (“coverage”) to the encoder's hidden states.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: In the original coverage paper (Tu et.al, 2016), they also proposed a “neural network based coverage model” where they used a general neural network output to encode attention history, although this paper works differently where it directly updates the encoder hidden states with an update vector from the decoder.
label: none

sentence: However, the modification is slightly marginal but seems quite effective.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It is better to explain the major difference and the motivation of updating the hidden states.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Comments:
label: none

sentence: -- In Equation (13), is there an activation function between W1 and W2?
label: asp_substance

sentence: -- Based on Table 1, why did not evaluate the proposed model with beam-search?
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper considers the problem of dictionary learning.
label: none

sentence: Here the model that we are given samples y, where we know that y = Ax where A is a dictionary matrix, and x is a random sparse vector.
label: none

sentence: The goal is typically to recover the dictionary A, from which one can also recover the x under suitable conditions on A. The paper shows that there is an alternating optimization-based algorithm for this problem that under standard assumptions provably converges exactly to the true dictionary and the true coefficients x (up to some negligible bias).
label: none

sentence: The main comparison with prior work
label: none

sentence: is with [1].
label: none

sentence: Both give algorithms of this type for the same problem, with similar assumptions (although there is some difference; see below).
label: none

sentence: In [1], the authors give two algorithms: one with a better sample complexity than the algorithm presented here, but which has some systematic, somewhat large, error floor which it cannot exceed, and another which can obtain similar rates of convergence to the exact solution, but which requires polynomial sample complexity (the explicit bound is not stated in the paper).
label: none

sentence: The algorithm here seems to build off of the former algorithm; essentially replacing a single hard thresholding step with an IHT-like step.
label: none

sentence: This update rule is able to remove the error floor and achieve exact recovery.
label: none

sentence: However, this makes the analysis substantially more difficult.
label: none

sentence: I am not an expert in this area, but this seems like a nice and non-trivial result.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The proofs are quite dense and I was unable to verify them carefully.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Comments:
label: none

sentence: - The analysis in [1] handles the case of noisy updates, whereas the analysis given here only works for exact updates.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The authors claim that some amount of noise can be tolerated, but do not quantify how much.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - A.4 makes it sound like eps_t needs to be assumed to be bounded, when all that is required is the bound on eps_0.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: [1] Arora, S. Ge, R., Ma, T. and Moitra, A. Simple, Efficient, and Neural Algorithms for Sparse Coding.
label: none

sentence: COLT 2015.
label: none

sentence: This paper presents a method for adapting a model that has been trained to perform one task, so that it can perform a new task (potentially without using any new training data at all—i.e., zero-shot learning).
label: none

sentence: In some ways the presented work is a form of meta-learning or *meta-mapping* as the authors refer to it.
label: none

sentence: The premise of the paper is very interesting and the overall problem is definitely of high interest and high potential impact.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: I believe that the presentation of the proposed method can be significantly improved.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The method description was a bit confusing and unclear to me.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The experimental results presented were all done on small synthetic datasets and it’s hard to evaluate whether the method is practically useful.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Furthermore, no comparisons were provided to any baselines/alternative methods.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: For example, in Sections 4 and 5 I was hoping to see comparisons to methods like MAML.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Also, I felt that the proposed approach in Section 5 is very similar to MAML intuitively. This makes a comparison with MAML even more desirable.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Without any comparisons it’s hard to tell how difficult the tasks under consideration are and what would amount to good performance on the held-out tasks.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In summary, I feel the paper tackles an interesting problem with an interesting approach, but the content could be organized much better.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Also, this work would benefit significantly from a better experimental evaluation.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For these reasons I lean towards rejecting this paper for now, but would love to see it refined for a future machine learning conference.
label: none

sentence: Also, the work by Platanios, et al. on contextual parameter generation is very relevant to this work as it tackles multi-task learning using HyperNetworks.
label: none

sentence: It may be worth adding a short discussion/comparison to that work as it also considers zero-shot learning.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Minor comments:
label: none

sentence: - Capitalize: “section” -> “Section”, “appendix” -> “Appendix”, “fig.” -> “Figure”.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Sometimes these are capitalized, but the use is inconsistent throughout the paper.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - “Hold-out” vs “held-out”
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Be consistent and use “held-out” throughout.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Brief summary:
label: none

sentence: This paper presents a deep decoder model which given a target natural image and a random noise tensor learns to decode the noise tensor into the target image by a series of 1x1 convolutions, RELUs, layer wise normalizations and upsampling.
label: none

sentence: The parameter of the convolution are fitted to each target image, where the source noise tensor is fixed.
label: none

sentence: The method is shown to serve as a good model for natural image for a variety of image processing tasks such as denoising and compression.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: * an interesting model which is quite intriguing in its simplicity.
label: asp_originality

sentence: * good results and good analysis of the model
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: * mostly clear writing and presentation (few typos etc. nothing too serious).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Cons and comments:
label: none

sentence: * The author say explicitly that this is not a convolutional model because of the use of 1x1 convolutions.
label: none

sentence: I disagree and I actually think this is important for two reasons.
label: asp_substance

sentence: First, though these are 1x1 convolutions, because of the up-sampling operation and the layer wise normalizations the influence of each operation goes beyond the 1x1 support.
label: none

sentence: Furthermore, and more importantly is the weight sharing scheme induced by this - using convolutions is a very natural choice for natural images (no pun intended) due to the translation invariant statistics of natural images.
label: none

sentence: I doubt this would have worked so well hadn't it been modeled this way (not to mention this allows a small number of parameters).
label: asp_substance

sentence: * The upsampling analysis is interesting but it is only done on synthetic data - will the result hold for natural images as well? should be easy to try and will allow a better understanding of this choice.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Natural images are only approximately piece-wise smooth after all.
label: none

sentence: * The use of the name "batch-norm" for the layer wise normalization is both wrong and misleading.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This is just channel-wise normalization with some extra parameters - no need to call it this way (even if it's implemented with the same function) as there is no "batch".
label: asp_clarity

sentence: * I would have loved to see actual analysis of the method's performance as a function of the noise standard deviation.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Specifically, for a fixed k, how would performance increase or decrease, and vice versa - for a given noise level, how would k affect performance.
label: asp_substance

sentence: * The actual standard deviation of the noise is not mentioned in any of the experiments (as far as I could tell)
label: asp_clarity

sentence: * What does the decoder produce when taking a trained C on a given image and changing the source noise tensor?
label: asp_substance

sentence: I think that would shed light on what structures are learned and how they propagated in the image, possibly more than Figure 6 (which should really have something to compare to because it's not very informative out of context).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The paper presents a Neural Network based method for learning ordinal embeddings only from triplet comparisons.
label: none

sentence: A nice, easy to read paper, with an original idea.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Still, there are some issues the authors should address:
label: none

sentence: - for the experiment with Imagenet images, it is not very clear how many pictures are used. Is this number 2500?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: - the authors state that they use "the power of DNNs" while they are experimenting with a neural network with only 4 layers. While there is no clear line between shallow and deep neural networks, I would argue that a 4 layer NN is rather shallow.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - the authors fix the number of layers of the used network based on "our experience". For the sake of completeness, more experiments in this area would be nice.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - for Figure 6, there is not a clear conclusion.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: While, it supports that " that logarithmic growth of the layer width respect to n is enough to obtain desirable performance."  I don't see a clear conclusion of how to pick the width of hidden layers, maybe a better representation could be used.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: - I don't see a discussion about the downsides of the method (for example, the large number of triplet comparison examples needed for training; and possible methods to overcome this problem).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - in section 4.4
label: asp_substance

sentence: when comparing the proposed approach with another methods why not use more complex datasets (like those used in section 4.3)
label: none

sentence: - in section 4.3, there is no guarantee that the intersection between the training set and test set is empty.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - in section 4.3 how is the reconstruction built (Figure 3b)?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: A few typos found:
label: none

sentence: - In figure 3 (c) "number |T of input" should be  "number |T| of input"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - In figure 5 (a) "cencept" should be "concept"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - In figure 8 "Each column corresponds to ..." should be "Each row corresponds to ...".
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - In the last paragraph of A1 "growth of the layer width respect" should be "growth of the layer width with respect"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - In the second paragraph of A2 "hypothesize the that relation" should be "hypothesize that the relation".
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - In section 4.3 last paragraph, first sentence: "with the maximunm number" should be "with the maximum number"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors present an architecture search method where connections are removed with sparse regularization.
label: none

sentence: It produces good network blocks relatively quickly that perform well on CIFAR/ImageNet.
label: none

sentence: There are a few grammatical/spelling errors that need ironing out.
label: arg_other

sentence: e.g. "In specific" --> "Specifically" in the abstract, "computational budge" -> "budget" (page 6) etc.
label: asp_substance

sentence: A few (roughly chronological comments).
label: none

sentence: - Pioneering work is not necessarily equivalent to "using all the GPUs"
label: asp_substance

sentence: - There are better words than "decent" to describe the performance of DARTS, as it's very similar to the results in this work!
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - From figure 2 it's not clear why all non-zero connections in (b) are then equally weighted in (c). Would keeping the non-zero weightings be at all helpful?
label: asp_substance

sentence: -  Why have you chosen the 4 operations at the bottom of page 4? It appears to be a subset of those used in DARTS.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - How do you specifically encode the number of surviving connections? Is it entirely dependent on budget?
label: asp_substance

sentence: - You should add DARTS 1st order to table 1.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Measuring in GPU days is only meaningful if you use the same GPU make for every experiment. Which did you use?
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The ablation study is good, and the results are impressive.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I propose a marginal acceptance for this paper as it produces impressive results in what appears to be a short amount of search time.
label: none

sentence: However, the implementation details are hazy, and some design choices (which operations, hyperparameters etc.) aren't well justified.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: UPDATE: Score changed based on author resposne
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes a method to address the interesting task, i.e. controllable human activity synthesis, by conditioning on the previous frames and the input control signal.
label: none

sentence: To synthesis the next frame, a Pose2Pose network is proposed to first transfer the input information into the next frame body structure and object.
label: none

sentence: Then, a Pose2Frame network is applied to generate the final result.
label: none

sentence: The results on several video sequences look nice with more natural boundaries, object, and backgrounds
label: none

sentence: compared to previous methods.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: 1. The proposed Pose2Pose successfully transfer the pose conditioned on the past pose and the input control signal.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The proposed conditioned residual block, occlusion augmentation and stopping criteria seem to help the Pose2Pose network work well.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Besides, the object is also considered in this network, which makes the method generalized well to the videos where human holds some rigid object.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 2. The Pose2Frame network is similar to previous works but learns to predict the soft mask to incorporate the complex background and to produce shallow.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The mask term in Eq. (7) seems to work well for the foreground (body+object) and the shallow regions.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 3. The paper is easy to follow.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Cons:
label: none

sentence: 1. Since the method is only evaluated on several video sequences, I am not sure how the method will perform on other different scenes.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Results on more scenes will make the performance more convincing.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I also wonder if the video data will be released, which could be important for the following comparisons.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: 2. As to the results of the Pose2Pose network, I wonder if there are some artifacts that will affect the performance of the Pose2Frame network.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Then, there will be another question: how the two networks are trained? Are they trained separately or jointly?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: I assume the authors first train the Pose2Pose network, then use the output to train the Pose2Frame network.
label: none

sentence: Otherwise, the artifacts from Pose2Pose will affect the testing performance of the Pose2Frame network.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 3. The mask term seems to work well for the shallow part.
label: none

sentence: I wonder how the straightforward regression term plus the smooth term will perform for the mask.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Here, the straightforward regression term means directly regress the output mask to the target densepose mask. Will the proposed mask term perform better?
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper studied learning unsupervised node embeddings by considering the structural properties of networks.
label: none

sentence: Experimental results on a few data sets prove the effective of the proposed approaches over existing state-of-the-art approaches for unsupervised node embeddings.
label: none

label: none

sentence: - important problem and interesting idea

sentence: - the proposed approach seems to be effective according to the experiments

label: none

label: asp_clarity

label: asp_replicability

sentence: - In Table 2 and 3, how are the degree and block information leveraged into the model?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: This paper present extensions of the Self-Attention Generative Adversarial Network approach SAGAN, leading to impressive images generations conditioned on imagenet classes.
label: none

sentence: The key components of the approach are :
label: none

sentence: - increasing the batch size by a factor 8
label: none

sentence: - augmenting the width of the networks by 50%
label: none

sentence: These first two elements result in an Inception score (IS) boost from 52 to 93.
label: none

sentence: - the use of shared embeddings for the class conditioned batch norm layers, orthonormal regularization and hierarchical latent space bring an additional boost of IS 99.
label: none

sentence: The core novel element of the paper is the truncation trick: At train time, the input z is sampled from a normal distribution but at test time, a truncated normal distribution is used: when the magnitude of elements of z are above a certain threshold, they are re-sampled.
label: none

sentence: Variations of this threshold lead to variations in FD and IS, as shown in insightful experiments.
label: none

sentence: The comments that more data helps (internal dataset experiments) is also informative.
label: none

sentence: Very nice to have included negative results and detailed parameter sweeps.
label: none

sentence: This is a very nice work with impressive results, a great progress achievement in the field of image generation.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Very well written.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Suggestions/questions:
label: none
