sentence: The paper proposes pre-training strategies (PT) for graph neural networks (GNN) from both node and graph levels.
label: none

sentence: Two new large-scale pre-training datasets are created and extensive experiments are conducted to demonstrate the benefits of PT upon different GNN architectures.
label: none

sentence: I am relative positive for this work.
label: none

sentence: Detail review of different aspects and questions are as follows.
label: none

sentence: Novelty: As far as I know, this work is among the earliest works to think about GNN pre-training.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The most similar paper at the same period is [Z Hu, arXiv:1905.13728]
label: none

sentence: I read both papers and found they have similar idea about PT although they have different designs.
label: none

sentence: This paper leverages graph structure (e.g., context neighbors) and supervised labels/attributes (e.g., node attributes, graph labels) for PT.
label: none

sentence: These strategies are not surprising for me and the novelty is incremental.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Experiment: The experiments are overall good.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors created two new large scale pre-training graph datasets.
label: none

sentence: Experimental results of different GNN architectures w/o different PT for different tasks are provided.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Comparing to non-pretraining GNN, the improvements are significant for most cases.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Writing: The writing is good and easy to follow.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Questions: I would like to see more discussion about difference between this work and [Z Hu, arXiv:1905.13728].
label: asp_substance

sentence: Comparing to the other work, what are strengths of this work? In addition, have the authors compared the performances of their work and [Z Hu, arXiv:1905.13728] using the same data?
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper explores how well different visual reasoning models can learn systematic generalization on a simple binary task.
label: none

sentence: They create a simple synthetic dataset, involving asking if particular types of objects are in a spatial relation to others.
label: none

sentence: To test generalization, they lower the ratio of observed  combinations of objects in the training data.
label: none

sentence: The authors show the result that tree structured neural module networks generalize very well, but other strong visual reasoning approaches do not.
label: none

sentence: They also explore whether appropriate structures can be learned.
label: none

sentence: I think this is a very interesting area to explore, and the paper is clearly written and presented.
label: none

sentence: As the authors admit, the main result is not especially surprising.
label: asp_originality

sentence: I think everyone agrees that we can design models that show particular kinds of generalization by carefully building inductive bias into the architecture, and that it's easy to make these work on the right toy data.
label: none

sentence: However, on less restricted data, more general architectures seem to show better generalization (even if it is not systematic).
label: none

sentence: What I really want this paper to explore is when and why this happens.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Even on synthetic data, when do or don't we see generalization (systematic or otherwise) from NMNs/MAC/FiLM?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: MAC in particular seems to have an inductive bias that might make some forms of systematic generalization possible.
label: none

sentence: It might be the case that their version of NMN can only really do well on this specific task, which would be less interesting.
label: none

sentence: All the models show very high training accuracy, even if they do not show systematic generalization.
label: none

sentence: That suggests that from the point of view of training, there are many equally good solutions, which suggests a number of interesting questions. If you did large numbers of training runs, would the models occasionally find the right solution? Could you somehow test for if a given trained model will show systematic generalization?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Is there any way to help the models find the "right" (or better) solutions - e.g. adding regularization, or changing the model size?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Overall, I do think the paper has makes a contribution in experimentally showing a setting where tree-structured NMNs can show better systematic generalization than other visual reasoning approaches.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: However, I feel like the main result is a bit too predictable, and for acceptance I'd like to see a much more detailed exploration of the questions around systematic generalization.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors consider the setting of a RL agent that exclusively receives intrinsic reward during training that is intended to model curiosity; technically, ‘curiosity’ is quantified by the ability of the agent to predict its own forward dynamics [Pathak, et al., ICML17].
label: none

sentence: This study primarily centers around an initially somewhat surprising result that non-trivial policies can be learned for many ’simpler’ video games (e.g., Atari, Super Mario, Pong) using just curiosity as reward.
label: none

sentence: While this is primarily an empirical study, one aspect considered was the observation representation (raw pixels, random features, VAE, and inverse dynamics features [Pathak, et al., ICML17]).
label: none

sentence: In examining reward curves (generally extrinsic during testing), ‘curiosity-based’ reward generally works with the representation effectiveness varying across different testbeds.
label: none

sentence: They also conduct more in-depth experiments on specific testbeds to study the dynamics (e.g., Super Mario, Juggling, Ant Robot, Multi-agent Pong) — perhaps most interestingly showing representation-based transfer of different embeddings across levels in Super Mario.
label: none

sentence: Finally, they consider the Unity maze testbed, combining intrinsic rewards with the end-state goal reward to generate a more dense reward space.
label: none

sentence: From a high level perspective, this is an interesting result that ostensibly will lead to a fair amount of discussion within the RL community (and already has based on earlier versions of this work).
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: However, it isn’t entirely clear if the primary contribution is showing that ‘curiosity reward’ is a potentially promising approach or if game environments aren’t particularly good testbeds for practical RL algorithms — given the lack of significant results on more realistic domains, my intuition leans toward the later (the ant robot is interesting, but one can come up with ‘simulator artifact’ based explanations).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: And honestly, I think the paper reads as if leaning toward the same conclusion.
label: none

sentence: Regardless, given the prevalence of these types of testbed environments, either is a useful discussion to have. Maybe the end result could minimally be a new baseline that can help quantify the ‘difficulty’ of a particular environment.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: From the perspective of a purely technical contribution, there are fewer exciting results.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The basic method is taken from [Parthak, et al., ICML17] (modulo some empirical choices such as using PPO).
label: none

sentence: The comparison of different observation representations doesn’t include any analytical component, the empirical component is primarily inconclusive, and the position statements are fairly non-controversial (and not really conclusively supported).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The testbeds all existed previously and this is mostly the effort of pulling then together.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Even the ‘focused experiments’ can be explained with the intuitive narrative that in the state/action space, there is always more uncertainty the farther one goes from the starting point and this is more of a result of massive computation being applied primarily to problems that are designed to provide some level of novelly (the Roboschool examples are a bit more interesting, but also less conclusive).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Finally, Figure 5 is interesting in showing that ‘curiosity + extrinsic’ improves over extrinsic rewards — although this isn’t particularly surprising for maze navigation that has such sparse rewards and can be viewed as something like ‘active exploration’.
label: asp_substance

sentence: With respect to this specific setting, the authors may want to consider [Mirowski, et al., Learning to Navigate in Complex Environments, ICLR17] with respect to auxiliary loss + RL extrinsic rewards to improve performance (in this case, also in maze environments).
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: In just considering the empirical results, they clearly entail a fair amount of effort and just a dump of the code and experiments on the community will likely lead to new findings (even if they are that game simulators are weaker testbeds than previously thought).
label: none

sentence: It is easy to ask for additional experiments (i.e., other mechanisms of uncertainty such as the count-based discussed in related work, other settings in 2.2) — but the quality seems high enough that I basically trust the settings and findings.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Beyond the core findings, the other settings are less convincingly supported by seem more like work in progress and this paper is really just a scaling-up of [Pathak, et al., ICML17] without generating any strong results regarding questions around representation, what to do about stochasticity (although the discussion regarding something like ‘curiosity honeypots’ is interesting).
label: asp_originality

sentence: Thus, it reads like one interesting finding around curiosity-driven RL working in games plus a bunch of preliminary findings trying to grasp at some explanations and potential future directions.
label: none

sentence: Evaluating the paper along the requested dimensions:
label: none

sentence: = Quality: The paper is well-written with a large set of experiments, making the case that exclusively using curiosity-based reward is very promising for the widely-used game RL testbeds.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Modulo a few pointers, the work is well-contextualized and makes reasonable assumptions in conducting its experiments.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The submitted code and videos result in a high-quality presentation and trustworthiness of the results.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: = Clarity: The paper is very clearly written. (7/10)
label: asp_clarity

sentence: = Originality: The algorithmic approach is a combination of [Parthak, et al., ICML17] and [Schulman, et al. 2017] (with some experiments using [Kingma & Welling, 2013]).
label: none

sentence: All of the testbeds have been used previously.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Other than completely relying on curiously-based reward exclusively, there is little here.
label: asp_originality

sentence: In considering combining with extrinsic rewards, I would also consider [Mirowski, et al., ICLR17], which is actually more involved in this regard.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: = Significance: Primarily, this ‘finishes’ [Parthak, et al., ICML17] to its logical conclusion for game-based environments and should spur interesting conversations and further research.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: In terms of actual technical contributions, I believe much less significant.
label: asp_substance

sentence: === Pros ===
label: none

sentence: + demonstrates that curiosity-based reward works in simpler game environments
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: + (implicitly) calls into question the value of these testbed environments
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: + well written, with a large set of experiments and some interesting observations/discussions
label: asp_substance

sentence: === Cons ===
label: none

sentence: - little methodological innovation or analytical explanations
label: asp_originality

sentence: - offers minimal (but some) evidence that curiosity-based reward works in more realistic settings
label: arg_other

sentence: - doesn’t answer the one question regarding observation representation that it set out to evaluate
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - the more interesting problem, RL + auxiliary loss isn’t evaluated in detail
label: asp_substance

sentence: - presumably, the sample complexity is ridiculous
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Overall, I am ambivalent.
label: none

sentence: I think that more casual ML/RL researchers will find these results controversial and surprising while more experienced researchers will see curiosity-driven learning to be explainable primarily by the intuition of the “The fact that the curiosity reward is often sufficient” paragraph of page 6, demanding more complex environments before accepting that this form of curiosity is particularly useful.
label: none

sentence: The ostensible goal of learning more about observation representations is mostly preliminary — and this direction holds promise of for a stronger set of findings.
label: none

sentence: Dealing with highly stochastic environments seems a potential fatal flaw of the assumptions of this method.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: However, as I said previously, this is probably a discussion worth having given the popularity and visibility of game-based testbeds — so, coupled with the overall quality of the paper, I lean toward a weak accept.
label: none

sentence: This paper makes concerted efforts to examine the existing beliefs about the significance of various statistical characteristics of hidden layer activations (or representations) in a DNN.
label: none

sentence: In the past, many works have argued for encouraging the certain statistical behavior of these representations (e.g., sparsity, low correlation etc) in order to have better classification accuracy.
label: none

sentence: However, this paper tries to argue that such efforts are not very useful as these statistical characteristics don't provide any systematic explanation for the performance of DNNs across different settings.
label: none

sentence: First, the paper argues that given a DNN, it's possible to construct either an identical output network or a comparable network that can have very different behavior for some of the statistical characteristics.
label: none

sentence: This casts doubt on the usefulness of these characteristics in explaining the performance of the network.
label: none

sentence: The paper conducts experiments with different regularizers associated with some of the standard statistical characteristics using the MNIST, CIFAR-10, and CIFAR-100 datasets.
label: none

sentence: The paper claims that for each dataset the best performing network cannot be attributed to any single regularizer.
label: none

sentence: For the same set of regularizers and the MNIST dataset, the paper then explores the mutual information between the inputs and the hidden layer activations.
label: none

sentence: The paper observes that the best performing regularizer is the one which minimizes this mutual information.
label: none

sentence: Therefore, it is plausible that the mutual information regularization can consistently explain the performance of an NN.
label: none

sentence: The paper addresses an interesting problem and makes some good contributions.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: However, the reviewer feels that the brief treatment of mutual information regularizer leaves something to be desired.
label: none

sentence: Did the authors also examine the relationship between mutual information and generalization error for CIFAR data sets? Does it not make sense to examine this for all (most of) the setups considered in Table 4, 8, and 9.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In these tables, how do the authors decide which hidden layer representations should be explored for their statistical characteristics?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The reviewer feels that for CIFAR-10 and 100, some regularizers do consistently give best or close to best networks. Could the authors comment on this?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The paper proposes using the Frank-Wolfe algorithm for fast adversarial attacks.
label: none

sentence: They prove upper bounds on the Frank-Wolfe gap and show experimentally that they can attack successfully much faster than other algorithms.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In general I find the paper novel (to the best of my somewhat limited knowledge), interesting and well written.
label: asp_originality

sentence: However I find the white-box experiments lacking as almost every method has 100% success rate.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Fixing this would significantly improve the paper.
label: none

sentence: Main remarks:
label: none

sentence: - Need more motivation for faster white-box attack.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: One good motivation for example is adversarial training, e.g. Kurakin et al 2017 ‘ADVERSARIAL MACHINE LEARNING AT SCALE’ that would benefit greatly from faster attacks
label: none

sentence: - White-box attack experiments don’t really prove the strength of the method, even with imagenet experiments, as almost all attacks get 100% success rate making it hard to compare.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Need to compare in more challenging settings where the success rate is meaningful, e.g. smaller epsilon or a more robust NN using some defence.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Also stating the 100% success rate in the abstract is a bit misleading for the this reason.
label: asp_substance

sentence: -Something is a bit weird with the FGM results. While it is a weaker attack, a 0%/100% disparity between it and every other
label: asp_clarity

sentence: attack seems odd.
label: none

sentence: -The average distortion metric (that’s unfavourable to your method anyway) doesn’t really mean anything as the constraint optimization has no incentive to find a value smaller than the constraint.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - Regarding lambda>1, you write that “we argue this modification makes our algorithm more general, and gives rise to better attack results”.
label: none

sentence: I did not see any theoretical or empirical support for this in the paper.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Also, it seems quite strange to me that making the FW overshot and then projecting back would be beneficial.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Some intuitive explanation on why this should help and/or empirical comparison would be a great addition.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The authors claim that this is the first zeroth-order non-convex FW convergence rate, I am not familiar enough with the field to evaluate this claim and its significance.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Alg. 1 for T>1 is very similar to I-FGM, but also ‘pulls’ x_t towards x_orig.
label: none

sentence: It would be very useful to write the update more explicitly and compare and contrast this 2 very similar updates.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This gives nice insight into why this should intuitively work better.
label: none

sentence: - I am not sure what the authors mean by “the Frank-Wolfe gap is affine invariant”. If we scale the input space by a, the gap should be scaled by a^2 - how/why is it invariant?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - I am not sure what you mean in 5.4 “we omit all grid search/ binary search steps
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Minor remarks:
label: none

sentence: - In remark 4.8 in the end option I and II are inverted by mistake
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - In 5.1, imagenet results are normally top-5 error rate not top-1 acc, would be better to report that more familiar number.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - In the proof you wrongfully use the term telescope sum twice, there is nothing telescopic about the sum it is just bound by the max value times the length.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In the manuscript entitled "Neural Causal Discovery with Learnable Input Noise" the authors describe a method for automated causal inference under the scenario of a stream of temporally structured random variables (with no missingness and a look-back window of given size).
label: none

sentence: The proposed approach combines a novel measure of the importance of fidelty in each variable to predictive accuracy of the future system state ("learnable noise risk") with a flexible functional approximation (neural network).
label: none

sentence: Although the setting (informative temporal data) is relatively restricted with respect to the general problem of causal inference, this is not unreasonable given the proposed direction of application to automated reasoning in machine learning.
label: none

sentence: The simulation and real data experiments are interesting and seem well applied.
label: asp_substance

sentence: A concern I have is that the manuscript as it stands is positioned somewhere between two distinct fields (sparse learning/feature selection, and causal inference for counterfactual estimation/decision making), but doesn't entirely illustrate its relationship to either.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: In particular, the derived criterion is comparable to other sparsity-inducing penalities on variable inclusion in machine learning models; although it has motivation in causality it is not exclusively derived from this position, so one might wonder how alternative sparsity penalities might perform on the same challenge.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Likewise, it is not well explained what is the value of the learnt relationships, and how uncertainty and errors in the causal learning are relevant to the downstream use of the learnt model.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In the ordinary feature selection regime one is concerned simply with improving the predictive capacity of models: e.g. a non-linear model might be fit using just the causal variables that might out-perform both a linear model and a non-linear model fit using all variables.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Here the end goal is less clear; this is understandable in the sense that the work is positioned as a piece in a grand objective, but it would seem valuable to nevertheless describe some concrete example(s) to elucidate this aspect of the algorithm (use case / error effects downstream).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The paper proposes a novel training method for variational autoencoders that allows using partially-observed data with multiple modalities.
label: none

sentence: A modality can be a whole block of features (e.g., a MNIST image) or just a single scalar feature.
label: none

sentence: The probabilistic model contains a latent vector per modality.
label: none

sentence: The key idea is to use two types of encoder networks: a unimodal encoder for every modality which is used when the modality is observed, and a shared multimodal encoder that is provided all the observed modalities and produces the latent vectors for the unobserved modalities.
label: none

sentence: The whole latent vector is passed through a decoder that predicts the mask of observed modalities, and another decoder that predicts the actual values of all modalities.
label: none

sentence: The “ground truth” values for the unobserved modalities are provided by sampling from the corresponding latent variables from the prior distribution once at some point of training.
label: none

sentence: While I like the premise of the paper, I feel that it needs more work.
label: asp_substance

sentence: My main concern is that sampling the target values for the unobserved modalities from the prior would almost necessarily lead to blurry synthetic “ground truth” for these modalities, which in turn means that the model would produce underconfident predictions for them.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The samples from MNIST in Figure 3 are indeed very blurry, supporting this.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Furthermore, the claims of the model working for non-MCAR missingness are not substantiated by the experiments.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I believe that the paper should currently be rejected, but I encourage the authors to revise the paper.
label: arg_other

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: * Generative modelling of partially observed data is a very important topic that would benefit from fresh ideas and new approaches
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: * I really like the idea of explicitly modelling the mask/missingness vector. I agree with the authors that this should help a lot with non completely random missingness.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Cons:
label: none

sentence: * The text is quite hard to read.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: There are many typos (see below).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The text is over the 8 page limit, but I don’t think this is justified.
label: none

sentence: For example, the paragraph around Eqn. (11) just says that the decoder takes in a concatenated latent vector.
label: none

sentence: The MNIST+SVHN dataset setup is described in detail, yet there is no summary of the experimental results, which are presented in the appendix.
label: asp_substance

sentence: * The approach taken to train on partially-observed data is described in three sentences after the Eqn. (10).
label: none

sentence: The non-observed dimensions are imputed by reconstructions from the prior from a partially trained model.
label: none

sentence: I think that this is the crux of the paper that should be significantly expanded and experimentally validated.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It is possible that due to this design choice the method would not produce sharper reconstructions than the original samples from the prior.
label: none

sentence: Figures 3, 5 and 6 indeed show very blurry samples from the model.
label: none

sentence: Furthermore, it is not obvious to me why these prior samples would be sensible at all, given that all modalities have independent latents by construction.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: * The paper states multiple times that VAEAC [Ivanov et al., 2019] cannot handle partially missing data, but I don’t think this is true, since their missing features imputation experiment uses the setup of 50% truly missing features.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The trick they use is adding “synthetic” missing features in addition to the real ones and only train on those.
label: none

sentence: See Section 4.3.3 of that paper for more details.
label: none

sentence: * The paper states that “it can model the joint distribution of the data and the mask together and avoid limiting assumptions such as MCAR”.
label: none

sentence: However, all experiments only show results in the MCAR setting, so the claim is not experimentally validated.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: * The baselines in the experiments could be improved.
label: asp_substance

sentence: First of all, the setup for the AE and VAE is not specified.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Secondly, it would be good to include a GAN-based baseline such as GAIN, as well as some more classic feature imputation method, e.g. MICE or MissForest.
label: asp_substance

sentence: * The experiments do not demonstrate that the model learns a meaningful *conditional* distribution for the missing modalities, since the provided figures show just one sample per conditioning image.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Questions to the authors:
label: none

sentence: 1. Could you comment on the differences in your setup in Section 4.1 compared to the VAEAC paper? I’ve noticed that the results you report for this method significantly differ from the original paper, e.g. for VAEAC on Phishing dataset you report PFC of 0.24, whereas the original paper reports 0.394; for Mushroom it’s 0.403 vs. 0.244. I’ve compared the experimental details yet couldn’t find any differences, for example the missing rate is 0.5 in both papers.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 2. How do you explain that all methods have NRMSE > 1 on the Glass dataset (Table 1), meaning that they all most likely perform worse than a constant baseline?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Summary: the paper purposes a dataset of abductive language inference and generation.
label: none

sentence: The dataset is generated by human, while the testing set is adversarially selected using BERT.
label: none

sentence: The paper experiments the popular deep learning models on the dataset and observe shortcoming of deep learning on this task.
label: none

sentence: Comments: overall, the problem on abductive inference and abductive generation in language in very interesting and important.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: This dataset seems valuable. And the paper is simple and well-written.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Concerns: I find the claim on deep networks kind of irresponsible.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 1. The dataset is adversarially filtered using BERT and GPT, which gives deep learning model a huge disadvantage. After all, the paper says BERT scores 88% before the dataset is attacked.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 2. The human score of 91.4% is based on majority vote, which should be compared with an ensemble of deep learning prediction.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: To compare the author should use the average score of human.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: 3. The ground truth is selected by human.
label: none

sentence: On a high level, the main difficulty of abduction is to search in the exponentially large space of hypothesis.
label: none

sentence: Formulating the abduction task as a (binary) classification problem is less interesting.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The generative task is a better option.
label: none

sentence: Decision: despite the seeming unfair comparison, this task is novel. I vote for weak accept.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The authors seek to make it practical to use the full-matrix version of Adagrad’s adaptive preconditioner (usually one uses the diagonal version), by storing the r most recently-seen gradient vectors in a matrix G, and then showing that (GG^T)^(-½) can be calculated fairly efficiently (at the cost of one r*r matrix inversion, and two matrix multiplications by an r*d matrix).
label: none

sentence: This is a really nice trick.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I’m glad to see that the authors considered adding momentum (to adapt ADAM to this setting), and their experiments show a convincing benefit in terms of performance *per iteration*. Interestingly, they also show that the models found by their method also don’t generalize poorly, which is noteworthy and slightly surprising.
label: asp_substance

sentence: However, their algorithm--while much less computationally expensive than true full-matrix adaptive preconditioning---is still far more expensive than the usual diagonal version.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: In Appendix B.1, they report mixed results in terms of wall-clock time, and I strongly feel that these results should be in the main body of the paper.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: One would *expect* the proposed approach to work better than diagonal preconditioning on a per-iteration basis (at least in terms of training loss).
label: none

sentence: A reader’s most natural question is whether there is a large enough improvement to offset the extra computational cost, so the fact that wall-clock times are relegated to the appendix is a significant weakness.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Finally, the proposed approach seems to sort of straddle the line between traditional convex optimization algorithms, and the fast stochastic algorithms favored in machine learning.
label: none

sentence: In particular, I think that the proposed algorithm has a more-than-superficial resemblance to stochastic LBFGS: the main difference is that LBFGS approximates the inverse Hessian, instead of (GG^T)^(-½).
label: none

sentence: It would be interesting to see how these two algorithms stack up.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Overall, I think that this is an elegant idea and I’m convinced that it’s a good algorithm, at least on a per-iteration basis.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: However, it trades-off computational cost for progress-per-iteration, so I think that an explicit analysis of this trade-off (beyond what’s in Appendix B.1) must be in the main body of the paper.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper proposes an approach to adapt hyperparameters online.
label: none

sentence: When learning rates are in focus, a convincing message would be to show that adaptation of learning rates is more efficient and simpler than their scheduling when tested on state-of-the-art architectures.
label: asp_substance

sentence: A. You demonstrate the results on CIFAR-10 for 10% error rates which corresponds to networks which are far from what is currently used in deep learning.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Thus, it is hard to say whether the results are applicable in practice.
label: asp_substance

sentence: B. You don't schedule learning rates for your baseline methods except for a single experiment for some initial learning rate.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: C. Your method involves a hyperparameter to be tuned which affects the shape of the schedule.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This hyperparameter itself benefits from (requires?) some scheduling.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It would be interesting to see if the proposed method is competitive for training contemporary networks and w.r.t. simple schedule schemes.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Online tuning of  hyperparameters is an important functionality and I hope your paper will make it more straightforward to use it in practice.
label: none

sentence: * Minor notes:
label: none

sentence: You mention that "APO converges quickly from different starting points on the Rosenbrock surface" but 10000 iterations is not quick at all for the 2-dimensional Rosenbrock, it is extremely slow compared to 100-200 function evaluations needed for Nelder-Mead to solve it. I guess you mean
label: none

sentence: w.r.t. the original RMSprop.
label: none

sentence: This manuscript studies mutual-information estimation, in particular variational lower bounds, and focuses on reducing their sample complexity.
label: none

sentence: The first contribution is based on adapting the MINE energy-based MI estimator family to out-of-sample testing.
label: none

sentence: MINE involves fitting a very flexible parametric form of the distribution, such as a neural network, to the data to derive a mutual information lower bound.
label: none

sentence: The present work separates the data fitting from the mutual information evaluation to decrease sample complexity, the argument being that the function class is no longer a limiting factor to sample complexity of the mutual information estimation.
label: none

sentence: The second contribution uses meta learning to decrease the sample complexity required to fit the neural network, creating a family of tasks derived from the data with data transformation that do not modify the mutual information.
label: none

sentence: The approaches are demonstrated on synthetic data as well as fMRI data, to detect significant inter-subject dependencies in time-series of neural responses.
label: none

sentence: There are some very interesting and strong contributions of this manuscript.
label: asp_substance

sentence: However, I worry that one of the central theoretical arguments does not seem correct to me.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Indeed, the manuscript introduces sample complexity results to justify the benefits of the out-of-sample procedure (th 1), but it seems to me that these give an incomplete picture.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Th 1 gives the number of validation samples required to bound error between the mutual information estimate at finite samples and asymptotically for a function T parametrized by \tilda{theta}. This control is of a very different nature from the control established by MIME which controls the error to the actual best possible variational bound.
label: none

sentence: In other terms, the control of th 1 does not control the estimation error of T. This is the reason why it is independent from the function class.
label: none

sentence: The total error in estimating the mutual information must take this error in account, and not only the validation error.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Hence the theoretical sample complexities contributed are not comparable to those of MIME.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The meta-learning estimator seems to involve a significant implementation complexity, for instance heuristic switchs between estimation approaches.
label: none

sentence: The danger is that could hard to make reliable in a wide set of applications.
label: none

sentence: It would be more convincing to see more experiments.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Along this direction, it is problematic that, in the synthetic examples, the relative  performance of methods changes significantly from experiment to experiment and there does not seem to be a simple way to control that.
label: asp_substance

sentence: On the other hand, the MIME-f-ES tends to have a reasonably good failure mode.
label: none

sentence: I would have been interested in "false detection" experiments: comparing estimator in a variety of problems where the mutual information is zero, but for different marginal distribution.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This is particularly important when the application is to test for independence, as in the fMRI experiments.
label: none

sentence: For hyper-parameter search (using hyperopt), the manuscript should make it explicit what metric is optimized.
label: none

sentence: Is it the data fit of the neural networks? With what specific measure?
label: asp_substance

sentence: With regards to the fMRI experiments, good baselines are missing: DEMINE is compared to Pearson correlation.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Additionally, CNNs are not a particularly good architecture for fMRI, as fMRI is not locally translation invariant (see Aydöre ICML 2019 for instance).
label: none

sentence: Finally, it seems that the goal here is to test for independence.
label: none

sentence: In such a situation, there are better strategies for higher-order tests of independence than estimating mutual information, in particular estimator that give a control p-value.
label: asp_substance

label: none

sentence: Alg 1 seems a fairly generic neural-network fitting algorithm.
label: none

sentence: In its current state, I am not sure that it adds a lot to the manuscript.
label: asp_substance

sentence: There are many acronyms that are never defined: MINE, TCPC

sentence: - Summary
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes a neural architecture search method based on a direct sparse optimization, where the proposed method provides a novel model pruning view to the neural architecture search problem.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, the proposed method introduces scaling factors to connections between operations, and impose sparse regularizations to prune useless connections in the network.
label: none

sentence: The proposed method is evaluated on CIFAR-10 and ImageNet dataset.
label: none

sentence: - Pros
label: none

sentence: - The proposed method shows competitive or better performance than existing neural architecture search methods.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The experiments are conducted thoroughly in the CIFAR-10 and ImageNet.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The selection of the datasets is appropriate.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Also, the selection of the methods to be compared is appropriate.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The effect of each proposed technique is appropriately evaluated.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Cons
label: none

sentence: - The search space of the proposed method, such as the number of operations in the convolution block, is limited.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - The proposed method does not outperform the existing state-of-the-art methods in terms of classification accuracy.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The technical contribution of the proposed method is not high, because the architecture space of neural network is similar to the prior works.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Overall, if we focus on the balance between the classification accuracy and computational efficiency, the proposed method is promising.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The paper investigates the Frank-Wolfe (FW) algorithm for constructing adversarial examples both in a white-box and black-box setting.
label: none

sentence: The authors provide both a theoretical analysis (convergence to a stationary point) and experiments for an InceptionV3 network on ImageNet.
label: none

sentence: The main claim is that the proposed algorithm can construct adversarial examples faster than various baselines (PGD, I-FGSM, CW, etc.), and from fewer queries in a black-box setting.
label: none

sentence: The FW algorithm is a classical method in optimization, but (to the best of my knowledge) has not yet been evaluated yet for constructing adversarial examples.
label: none

sentence: Hence it is a natural question to understand whether FW performs significantly better than current algorithms in this context.
label: none

sentence: Indeed, the authors find that FW is 6x - 20x faster for constructing white-box adversarial examples than a range of relevant baseline, which is a significant speed-up.
label: none

sentence: However, there are several points about the experiments that are unclear to me:
label: none

sentence: - It is well known that the running times of optimization algorithms are highly dependent on various hyperparameters such as the step size.
label: none

sentence: But the authors do not seem to describe how they chose the hyperparameters for the baselines algorithms.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Hence it is unclear how large the running time improvement is compared to a well-tuned baseline.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - Other algorithms in the comparison achieve a better distortion (smaller perturbation).
label: none

sentence: Since finding an adversarial with smaller perturbation is a harder problem, it is unclear how the algorithms compare for finding adversarial examples with similar distortion.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Instead of reporting a single time-vs-distortion data point, the authors could show the full trade-off curve.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - The authors only provide running times, not the number of iterations.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In principle all the algorithms should have a similar bottleneck in each iteration (computing a gradient for the input image), but it would be good to verify this with an iteration count vs success rate (or distortion) plot.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This would also allow the authors to compare their theoretical iteration bound with experimental data.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In addition to these three main points, the authors could strengthen their results by providing experiments on another dataset (e.g., CIFAR-10) or model architecture (e.g., a ResNet), and by averaging over a larger number of test data points (currently 200).
label: asp_substance

sentence: Overall, I find the paper a promising contribution. But until the authors provide a more thorough experimental evaluation, I hesitate to recommend acceptance.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Additional comments:
label: none

sentence: The introduction contains a few statements that may paint an incomplete or confusing picture of the current literature in adversarial attacks on neural networks:
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: * The abstract claims that the poor time complexity of adversarial attacks limits their practical usefulness.
label: none

sentence: However, the running time of attacks is typically measured in seconds and should not be the limiting element in real-world attacks on deep learning systems.
label: none

sentence: I am not aware of a setting where the running time of an attack is the main computational bottleneck (outside adversarial training).
label: none

sentence: * The introduction distinguishes between "gradient-based methods" and "optimization-based methods".
label: none

sentence: This distinction is potentially confusing to a reader since the gradient-based methods can be seen as optimization algorithms, and the optimization-based methods rely on gradients.
label: none

sentence: * The introduction claims that black-box attacks need to estimate gradients coordinate-wise.
label: none

sentence: However, this is not the case already in some of the prior work that uses random directions for estimating gradients (e.g., the cited paper by Ilyas et al.)
label: none

sentence: I encourage the authors to clarify these points in an updated version of their paper.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper proposes to extend VAE-GAN from the static image generation setting to the video generation setting.
label: none

sentence: It’s a well-written, simple paper that capitalizes on the trade-off between model realism and diversity, and the fact that VAEs and GANs (at least empirically) tend to lie on different sides of this spectrum.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The idea to extend the use of VAE-GANs to the video prediction setting is a pretty natural one and not especially novel.
label: asp_originality

sentence: However, the effort to implement it successfully is commendable and will, I think, serve as a good reference for future work on video prediction.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: There are also several interesting design choices that I think are worth of further exposition.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Why, for example, did the authors only perform variational inference with the current and previous frames? Did conditioning on additional frames offer limited further improvement? Can the blurriness instead be attributable to the weak inference model?
label: asp_substance

sentence: Please provide a response to these questions.
label: none

sentence: If the authors have any ablation studies to back up their design choices, that would also be much appreciated, and will make this a more valuable paper for readers.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I think Figure 5 is the most interesting figure in the paper.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I would imagine that playing with the hyperparameters would allow one to traverse the trade-off between realism and diversity.
label: none

sentence: I think having such a curve will help sell the paper as giving the practitioner the freedom to select their own preferred trade-off.
label: none

sentence: I don’t understand the claim that “GANs prioritize matching joint distributions of pixels over per-pixel reconstruction” and its implication that VAEs do not prioritize joint distribution matching.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: VAEs prioritize matching joint distributions of pixels and latent space: min KL(q(z, x) || p(z, x)) and is a variational approximation of the problem min KL(q(x) || p(x)), where q(x) is the data distribution.
label: none

sentence: The explanation provided by the authors is thus not sufficiently precise and I recommend the retraction of this claim.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: + Well-written
label: asp_clarity

sentence: + Natural extension of VAE-GANs to video prediction setting
label: asp_substance

sentence: + Establishes a good baseline for future video prediction work
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Cons:
label: none

sentence: - Limited novelty
label: asp_originality

sentence: - Limited analysis of model/architecture design choices
label: asp_replicability

sentence: This paper studies the characteristics of representations and their roles in neural network expressiveness.
label: none

sentence: The results  are overall not very impressive.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: 1. There are many characteristics of representations such as scaling, permutation, covariance, correlation, sparsity, dead units, rank.
label: none

sentence: The papers discusses some (not surprising) theoretical properties relating to scaling, permutation, covariance, correlation, while making less efforts on the more interesting characteristics  sparsity, dead units, rank, mutual information.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Only some heuristic results are obtained for them without rigorous theory.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It would be better if these heuristic arguments can be formed as theorems as well.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 2. Probably the most interesting experimental finding of this paper is that the mutual information between z and output is constant, while the one between z and input strongly depends on the regularizers.
label: none

sentence: That is, the dependence between z and y does not vary with regularizers but the one between z and x does.
label: none

sentence: Is this a coincidence or a general phenomenon? Is there a theoretical explanation?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This paper provide a method to produce adversarial attack using a Frank-Wolfe inspired method.
label: none

sentence: I have some concerns about the motivation of this method:
label: none

sentence: - What are the motivations to use Frank-Wolfe ? Usually this algorithm is used when the constraints are to complicated to have a tractable projection (which is not the case for the L_2 and L_\infty balls) or when one wants to have sparse iterates which do not seem to be the case here.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - Consequently why did not you compare simple projected gradient method ?
label: asp_substance

sentence: (BIM) is not equivalent to the projected gradient method since the direction chosen is the sign of the gradient and not the gradient itself (the first iteration is actually equivalent because we start at the center of the box but after both methods are no longer equivalent).
label: none

sentence: - There is no motivations for the use of $\lambda >1$ neither practical or theoretical since the results are only proven for $\lambda =1$ whereas the experiments are done with \lambda = 5,20 or 30.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - What is the difference between the result of Theorem 4.3 and the result from (Lacoste-Julien 2016)?
label: asp_substance

sentence: Depending on the answer to these questions I'm planning to move up or down my grade.
label: none

sentence: In the experiment there is no details on how you set the hyperparameters of CW and EAD.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: They use a penalized formulation instead of a constrained one.
label: none

sentence: Consequently the regularization hyperparameters have to be set differently.
label: none

sentence: The only new result seem to be Theorem 4.7 which is a natural extension to theorem 4.3 to zeroth-order methods.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Comment:
label: none

sentence: - in the whole paper there is $y$ which is not defined.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I guess it is the $y_{tar}$ fixed in the problem formulation Sec 3.2.
label: none

sentence: In don't see why there is a need to work on any $y$. If it is true
label: asp_substance

sentence: ,  case assumption 4.5 do not make any sense since $y = y_{tar}$ (we just need to note $\|\nabla f(O,y_{tar})\| = C_g$) and some notation could be simplified setting for instance $f(x,y_{tar})  = f(x)$.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: ===== After rebuttal ======
label: none

sentence: The authors answered some of my questions but I still think it is a borderline submission.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The paper examines an architectural feature in GAN generators -- self-modulation -- and presents empirical evidence supporting the claim that it helps improve modeling performance.
label: none

sentence: The self-modulation mechanism itself is implemented via FiLM layers applied to all convolutional blocks in the generator and whose scaling and shifting parameters are predicted as a function of the noise vector z.
label: none

sentence: Performance is measured in terms of Fréchet Inception Distance (FID) for models trained with and without self-modulation on a fairly comprehensive range of model architectures (DCGAN-based, ResNet-based), discriminator regularization techniques (gradient penalty, spectral normalization), and datasets (CIFAR10, CelebA-HQ, LSUN-Bedroom, ImageNet).
label: none

sentence: The takeaway is that self-modulation is an architectural feature that helps improve modeling performance by a significant margin in most settings.
label: none

sentence: An ablation study is also performed on the location where self-modulation is applied, showing that it is beneficial across all locations but has more impact towards the later layers of the generator.
label: none

sentence: I am overall positive about the paper: the proposed idea is simple, but is well-explained and backed by rigorous evaluation.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Here are the questions I would like the authors to discuss further:
label: none

sentence: - The proposed approach is a fairly specific form of self-modulation.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In general, I think of self-modulation as a way for the network to interact with itself, which can be a local interaction, like for squeeze-and-excitation blocks.
label: none

sentence: In the case of this paper, the self-interaction allows the noise vector z to interact with various intermediate features across the generation process, which for me appears to be different than allowing intermediate features to interact with themselves.
label: none

sentence: This form of noise injection at various levels of the generator is also close in spirit to what BigGAN employs, except that in the case of BigGAN different parts of the noise vector are used to influence different parts of the generator.
label: none

sentence: Can you clarify how you view the relationship between the approaches mentioned above?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - It’s interesting to me that the ResNet architecture performs better with self-modulation in all settings, considering that one possible explanation for why self-modulation is helpful is that it allows the “information” contained in the noise vector to better propagate to and influence different parts of the generator.
label: none

sentence: ResNets also have this ability to “propagate” the noise signal more easily, but it appears that having a self-modulation mechanism on top of that is still beneficial.
label: none

sentence: I’m curious to hear the authors’ thoughts in this.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Reading Figure 2b, one could be tempted to draw a correlation between the complexity of the dataset and the gains achieved by self-modulation over the baseline (e.g., Bedroom shows less difference between the two approaches than ImageNet). Do the authors agree with that?
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper proposed a novel image classifier comparison approach that went beyond one fixed testing set for all.
label: none

sentence: Instead, for a pair of classifiers to be compared, it advocated to sample their "most disagreed" test set from a large corpus of unlabeled images.
label: none

sentence: The level of disagreement was measured by a semantic-aware distance derived from WordNet ontology.
label: none

sentence: Because of the efficacy of such "worst-case" comparison, the needed set size is very small and thus minimizes the human annotation workload.
label: none

sentence: The proposed MAD competition distinguishes classifiers by finding their respective counterexamples.
label: none

sentence: It is therefore an "error spotting" mechanism, rather than a drop-in replacement of standard test accuracy.
label: none

sentence: I feel the approach to implicitly assume that the classifiers to be compared are already "reasonably accurate"; since if not, both classifiers might be easily falsified by certain trivial examples, making the "disagreed examples" not as meaningful.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: If that is true, I would suggest the authors to make this hidden assumption clearer in the paper
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The idea shows clear liaison to the "differential testing" concept in software engineering besides the cited work of perceptual quality assessment.
label: none

sentence: The idea has a cross-disciplinary nature and is fairly interesting to me.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: I can see the paper to be of interest to a quite broad audience and can motivate many subsequent works.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: One minor comment: for images in "Case III", the authors considered them "contribute little to performance comparison between the two classifiers" and therefore did not source labels for them.
label: none

sentence: However, since the authors adopted an affinity-aware distance, two incorrect predictions can still be compared based on their semantic tree distances to the true class.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This paper uses constrained Markov decision processes to solve a multi-objective problem that aims to find the correct trade-off between cost and return in continuous control.
label: none

sentence: The main technique is Lagrangian relaxation and experiments are focus on cart-pole and locomotion task.
label: none

sentence: Comments:
label: none

sentence: 1) How to solve the constrained problem (8) is unclear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It is prefer to provide detailed description or pseudocode for this step.
label: none

sentence: 2) In equation (8), lambda is a trade-off between cost and return.
label: none

sentence: Optimization on lambda reduces burdensome hyperparameter selection, but a new hyperparameter beta is introduced.
label: none

sentence: How do we choose a proper beta, and will the algorithm be sensitive to beta?
label: asp_substance

sentence: 3) The paper only conducts comparison experiments with fixed-alpha baselines.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: The topic is similar to safe reinforcement learning.
label: none

sentence: Including the comparison with safe reinforcement learning algorithms is more convincing.
label: none

sentence: This paper proposed another variant of Langevin dynamics, called “Stein self-repulsive dynamics,” which simultaneously decreases the auto-correlation of Langevin dynamics and eliminates the need for running parallel chains in SVGD.
label: none

sentence: They combined Langevin dynamics with Stein variational gradient descent and theoretically justified that the proposed method successfully converges to the stationary distribution with only a single chain, unlike SVGD.
label: none

sentence: The proposed method decreases the auto-correlation of Langevin dynamics, so the proposed method increases the sample efficiency.
label: none

sentence: The paper is well-written.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The idea of the proposed method is natural, which is incorporating the functionality of SVGD to reduce the auto-correlation of Langevin dynamics.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The idea is intuitive and justified by their theoretical analysis.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors also well- placed their work in the literature, as described in Section 3.
label: none

sentence: The intuitive explanation of the proposed method is given in Section 3.
label: none

sentence: I have one technical question as follows. If the authors reply appropriately, I will raise the score to accept.
label: none

sentence: In Theorem 4.3
label: none

sentence: , the result holds for any k and M. The authors claim that if we take a limit of M -> ∞ with fixed k, the practical dynamics converges to the discrete-time mean-field limit, in Section 4.
label: none

sentence: However, to state the result of Theorem 4.3, k should be bigger than M c_\eta from the dentition of \tilde{\rho}_k^M, as shown under the equation (4).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: How do we take a limit of M -> ∞ ? Does k also go ∞?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Minor comments:
label: none

sentence: - The definition of g should depend on only \theta_k^I and \hat{\delta}_k^M, not \theta_k^k.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - The equation (1) should hold for any \theta’, not \theta.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - The equation (1) should contain \rho, not p.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This paper studies "Noisy Information Bottlenecks".
label: none

sentence: The overall idea is that, if the mutual information between learned parameters and the data is limited, then this prevents overfitting.
label: none

sentence: It proposes to create a "bottleneck" to limit the mutual information.
label: none

sentence: Specifically, the bottleneck is created by having the data depend on a noisy version of the parameters, rather than the true parameters and invoking the information processing inequality.
label: none

sentence: The paper gives an example of Gaussian mean field inference.
label: none

sentence: Ultimately, the analysis boils down to looking at a signal-to-noise ratio of the algorithm, which looks very much like regularization.
label: none

sentence: I think this is a very interesting direction, but the present paper is somewhat unclear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In particular, the example in section 3.1 says that a noisy information bottleneck is introduced, but then says that the modified and unmodified models have "training algorithms that are exactly equivalent." I think this example needs to be clarified.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Many of the parameters here are also unclear and not properly defined/introduced.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: What is the relationship between $\theta$ and $\tilde\theta$ exactly?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In this simple model, can we not calculate the mutual information directly (i.e., without the bottleneck)?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: The connection between mutual information and generalization has been studied in several contexts [see, e.g., the references in this paper and https://arxiv.org/abs/1511.05219 https://arxiv.org/abs/1705.07809 https://arxiv.org/abs/1712.07196 https://arxiv.org/pdf/1605.02277.pdf https://arxiv.org/abs/1710.05233 https://arxiv.org/pdf/1706.00820.pdf ] and further exploration is desirable.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper is giving an information-theoretic perspective on existing variational inference methods.
label: none

sentence: Such a perspective is interesting, but needs to be further developed and explained.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Specifically, how can mutual information in this context be formally linked to generalization/overfitting?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Also, the definition of mutual information used in this paper uses the inferred distribution q (e.g., in eq. 2), which is somewhat unusual.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: As a result, constraining the model will alter the mutual information and I think the effect of this should be remarked on.
label: arg_other

sentence: Overall, I think this paper has some interesting ideas, but those need to be fleshed out and clearly explained in a future revision.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This work presents Backpropamine, a neuromodulated plastic LSTM training regime.
label: none

sentence: It extends previous research on differentiable Hebbian plasticity by introducing a neuromodulatory term to help gate information into the Hebbian synapse.
label: none

sentence: The neuromodulatory term is placed under network control, allowing it to be time varying (and hence to be sensitive to the input, for example).
label: none

sentence: Another variant proposes updating the Hebbian synapse with modulated exponential average of the Hebbian product.
label: none

sentence: This average is linked to the notion of an eligibility trace, and ties into some recent biological work that shows the role of dopamine in retroactively modulating synaptic plasticity.
label: none

sentence: Overall the work is nicely motivated and clearly presented.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: There are some interesting ties to biological work -- in particular, to retroactive plasticity phenomena.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: There should be sufficient details for a reader to implement this model, thought there are some minor details missing regarding the experimental setup, which will be addressed below.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The authors test their model on three tasks: cue-award association, maze learning, and Penn Treebank (PTB).
label: none

sentence: In the cue-award association task the retroactive and simple modulation networks perform well, while the non-modulated and non-plastics fail.
label: none

sentence: For the maze navigation task the modulated networks perform better than the non-modulated networks, though the effect is less pronounced.
label: none

sentence: Finally, on PTB the authors report improvements over baseline LSTMs.
label: none

sentence: One of the main claims of this paper is that neuromodulated plastic LSTMs...outperform standard LSTMs on a benchmark language modeling task”, and that therefore “differentiable neuromodulation of plasticity offers a powerful new framework for training neural networks”.
label: none

sentence: This claim is unfortunately unfounded for a very important reason: the LSTM performance is not at all close to that which can be achieved by LSTMs in general.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The authors cite such models in the appendix (Melor et al), but claim that “much larger models” are needed, potentially with other mechanisms, such as dropout.
label: none

sentence: Though this may be true, these models still undermine the claim that “neuromodulated plastic LSTMs...outperform standard LSTMs on a benchmark language modeling task”.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This claim is simply not true, and more care is needed in reporting the results here in the wider context of the literature.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Also, I am left wondering what are considered the parameters of the models -- are only the neuromodulatory terms considered as the additional trainable parameters compared to baseline LSTMs? How are the Hebbian synapses themselves considered in this calculation?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: If the Hebbian synapses are not considered, then the authors need a control with matched memory-capacities to account for the extra capacity afforded by the Hebbian synapses.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Given the ties between Hebbian synapses and attention (see Ba et al), an important control here could be an LSTM with Bahdanau (2014) style attention.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Finally, the style (font) of the paper does not adhere to the ICLR style template, and must be changed.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Overall, the ideas presented in the paper are intriguing, and further research down this line is encouraged.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: However, in its current state the work lacks sufficiently strong baselines to support the paper’s claims; thus, the merits of this approach cannot yet be properly assessed.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In this paper, the authors proposed a multi-domain adversarial learning approach, MULANN, to improve the classification accuracy on three datasets-DIGITS, OFFICE and CELL-in the semi-supervised DA setting.
label: none

sentence: It’s contributions include: i) using the H-divergence to bound both the risk across all domains and the worst-domain risk (imbalance on a specific domain); ii) a new loss to accommodate semi-supervised multi-domain learning and domain adaptation; iii) the experimental validation of the approach, improving on the state-of-the-art on two standard image benchmarks, and a novel bioimage dataset, CELL.
label: none

sentence: In addition, this paper has a clear logic to explain and prove the problem to be solved, and has ample experimental evidence.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Above on, this paper did a meaningful work.
label: asp_substance

sentence: But there are some errors of expression, so it should be checked.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The paper proposes two additional steps to improve the compression of weights in deep neural networks.
label: none

sentence: The first is to quantize the weights after pruning, and the second is to further encode the quantized weights.
label: none

sentence: There are several weaknesses in this paper.
label: arg_other

sentence: The first one is clarity.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The paper is not very self-contained, and I have to constantly go back to Lee et al. and Xu et al. in order to read through the paper.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The paper can be made more mathematically precise.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The input and output types of each block in Figure 1. should be clearly stated.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: For example, in Section 3.2, it can be made clear that the domain of the quantization function is the real and the codomain is a sequence k bits.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Since the paper relies so heavily on Lee et al., the authors should make an effort to summarize the approach in a mathematically precise way.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The figures are almost useless, because the captions contain very little information.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: For example, the authors should at least say that the "D" in Figure 2. stands for delay, and the underline in Figure 4. indicates the bits that are not pruned.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Many more can be said in all the figures.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The second weakness is experimental design.
label: asp_substance

sentence: There are two conflicting qualities that need to be optimized--performance and compression rate.
label: none

sentence: When optimizing the compression rate, it is important not to look at the test set error.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: If the compression rate is optimized on the test set, then the compressed model is nothing but a model overfit to the test set.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The test set is typically small compared to the training set, so it is no surprise that the compression rate can be as high as 90%.
label: none

sentence: Optimizing compression rates should be done on the training set with a separate development set.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The test set should not used before the best compression scheme is selected.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Both the results on the development set and on the test set should be reported for the validity of the experiments.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I do not see these experimental settings mentioned anywhere in the paper, and this is very concerning.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Lee et al. seem to make similar mistakes, and it is likely that their experimental design is also flawed.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The present paper proposes a fast approximation to the softmax computation when the number of classes is very large.
label: none

sentence: This is typically a bottleneck in deep learning architectures.
label: none

sentence: The approximation is a sparse two-layer mixture of experts.
label: none

sentence: The paper lacks rigor and the writing is of low quality, both in its clarity and its grammar.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: See a list of typos below.
label: none

sentence: An example of lack of mathematical rigor is equation 4 in which the same variable name is used to describe the weights before and after pruning, as if it was computer code instead of an equation.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Also pervasive is the use of the asterisk to denote multiplication, again as if it was code and not math.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Algorithm 1 does not include mitosis, which may have an effect on the resulting approximation.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: How are the lambda and threshold parameters tuned? The authors mention a validation set, are they just exhaustively explored on a 3D grid on the validation set?
label: asp_replicability

sentence: The results only compare with Shim et al. Why only this method? Why would it be expected to be faster than all the other alternatives? Wouldn't similar alternatives like the sparsely gated MoE, D-softmax and adaptive-softmax have chances of being faster?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The column "FLOPS" in the result seems to measure the speedup, whereas the actual FLOPS should be less when the speed increases.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Also, a "1x" label seems to be missing in for the full softmax, so that the reference is clearly specified.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: All in all, the results show that the proposed method provides a significant speedup with respect to Shim et al., but it lacks comparison with other methods in the literature.
label: asp_substance

sentence: A brief list of typos:
label: none

sentence: "Sparse Mixture of Sparse of Sparse Experts"

sentence: "if we only search right answer"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: "it might also like appear"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: "which is to design to choose the right"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: sparsly
label: asp_clarity

sentence: "will only consists partial"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: "with γ is a lasso threshold"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: "an arbitrarily distance function"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: "each 10 sub classes are belonged to one"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: "is also needed to tune to achieve"
