sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: The role of auxiliary tasks is to improve the generalization performance of the principal task of interest.
label: none

sentence: So far, hand-crafted auxiliary tasks are generated, tailored for a problem of interest.
label: none

sentence: The current work addresses a meta-learning approach to automatically generate auxiliary tasks suited to the principal task, without human knowledge.
label: none

sentence: The key components of the method are: (1) meta-generator; (2) multi-task evaluator.
label: none

sentence: These two models are trained using the gradient-based meta-learning technique (for instance, MAML).
label: none

sentence: The problem of image classification is considered only, while authors claimed the method can be easily applied to other problems as well.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Strengths:
label: none

sentence: - To my best knowledge, the idea of applying the meta-learning to the automatic generation of auxiliary tasks is novel.
label: asp_originality

sentence: - The paper is well written and easy to read.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - The method nicely blends a few components such as self-supervised learning, meta-learning, auxiliary tasks into a single model to tackle the meta auxiliary learning.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Weakness:
label: none

sentence: - The performance gain is not substantial in experiments.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I would like to suggest to use the state-of-the-arts classifier for the principal task and to evaluate how much gain your method can get with the help of auxiliary tasks.
label: asp_substance

sentence: You can refer to the state-of-the-arts performance on CIFAR.
label: none

sentence: - If the information on the hierarchy of sub-categories is not available, it will be an annoying hyperparameters that should be well tuned.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper is well written and easy to follow. The topic is apt.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I don’t have any comments except the following ones.
label: none

sentence: Lemma 2.4, Point 1: The proof is confusing.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Consider the one variable vector case.
label: none

sentence: Assuming that there is only one variable w, then \nabla L(w) is not perpendicular to w in general.
label: none

sentence: The Rayleigh quotient example L(w)  = w’*A*w/ (w’*w) for a symmetric matrix A, then \nabla L(w) = (2/w’*w)(Aw - L(w)*w), which is not perpendicular to w.
label: none

sentence: Even if we constrain ||w ||_2 = 1
label: none

sentence: , then also  \nabla L(w)  is not perpendicular to w.
label: none

sentence: Am I missing something?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: What is G_t in Theorem 2.5. It should be defined in the theorem itself.
label: asp_substance

sentence: There is another symbol G_g which is a constant.
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes a new task/dataset for language-based abductive reasoning in narrative texts.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: -	The proposed task is interesting and well motivated.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The paper contributes a dataset (20,000 commonsense narratives and 200,000 explanatory hypotheses).
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The construction of the dataset was performed carefully (e.g., avoiding annotation artifacts).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: -	The paper established many reasonable baselines.
label: asp_substance

sentence: -	The paper conducted detailed analysis, which invites more research on this task: despite the strong performance of many existing systems on NLI/RTE, there are larger gaps between the performance of these models and human performance on the proposed task.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The experiments well support the conclusions made in the paper.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: -	The paper is well structured and easy to follow. It is well written.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Cons/comments:
label: none

sentence: -	While this is a new and interesting task, the contribution (as discussed above in “pros” above) is somewhat limited.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: I also suggest the paper discusses e-SNLI a bit more.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: -	The paper has a specific form of formulation for abductive reasoning, where there are exactly two observations and one proceeds the other; the explanation happens in between. I can see this helps collect and annotate data, but also limit the form of abductive reasoning and how models should be developed.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: -	Should the title of the paper specify the paper is about “language-based” abductive reasoning.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: A minor one: “Table 7 reports results on the αNLI task.” Should it be “Table 2”?
label: none

sentence: The paper proposes a neural-network-based estimation of mutual information, following the earlier line of work in [A].
label: none

sentence: The main focus has been to develop an estimator that can reliably work with small dataset sizes.
label: none

sentence: They first reduce the sample complexity of estimating mutual information by decoupling the network learning problem and the estimation problem by creating a training and validation set and then using the validation set for estimating mutual information.
label: none

sentence: Of course, there is still the problem of learning the network with smaller sized data.
label: none

sentence: For this, they propose the strategy of creating multiple tasks from the same dataset, where the dataset is run through transformations that do not affect mutual information.
label: none

sentence: I am inclined to accept (weak) the paper for the following reasons:
label: none

sentence: 1. The paper uses some nice ideas to reduce the variance of the MI estimates and to be able to work with smaller dataset sizes.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Both splitting data into training and validation and then using task augmentation to make learning robust are pretty nice ideas.
label: asp_originality

sentence: 2. The results on the synthetic datasets show that the resulting estimator does have low variance and the estimates are less than or equal to the true MI value, which is consistent with the fact that it is a lower bound estimation.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 3. The results on fMRI dataset were interesting and showed that the method gives improvements over baselines were the estimates were made on a smaller sized dataset.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Some improvement suggestions:
label: none

sentence: 1. I don't see why MINE cannot be applied to the fMRI dataset and results be reported.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I know that the variance in estimation is large, but it would still be useful to look at the performance of MINE in comparison to DEMINE.
label: none

sentence: 2. There are several errors in the writing - hyperparamters in Abstract, repetition of the word "Section" in fMRI experiment section etc. - which needs to be fixed.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: [A] Mutual Information Neural Estimation, ICML 2018
label: none

sentence: The authors introduce strategies for pre-training graph neural networks.
label: none

sentence: Pre-training is done at the node level as well as at the graph level.
label: none

sentence: They evaluate their approaches on two domains, biology and chemistry on a number of downstream tasks.
label: none

sentence: They find that not all pre-training strategies work well and can in fact lead to negative transfer.
label: none

sentence: However, they find that pre-training in general helps over non pre-training.
label: none

sentence: Overall, this paper was well written with useful illustrations and clear motivations.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors evaluate their models over a number of datasets.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Experimental construction and analysis also seems sound.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I would have liked to see a bit more analysis as to why some pre-training strategies work over others.
label: asp_substance

sentence: However, the authors mention that this is in their planned future work.
label: none

sentence: Also, in figure 4, the authors mention that their pre-trained models tend to converge faster.
label: none

sentence: However, this does not take into account the time already spent on pre-training. Perhaps the authors can include some results as to the total time taken as well as amortized total time over a number of different downstream tasks.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper introduces a simple measure of tunability that allows to compare optimizers under varying resource constraints.
label: none

sentence: The tunability of the optimizer is a weighted sum of best performance at a given budget.
label: none

sentence: The authors found that in a setting with low budget for hyperparameter tuning, tuning only Adam optimizer’s learning rate is likely to be a very good choice; it doesn’t guarantee the best possible performance, but it is evidently the easiest to find well-performing hyperparameter configurations.
label: none

sentence: Comments:
label: none

sentence: The paper is easy to follow.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The motivation of defining tunability of optimizer is a very interesting question, however, the study seems to preliminary and the conclusion is not quite convencing due to several reasons:
label: asp_substance

sentence: In section 3.2, to characterize its difficulties of finding best hyperparameters or tunability, the authors seem to try to connect the concept of “sharpness” of a minima in loss surface to the tunability of an optimizer, which is similar to comparing the loss landscape of minimums.
label: none

sentence: However, while the authors made intuitive explanation about the tunability in section 2.2, I did not see the actual plot of the true hyperpaparameter loss surface of each optimizer to verify these intuitions.
label: none

sentence: Can the author be more specific about the x-axis in the illustration 1.a and 1.b? If I understand correctly, they are not the number of trails.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In addition, the proposed stability metric seems not quite related with the above intuitions, as the illustrations (1.a and 1b) define the tunability to be the flatness of hyperparameter space around the best configurations, but the proposed definition is a weighted sum of the incumbents in terms of the HPO budgets.
label: none

sentence: The definition of the tuning budgets is not clear, is it the number of trials or the time/computation budgets?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors seems interchangeably using “runs” and “iterations”, which makes the concept more confusable.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors further proposed three weighting schemes to emphasize the tunability of different stage of HPO.
label: none

sentence: My concern is that is highly dependent  on the order of hyperparameter searched, which could impact the tunability significantly.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: For instance, in case of grid search HPO and 0.1 is the best learning rate, different search order such as [10, 1, 0.01, 0.1] and [0.1, 0.01, 1, 10] could results in dramatic different CPE and CPL.
label: none

sentence: My major concern is the hyperparameter distributions for each optimizer highly requires prior knowledge.
label: none

sentence: A good prior of one optimizer could significantly affect the HPO cost or increase the tunability, i.e., the better understanding the optimizer, the less tuning cost.
label: none

sentence: My major concern is that the authors assume the hyperparameters to be independent (section 3.2), which is not necessarily true.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Actually hyperparameters are highly correlated, such as momentum, batch size and learning rate are correlated in terms of effective learning rate [1,2], so as weight decay and learning rate are [3], which means using non-zero momentum is equivalent to using large learning rate as long as the effective learning rate is the same.
label: none

sentence: This could significantly increase the tunability of SGDM.
label: none

sentence: Another concurrent submission [4] verified this equivalence and showed one can also just tune learning rate for SGDM.
label: none

sentence: The assumption of independent hyperparameters might be fine for black box optimization or with the assumption that practitioners have no knowledge of the importance of each hyperparameter, then the tunability of the optimizer could be different based on the prior knowledge of hyperparameter and their correlations. But it is not rigorous enough to make the conclusion that Adam is easier to tune than SGD.
label: none

sentence: The author states their method to determine the priors by training each task specified in the DEEPOBS with a large number of hyperparameter samplings and retain the hyperparameters which resulted in performance within 20% of the best performance obtained.
label: none

sentence: Could the authors be more specific on the hyperparameters searched? Is this process counted in the tunability measurement?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: [1] Smith and Le, A Bayesian Perspective on Generalization and Stochastic Gradient Descent, https://arxiv.org/abs/1710.06451
label: none

sentence: [2] Smith et al, Don't Decay the Learning Rate, Increase the Batch Size, https://arxiv.org/abs/1711.00489
label: none

sentence: [3] van Laarhoven et al, L2 Regularization versus Batch and Weight Normalization, https://arxiv.org/abs/1706.05350
label: none

sentence: [4] Rethinking the Hyperparameters for Fine-tuning
label: none

sentence: https://openreview.net/forum?id=B1g8VkHFPH
label: none

sentence: The paper paper proposes a mutual information maximization objective for discovering unsupervised robotic manipulation skills.
label: none

sentence: The paper assumes that the state space can be divided into two parts - the state of the robot (“context states”) which is controllable via actions and the state of an object (“states of interest”) which must be manipulated by the robot.
label: none

sentence: Given these two categories of states, the proposed algorithm maximizes a lower bound on the mutual information between the two categories of states such that a policy is learnt that is able to manipulate the object with the robot meaningfully.
label: none

sentence: I vote for weak reject as (1) the paper makes a strong assumption about the availability of both the robot and object states which is not realistic in typical robotic manipulation applications and (2) the objective in the paper will not work if there is no notion of an “object” or object-state e.g.: this algorithm will not learn skills for a robot trying to control itself; hence, it is not truly a general purpose skill discovery algorithm but rather a skill discovery algorithm specifically meant for robot-object manipulation tasks.
label: asp_substance

sentence: My main concern with the paper is its limited applicability to robotic manipulation tasks with a clear divide between states of interest vs others.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The paper does not talk about settings where states of interest are not known, so all of the experiments are based on this strong assumption.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It doesn’t seem like a surprising discovery that maximizing the mutual information between the robot state and object state will lead to skills that actually make the robot move the object.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Given that object manipulation is the specific application of interest, the comparison with DIAYN and the combined objective with DIAYN is interesting but little motivation or discussion has been provided in the paper.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Can the authors elaborate on why this choice should intuitively be better than the proposed method alone?
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The paper does not talk about how these skills can be used as primitive actions by a higher level controller (in a hierarchical RL setup), which would help in demonstrating the usefulness of these skills - e.g.: are these skills sequentially composable such that they can solve a complex task?
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper proposes to learn task-level modules progressively to perform the task of VQA.
label: none

sentence: Such task-level modules include object/attribute prediction, image captioning, relationship detection, object counting, and finally VQA model.
label: none

sentence: The benefit of using modules for reasoning allows one to visualize the reasoning process more easily to understand the model better.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The results are mainly shown on VQA 2.0 set, with a good amount of analysis.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - I think overall this is a good paper, with clear organization, detailed description of the approach, solid analysis of the approach and cool visualization.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I especially appreciate that analysis is done taking into consideration of extra computation cost of the large model; the extra data used for visual relationship detection.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I do not have major comments about the paper itself, although I did not check the technical details super carefully.
label: none

sentence: - One thing I am confused about is the residual model, which seems quite important for the pipeline but I cannot find details describing it and much analysis on this component.
label: asp_substance

sentence: - I am in general curious to see if it will be beneficial to fine-tune the modules themselves can further improve performance. It maybe hard to do it entirely end-to-end, but maybe it is fine to fine-tune just a few top layers (like what Jiang et al did)?
label: asp_substance

sentence: - One great benefit of having a module-based model is feed in the *ground truth* output for some of the modules.
label: none

sentence: For example, what benefit we can get if we have perfect object detection? Where can we get if we have perfect relationships?
label: asp_substance

sentence: This can help us not only better understand the models, but also the dataset (VQA) and the task in general.
label: none

sentence: The paper proposes a recurrent knowledge graph (bipartite graph between entities and location nodes) construction & updating mechanism for entity state tracking datasets such as (two) ProPara tasks and Recipes.
label: none

sentence: The model goes through the following three steps: 1) it reads a sentence at each time step t and identifies the location of each entity via machine reading comprehension model such as DrQA (entities are predefined).
label: none

sentence: 2) Co-reference module adjusts relationship scores (soft adjacency matrix) among nodes, including possibly new nodes introduced by the MRC model.
label: none

sentence: 3) to propagate the relational information across all the nodes, the model performs L layers of LSTM for each entity that attend on other nodes via attention (where the weights come from the adjacency matrix).
label: none

sentence: The model repeats the three steps for each sentence.
label: none

sentence: The model is trained by directly supervising for the correct span by the MRC model at each time step, which is possible because the data provides strong supervision for each sentence (not just the answer at the end).
label: none

sentence: The model achieves the state of the art in the two tasks of ProPara and Recipes dataset.
label: none

sentence: Strengths: The paper provides an elegant solution for tracking relationship between entities as time (sentence) progresses.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: I also agree with the authors that this line of work (dynamic KG construction and modification) is an important area of research.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: While the model shares a similar spirit to EntNet, I think the model has enough distinctions / contributions, especially given that it outperforms EntNet by a large margin.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The model also obtains non-trivial improvement over previous SOTA models.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Weaknesses: Paper could have been written better. I had hard time understanding it.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The notations are overall confusing and not explained well.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Also there are a few unclear parts which I discuss in questions below.
label: none

sentence: Questions:
label: none

sentence: 1. Are e_{i,t} and lambda_{i,t} vectors?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Scalars?
label: none

sentence: Abstract node notations? It is not clear in the model section.

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: This paper describes a contextual encoding scheme for reconstruction of 3D pointclouds from 2D images.
label: none

sentence: An encoder outputs the parameters of a hierarchy of reconstruction networks that can be applied in succession to map random samples on a unit sphere to the surface of the reconstructed shape.
label: none

sentence: Strengths:
label: none

sentence: The author's model was quite novel in my opinion.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Deep 2D->3D is becoming a crowded space and there are many other models that encode image inputs, and many others that perform recursive or composition-based decoding.
label: none

sentence: However, the particular link here was interesting, and I appreciate the small number of parameters resulting in solid reconstruction performance.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: While most related work was covered well, I believe the authors could have a more up-to-date list of recent work that reconstructs triangle-mesh representations from images [A-C] (especially since several of these methods has an architecture that involves encoding and subsequent compositional refinement).
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Some of the reconstructions shown in this paper are quite impressive, and the quantitative results show outperforming 2 recent methods.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I did appreciate also the novel path-based evaluation of shape accuracy in the Appendix, although it would have been helpful to see more discussion of this in the main paper.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Areas for improvement:
label: none

sentence: I found that the core technical description was quite brief and would have benefited from simply more detail and space.
label: asp_substance

sentence: You have argued that your method is sensible to try (cog. sci motivations), and shown that one instance works, but what can we expect in a more mathematical or general sense? Can any sizes of encoder and mapping network fit together? How does the number of mapping layers effect performance? Won't we eventually expect vanishing/exploding gradients with particular activation and can one address this in some way?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I note that recent papers in this field tend to perform significantly more extensive experimental evaluation, typically selecting a wider range of competitors and using a number of more standardized metrics including IOU, F1 score and CD and typically repeating these at a variety of resolutions or on additional datasets or category splits etc.
label: none

sentence: Decision:
label: none

sentence: Weak reject because the idea is quite interesting, but I believe a more thorough explanation and expanded experimental comparison would be of great help to ensure the community can appreciate this work.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Additional citations suggested:
label: none

sentence: [A] Pixel2Mesh: Generating 3D Mesh Models from Single RGB Images. Wang, Zhang, Li, Fu, Liu and Jiang. ECCV 2018.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: [B] MeshCNN: A Network with an Edge. Hanocka, Hertz, Fish, Giryes, Fleishman and Cohen-Or. SIGGRAPH 2019.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: [C] GEOMetrics: Exploiting Structure for Graph-Encoded Objects. Smith, Fujimoto, Romero and Meger. ICML 2019.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Overview:
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes modifications to the original Differentiable Neural Computer architecture in three ways.
label: none

sentence: First by introducing a masked content-based addressing which dynamically induces a key-value separation
label: none

sentence: Second, by modifying the de-allocation system by also multiplying the memory contents by a retention vector before an update
label: none

sentence: Finally, the authors propose a modification in the link distribution, through renormalization.
label: none

sentence: They provide some theoretical motivation and empirical evidence that it helps avoiding memory aliasing.
label: none

sentence: The authors test their approach in the some algorithm task from the DNC paper (Copy, Associative Recall and Key-Value Retrieval), and also in the bAbi dataset.
label: none

sentence: Strengths: Overall I think the paper is well-written, and proposes simple adaptions to the DNC architecture which are theoretically grounded and could be effective for improving general performance.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Although the experimental results seem promising when comparing the modified architecture to the original DNC, in my opinion there are a few fundamental problems in the empirical session (see weakness discussion bellow).
label: asp_substance

sentence: Weaknesses: Not all model modifications are studied in all the algorithmic tasks.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For example, in the associative recall and key-value retrieval only DNC and DNC + masking are studied.
label: none

sentence: For the bAbi task, although there is a significant improvement (43%) in the mean error rate compared to the original DNC, it's important to note that performance in this task has improved a lot since the DNC paper was release. Since this is the only non-toy task in the paper, in my opinion, the authors have to discuss current SOTA on it, and have to cite, for example the universal transformer[1], entnet[2], relational nets [3], among others architectures that shown recent advances on this benchmark.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Moreover, the sparse DNC (Rae el at., 2016) is already a much better performant in this task.
label: none

sentence: (mean error DNC: 16.7 \pm 7.6, DNC-MD (this paper) 9.5 \pm 1.6, sparse DNC 6.4 \pm 2.5).
label: none

sentence: Although the authors mention in the conclusion that it's future work to merge their proposed changes into the sparse DNC, it is hard to know how relevant the improvements are, knowing that there are much better baselines for this task.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It would also be good if besides the mean error rates, they reported best runs chosen by performance on the validation task, and number of the tasks solve (with < 5% error) as it is standard in this dataset.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Smaller Notes.
label: none

sentence: 1) In the abstract, I find the message for motivating the masking from the sentence  "content based look-up results... which is not present in the key and need to be retrieved."  hard to understand by itself. When I first read the abstract, I couldn't understand what the authors wanted to communicate with it. Later in 3.1 it became clear.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 2) page 3, beta in that equation is not defined
label: none

sentence: 3) First paragraph in page 5 uses definition of acronyms DNC-MS and DNC-MDS before they are defined.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 4) Table 1 difference between DNC and DNC (DM) is not clear. I am assuming it's the numbers reported in the paper, vs the author's implementation?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 5)In session 3.1-3.3, for completeness. I think it would be helpful to explicitly compare the equations from the original DNC paper with the new proposed ones.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Post rebuttal update: I think the authors have addressed my main concern points and I am updating my score accordingly.
label: none

sentence: Summary:
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes to impute multimodal data when certain modalities are present.
label: none

sentence: The authors present a variational selective autoencoder model that learns only from partially-observed data.
label: none

sentence: VSAE is capable of learning the joint
label: none

sentence: distribution of observed and unobserved modalities as well as the imputation mask, resulting in a model that is suitable for various down-stream tasks including data generation and imputation
label: none

sentence: The authors evaluate on both synthetic high-dimensional and challenging low-dimensional multimodal datasets and show improvement over the state-of-the-art data imputation models.
label: none

sentence: Strengths:
label: none

sentence: - This is an interesting paper that is well written and motivated.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: - The authors show good results on several multimodal datasets, improving upon several recent works in learning from missing multimodal data.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Weaknesses:
label: none

sentence: - How multimodal are the datasets provided by UCI? It seems like they consist of different tabular datasets with numerical or categorical variables, but it was not clear what the modalities are (each variable is a modality?) and how correlated the modalities are. If they are not correlated at all and share no joint information I'm not sure how these experiments can represent multimodal data.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: - Some of the datasets the authors currently test on are quite toy, especially for the image-based MNIST and SVHN datasets.
label: asp_substance

sentence: They should consider larger-scale datasets including image and text-based like VQA/VCR, or video-based like the datasets in (Tsai et al., ICLR 2019).
label: asp_substance

sentence: - In terms of prediction performance, the authors should also compare to [1] and [2] which either predict the other modalities completely during training or use tensor-based methods to learn from noisy or missing time-series data.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: - One drawback is that this method requires the mask during training. How can it be adapted for scenarios where the mask is not present? In other words, we only see multiple modalities as input, but we are not sure which are noisy and which are not?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: [1] Pham et al. Found in Translation: Learning Robust Joint Representations by Cyclic Translations Between Modalities, AAAI 2019
label: none

sentence: [2] Liang et al. Learning Representations from Imperfect Time Series Data via Tensor Rank Regularization, ACL 2019
label: none

sentence: ### Post rebuttal
label: none

sentence: Thank you for your detailed answers to my questions.
label: none

sentence: I raised my rating. After the rebuttal.
label: none

sentence: The idea is simple but intuitive. I am conservative about my rating now, I will consider raising it after the rebuttal.

sentence: 1. The focus of this paper is the hyper-parameter, please focus and explain more on the usage with hyper-parameters.

sentence: - no need to write so much in section 2.1, the surrogate is simple and common in optimization for parameters.

sentence: So, bounds here can not be used to explain empirical observations in Section 5.

sentence: 3. Could authors explain the time complexity of inner loop in Algorithm 1? Does it take more time than that of updating model parameters?

sentence: 4. Authors have done a good comparison in the context of deep nets.

sentence: However,
label: asp_substance

label: none

sentence: Is it better to decay learning rates for toy data sets?

sentence: It is known that SGD with fixed step-size can not find the optimal for convex (perhaps, also simple) problems.

sentence: - how to tune lambda? it is an important hyper-parameter, but it is set without a good principle, e.g., "For SGD-APO, we used lambda = 0.001, while for SGDm-APO, we used lambda = 0.01", "while for RMSprop-APO, the best lambda was 0.0001
label: asp_replicability

label: asp_replicability

sentence: - In Section 5.2, it is said lambda is tuned by grid-search.
label: none

sentence: Tuning a good lambda v.s. tuning a good step-size, which one costs more?
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper proposes a justification to one observation on VAE: "restricting the family of variational approximations can, in fact, have a positive regularizing effect, leading to better generalization".
label: none

sentence: The explanation given in this work is based on Gaussian mean-field approximation.
label: none

sentence: I had trouble to understand some parts of this paper, since some of the sentences do not make sense to me. For example
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - the sentence under eq. (2)
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - the sentence "Bacause the identity of the datapoint can never be learned by ..." What is the identity of a dat point?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It looks like section 2.1 wants to show the connections between eq. (2) and other popularly used inference methods.
label: none

sentence: Somehow, those connections are not clear to me.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Besides some issues in the technical details, the major problem of this paper is that it uses the data processing inequality (DPI) in a **wrong** way.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: As in (Cover and Thomas, 2012), which is also cited in this paper, DPI is defined on a Markov chain X -> Y -> Z and we have I(X,Y) >= I(X,Z).
label: none

sentence: However, based on the definition of \theta and \tilde{\theta} given in the first sentence of section 2.3, the relation between \theta, \tilde{\theta} and D
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: should be: D <- \theta -> \tilde{\theta} (if it is a generative model) or D -> \theta -> \tilde{\theta} (if a discriminative model).
label: none

sentence: Either case, I don't think we can have the inequality in eq. (5).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: This paper proposes an approach for mitigating issues associated with high-frequency/amplitude control signals that may be obtained when one applies reinforcement learning algorithms to continuous control tasks.
label: none

sentence: The approach taken by the paper is to solve a constrained optimization problem, where the constraint imposes a (potentially state-dependent) lower bound on the reward.
label: none

sentence: This is done by using a Lagrangian relaxation that learns the parameters of a control policy that satisfies the desired constraints (and also learns the Lagrange multipliers).
label: none

sentence: The presented approach is demonstrated on a cart-pole swing-up task as well as a quadruped locomotion task.
label: none

sentence: Strengths:
label: none

sentence: + The paper is generally clear and readable.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: + The simulation results for the Minitaur quadruped robot are performed using a realistic model of the robot.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Major concern:
label: none

sentence: - My biggest concern is that the technical contributions of the paper are not clear at all.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: The motivation for the work (avoiding high amplitude/frequency control inputs) is certainly now new; this has always been a concern of control theorists and roboticists (e.g., when considering minimum-time optimal control problems, or control schemes such as sliding mode control).
label: asp_originality

sentence: The idea of using a constrained formulation is not novel either (constrained MDPs have been thoroughly studied since Altman (1999)).
label: asp_originality

sentence: The technical approach of using a Lagrangian relaxation is the standard way one goes about handling constrained optimization problems, and thus I do not see any novelty there either.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Overall, the paper does not make a compelling case for the novelty of the problem or approach.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Other concerns:
label: none

sentence: - For the cart-pole task, the paper states that the reward is modified "to exclude any cost objective".
label: none

sentence: Results are then presented for this modified reward showing that it results in high-frequency control signals (and that the proposed constrained approach avoids this).
label: none

sentence: I don't think this is really a fair comparison; I would have liked to have seen results for the unmodified reward function.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: - The claim made in the first line of the abstract (applying RL algorithms to continuous control problems often leads to bang-bang control)
label: asp_substance

sentence: is very broad and should be watered down.
label: none

sentence: This is the case only when one considers a poorly-designed cost function that doesn't take into account realistic factors such as actuator limits.
label: none

sentence: - In the last paragraph of Section 3.3, the paper proposes making the lower-bound on the reward state-dependent.
label: none

sentence: However, this can be tricky in practice since it requires having an estimate for Q_r(s,a) as a function of the state (in order to ensure that the state-dependent lower bound can indeed be satisfied).
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Typos:
label: none

sentence: - Pg. 5, Section 3.4: "...this is would achieve..."
label: asp_substance

sentence: - Pg. 6: ...thedse value of 90..."
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper presents a method for single image 3D reconstruction.
label: none

sentence: It is inspired by implicit shape models, like presented in Park et al. and Mescheder et al., that given a latent code project 3D positions to signed distance, or occupancy values, respectively.
label: none

sentence: However, instead of a latent vector, the proposed method directly outputs the network parameters of a second (mapping) network that displaces 3D points from a given canonical object, i.e., a unit sphere.
label: none

sentence: As the second network maps 3D points to 3D points it is composable, which can be used to interpolate between different shapes.
label: none

sentence: Evaluations are conducted on the standard ShapeNet dataset and the yields results close to the state-of-the-art, but using significantly less parameters.
label: none

sentence: Overall, I am in favour of accepting this paper given some clarifications and improving the evaluations.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The core contribution of the paper is to estimate the network parameters conditioned on the input (i.e., the RGB image).
label: none

sentence: As noted in the related work section this is not a completely new idea (cf. Schmidhuber, Ha et al.).
label: none

sentence: There are a few more references that had similar ideas and might be worth adding: Brabandere et al. "Dynamic Filter Networks", Klein et al. "A dynamic convolutional layer for short range weather prediction", Riegler et al. "Conditioned regression models for non-blind single image super-resolution", and maybe newer works along the line of Su et al. "Pixel-Adaptive Convolutional Neural Networks".
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The input 3D points are sampled from a unit sphere.
label: none

sentence: Does this imply any topological constraints?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Is this the most suitable shape to sample from? How do you draw samples from the sphere (Similarly, how are the points sampled for the training objects)?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: What happens if you instead densely sample from a 3D box (similar to the implicit shape models)?
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: On page 4 the mapping network is described as a function that maps c-dimensional points to 3D points.
label: none

sentence: What is c? Isn't it always 3, or how else is it possible to composite the mapping network?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Regarding the main evaluation: The paper follows the "standard" protocol on ShapeNet.
label: none

sentence: Recently, Tatarchenko et al. showed in "What Do Single-view 3D Reconstruction Networks Learn?" shortcomings of this evaluation scheme and proposed alternatives.
label: none

sentence: It would be great if this paper could follow those recommendations to get better insights in the results.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Further, I could not find what k was set to in the evaluation of Tab. 1.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It did also not match any numbers in Tab. 4 of the appendix.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Tab. 4 shows to some extend the influence of k, but I would like to see a more extensive evaluation.
label: asp_substance

sentence: How does performance change for larger k, and what happens if k is larger at testing then on at training, etc.?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Things to improve the paper that did not impact the score:
label: none

sentence: - The tables will look a lot nicer if booktab is used in LaTeX
label: asp_clarity

sentence: I have gone through the other reviews as well as the author response.
label: none

sentence: Firstly, I would like to thank the authors for providing detailed responses to my questions.
label: none

sentence: In general, I agree with R2 that the paper generally has some potentially interesting ideas and results but the manner in which the current draft is organized and presented makes it hard to grasp them and there is a lack of coherent message about what the paper is about.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Moreover, from my understanding the analysis in David McKay’s book (Chapter 41) concerns a single neuron (and the number of parameters for a single neuron)
label: none

sentence: As pointed out by R2, with depth there are a lot more number of possible ways in which one could carve out decision boundaries to separate data points, thus, it is not clear that the loose linear upper bound holds Specifically, as one might expect with depth it could be possible that linear capacity increase is a lower bound (I am not suggesting that it is, but that possibility should be considered and explained in the paper).
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Similarly, it would be good to formally connect the capacity to the rate of memorization before making a statement about them being related (as suggested in the initial review).
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: In general, I feel this section could use some tighter formalism and justifications.
label: asp_substance

sentence: I also remain unconvinced by the response to my issue with the claim “Our experiments show that our networks can remember a large number of images and distinguish them from unseen images”, where the negative images are also seen by the memorization model, so they are not unseen.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The authors address this by saying 3M of the 15 M negatives have been seen.
label: none

sentence: That does not seem like a small enough percentage to claim that these are “unseen” images.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In general, I feel the paper is interesting but would benefit from a major revision which makes the message of the paper more clear, and addresses these and other issues raised in the review phase. Thus I am holding my current rating.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Summary
label: none

sentence: The paper trains classification models to classify a labeling of a subset of images (assigned with label 1) from the rest of the images (assigned with a label 0).
label: none

sentence: Firstly, the paper shows that deep learning models are able to learn such classifiers and get low training loss.
label: none

sentence: It then proposes to use this model to ``attack’’ task-specific models to perform membership inference, i.e. figuring out if an image provided in a set was used in training or not.
label: none

sentence: Strengths
label: none

sentence: + The paper thoroughly covers related work and provides context.
label: asp_substance

sentence: + Results on confidence as a signature of a dataset are interesting.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Weaknesses
label: none

sentence: [Motivation]
label: none

sentence: In general, recent work has found that the raw number of parameters has little to do with the size of the model class or the capacity of a model for deep models, and thus work like [A] has been trying to come up with better complexity measures for models to explain generalization.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Thus, without sufficient justification the assertion in the paper that the capacity of the network is well approximated by the number of parameters does not seem correct.
label: none

sentence: Also, the claim in Fig. 1 that the transition from ‘’high capacity’’ to low capacity happens at the number of parameters in the network seems a bit loose and hard to substantiate from what I understand, and should be toned down. (*)
label: asp_substance

sentence: [Capacity]
label: none

sentence: 2. Sec. 3.3, Fig. 3: The capacity (in terms of parameters)of both Resnet-18 and VGG-16 is higher than the capcity for YFCC100M dataset for n=10K images (comes to 161K bits), while the capacity of Resnet-18, with 14.7 million parameters (assuming float32 encoding) has 14.7 * 32 bits = 470.4 million bits, thus capacity alone cannot explain why VGG converges faster than Resnet-18, since both networks exceed the capacity, and capacity does not seem to have an established formal connection to rate of memorization.
label: asp_substance

sentence: This is something which would need to be explained/ substantiated separately.
label: none

sentence: 3. Scenario discussed in Sec. 4 seems somewhat impractical.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: Given a set of m images, it is not clear that a classifier that is trained to detect between train and validation is sufficient, as one might also need to figure out if it is neither train nor val, which is a very practical scenario.
label: none

sentence: 4. Fig. 3 (right): It is not clear
label: asp_clarity

sentence: why the fact that the classifier is able to predict which dataset the image ‘m’ corresponds to is useful or practical, as this seems to be a property of the set ‘m’ rather than the property of the trained classification model (f_\theta)
label: none

sentence: Please clarify.
label: asp_substance

sentence: On the other hand it is clear that using the confidence of the model to predict the dataset is a useful property, but the right side of the Fig. is very confusing.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: It is not clear to me what the point of Sec. 5 is, given a trained model, one wants to figure out if an image was present in the training of the model.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: While the baseline approaches seem to make use of the model confidence, I cannot see how the proposed approach (which uses a classifier) makes use of the original model.
label: none

sentence: It is also not clear why Table. 3 does not report the Bayes baseline results.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Also, does this section use the classifier for predicting the dataset, or is the approach reported in the section, the MAT approach?
label: none

sentence: 7. ``Our experiments show that our networks can remember a large number of images and distinguish them from unseen images’’ -- this does not seem to be true, since the model is trained on both n as well as N -n ``unseen’’ images which it labels as the negative class, thus the negative class is also seen by the memorization model.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Minor Points
label: none

sentence: 1. It is not clear that training a network to classify a set from another set is necessarily equivalent to ``memorization’’.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In addition, the paper would also need to show that such a model does not generalize to a validation set of images.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: This is probably obvious given the results from Zhang et.al. but should be included as a sanity check.
label: none

sentence: 2. Figure 3: it is confusing to call the cumulative distribution of the maximum classification score as the CDF of the model (y-axis fig. 3 left) as CDF means something else generally in such contexts, as the CDF of a predictor.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Preliminary Evaluation
label: none

sentence: There are numerous issues with the writing and clarity of the paper, while it seems like some of the observations around the confidence of classifiers are interesting, in general the connection between those set of results and the ``memorization’’ capabilities of the classifier trained to remember train vs val images is not clear in general.
label: none

sentence: Important points for the rebuttal are marked with (*).
label: none

sentence: This paper proposes an algorithm for auxiliary learning.
label: none

sentence: Given a target prediction task to be learned on training data, the auxiliary learning utilizes external training data to improve learning.
label: none

sentence: The authors focus on a setup where both target and external training data come from the same distribution but differ in class labels, where each class in the target data is a set of finer-grained classes in the auxiliary data.
label: none

sentence: The authors propose a heuristic for learning from both data sets through minimization of a joint loss function.
label: none

sentence: The experimental results show that the proposed methods works well on this particular setup on CIFAR data set.
label: none

sentence: Strengths:
label: none

sentence: + a new auxiliary learning algorithm
label: asp_originality

sentence: + positive results on CIFAR data set
label: asp_substance

sentence: Weaknesses:
label: none

sentence: - novelty is low: the proposed algorithm is a heuristic similar to previously proposed algorithms in the transfer learning and auxiliary learning space
label: asp_originality

sentence: - there is no attempt to provide a theoretical insight into the performance of the algorithm
label: asp_substance

sentence: - the problem assumptions are too simplistic and unrealistic (feature distributions of target and auxiliary data are identical), so it is questionable if the proposed algorithm has practical importance
label: asp_replicability

sentence: - experiments are performed using a synthetic setup on a single data set, so it remains unclear if the algorithm would be successful in a real life scenario
label: asp_replicability

sentence: - the paper is poorly written and sentences are generally very hard to parse. For example, section 3.1 is opened by statements such as "(we use) a multi-task evaluator which trains on the principal and auxiliary tasks, and evaluates the performance of the auxiliary tasks on a meta set"??
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This paper presents 4D convolutional neural networks for video-level representations.
label: none

sentence: To learn long-range evolution of spatio-temporal representation of videos, the authors proposed V4D convolution layer.
label: none

sentence: Benchmark on several video classification dataset shows improvement.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 1. In section 3.1, the authors selected a snippet from each section, but this was not rigorously defined.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Same for action units.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It does intuitively makes sense, but more mathematical definition (e.g., dimensionality) may be needed.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 2. In section 3.2, the authors argued that 3D kernel suffers from trade-off between receptive field and cost of computation.
label: none

sentence: At the end of the subsection, the authors argue that 4D convolution is just k times larger than 3D kernels, which sounds like contradicting.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: 3D convolution is already expensive and not scalable, but 4D operation sounds even more expensive and more prohibitive.
label: none

sentence: 3. In the paper, the authors argued that clip-level feature learning is limited as it is hard to learn long-range spatio-temporal dependency.
label: none

sentence: It makes sense, and I expect the proposed model may benefit from its design for long-range spatio-temporal feature learning.
label: none

sentence: However, what I see in the experiments is on ~300 frames for Mini-Kinetics and 36-72 frames for Something-Something dataset.
label: none

sentence: Assuming that a second is represented with 15-30 frames, this corresponds to 10-20 sec and 1-4 sec, respectively.
label: none

sentence: I'd say these short videos are still clips.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper presents an interesting idea, but there are some issues that need to be addressed before published on ICLR.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: This paper analyzes the AlphaGo Zero algorithm by showing that the optimal policy corresponds to a Nash equilibrium.
label: none

sentence: The authors then show that the equilibrium corresponds to a KL-minimization.
label: none

sentence: Finally, the show on a classical scheduling task.
label: none

sentence: On the positive side, the paper is well written and structured.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The results presented are very interesting, specially showing that stochastic approximation of a KL-divergence minimization.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The case-study is also interesting, although does not improve current state-of-the-art.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: On the negative side, I think the relevance and novelty of the results should be explained better.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: For example, it is not clear the strong emphasis on the robust MDP formalization and the fact that MCTS finds a Nash equilibrium.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The MDP formalization is rather straightforward.
label: none

sentence: Also, MCTS has been used extensively to find Nash equilibria in both perfect and imperfect games, e.g., "Online monte carlo counterfactual regret minimization for search in imperfect information games".
label: none

sentence: Maybe the authors can elaborate more on the significance/relevance of this contribution.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Besides, the power of AlphaGo Zero resides in the combination of the MCTS together with the compact representation learning of the value functions.
label: none

sentence: The presented analysis seems to neglect the error term corresponding to the value function.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

label: asp_clarity

label: asp_clarity

label: asp_clarity

sentence: This paper introduced a latent space model for reinforcement learning in vision-based control tasks.
label: none

sentence: It first learns a latent dynamics model, in which the transition model and the reward model can be learned on the latent state representations.
label: none

sentence: Using the learned latent state representations, it used an actor-critic model to learn a reactive policy to optimize the agent's behaviors in long-horizon continuous control tasks.
label: none

sentence: The method is applied to vision-based continuous control in 20 tasks in the Deepmind control suite.
label: none

sentence: Pros:
label: none

sentence: 1. The method used a latent dynamics model, which avoids reconstruction of the future images during inference.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 2. The learned actor-critic model replaced online planning, where actions can be evaluated in a more efficient manner.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 3. The model achieved better performances in challenging control tasks compared to previous latent space planning methods, such as PlaNet.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: Cons:
label: none

sentence: 1. The work has limited novelty: the learning of the world model (recurrent state-space model) closely follows the prior work of PlaNet.
label: asp_originality

sentence: In contrast to PlaNet, the difference is that this work learns an actor-critic model in place of online planning with the cross entropy method.
label: none

sentence: However, I found the contribution of the actor-critic model is insufficient and requires additional experimental validation (see below).
label: asp_substance

sentence: 2. Since the actor-critic model is the novel component in this model (propagating gradients through the learned dynamics), I would like to see additional analysis and baseline comparisons of this method to previous actor-critic policy learning methods, such as DDPG and SAC training on the (fixed) latent state representations, and recent work of MVE or STEVE that use the learned dynamics to accelerate policy learning with multi-step updates.
label: asp_substance

sentence: 3. The world model is fixed while learning the action and value models, meaning that reinforcement learning of the actor-critic model cannot be used to improve the latent state model.
label: none

sentence: It'd be interesting to see how optimization of the actions would lead to better state representations by propagating gradients from the actor-critic model to the world model.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Typos:
label: none

sentence: Reward prediction along --> Reward prediction alone
label: asp_clarity

sentence: this limitation in latenby?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The authors propose PARCUS ("Pattern Representations on Continuous Spaces"), a model which computes a soft-matching probability for all words in an input sequence with so-called prototypes in order to predict a label for the input.
label: none

sentence: Furthermore, for training, PARCUS makes use of rationales.
label: none

sentence: Those are indicators of input importance, and help to boost the loss for relevant tokens.
label: none

sentence: The main motivation to use PARCUS is that it works better in a low-resource setting than recent state-of-the-art models for the high-resource case.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: This is due to it having relatively few parameters and to it having a strong inductive bias.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: However, the fact that models with less parameters perform better than BERT-based models in the low-resource case is not very surprising.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Looking at the experiments, the results on HATESPEECH show less differences between models than for SPOUSE or MOVIEREVIEW.
label: none

sentence: Another selling point of PARCUS is that it's interpretable. While neural networks can also be analyzed in different ways, I agree with the authors that this is nice to have.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Overall, the paper seems solid.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Update: After reading the other reviews and the responses by the authors, I lowered my score from 6 to 3.
label: arg_other

sentence: This paper discusses the optimization of robot structures, combined with their controllers.
label: none

sentence: The authors propose a scheme
label: none

sentence: based on a graph representation of the robot structure, and a graph-neural-network as controllers.
label: none

sentence: The experiments show
label: none

sentence: that the proposed scheme is able to produce walking and swimming robots in simulation.
label: none

sentence: The results in this paper are impressive, and the paper seems free of technical errors.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The main criticism I have is that I found the paper harder to read.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: In particular, the exact difference between the proposed method and the ES baseline is not as clear as it could be.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This makes the contribution of this paper in terms of the method
label: asp_clarity

sentence: hard to judge. Please include further description of the ES cost function and algorithm in the main body of the paper.
label: none

sentence: The second point is that the proposed approach seems to modify a few things from the ES baseline.
label: none

sentence: The efficacy of the separate modifications should be tested.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Therefore I would like to see experiments with the ES cost function, but with
label: asp_substance

sentence: inclusion of the pruning step, and experiments with the AF-function but without the pruning step.
label: none

sentence: The paper proposes doubly sparse, which is a sparse mixture of sparse experts and learns a two-level class hierarchy, for efficient softmax inference.
label: none

sentence: [+] It reduces computational cost compared to full softmax.
label: asp_substance

sentence: [+] Ablation study is done for group lasso, expert lasso and load balancing, which help understand the effect of different components of the proposed
label: asp_substance

sentence: [-] It seems to me the motivation is similar to that of Sparsely-Gated MoE (Shazeer et al. 2017), but it is not clear how the proposed two-hierarchy method is superior to the Sparsely-Gated MoE. It would be helpful the paper discuss more about this.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Besides, in evaluation, the paper only compares Doubly Sparse with full softmax.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Why not compare with Sparsely-Gated MoE?
label: asp_substance

sentence: Overall, I think this paper is below the borderline of acceptance due to insufficient comparison with Sparsely-Gated MoE.
label: asp_substance

sentence: -- This paper seeks to combine several ideas together to propose an approach for image classification based continual learning tasks.
label: none

sentence: In this effort, the paper combines previously published approaches from generative modeling with VAEs, mutual information regularization and domain adaptation.
label: none

sentence: I am a making a recommendation for reject for this paper with the main reason being that I believe the primary derivations for their method appear flawed.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: --In the main section describing the approach (Section 4), the authors start with a claim that Equation 1 and 2 are equal; I don’t believe 1 and 2 are equal.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: --In Section 4.1, it appears that they are instead making a claim about Equation 2 being a bound for equation 1; but even this derivation appears to have a problem.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The following is the concern:
label: none

sentence: --In the second line of Equation 5, the KL term appears to be measuring a distance between distributions on two different variables; z|c and c|z.
label: none

sentence: If one were to interpret the second one as the unnormalized distribution on z defined via the likelihood for c given z; even this has an issue because then the expression for KL where we plug the unnormalized density in place of the normalized need not be positive which is something they need to derive their bound.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: --Another issue is that the regularization lambda should apply to both the terms in the bound but in Equation (7) only appears selectively for one of the two terms.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: It is also not clear how the loss function proposed differs from that of the CDVAE, etc.
label: asp_originality

sentence: If the novelty is in applying to continual learning and new datasets, it is not clear that this is sufficient.
label: asp_originality

sentence: Additional feedback for authors (not part of the main decision reasoning):
label: none

sentence: - What is dt in Algorithm 1 description?

sentence: Figure 1:

label: none

sentence: However, it’s noteworthy that embedding to a vector could be useful too if the embedding espace is representative of the entire history and the timing of the events.

sentence: = Summary
label: none

sentence: A method to predict likely type of program variables in TypeScript is presented.
label: none

sentence: It consists of a translation of a program's type constraints and defined objects into a (hyper)graph, and a specialised neural message passing architecture to learn from the generated graphs.
label: none

sentence: Experiments show that the method substantially outperforms sound typing in the TypeScript compiler, as well as a recent method based on deep neural networks.
label: none

sentence: = Strong/Weak Points
label: none

sentence: + The graph representation of the problem is novel, and draws both on core ideas from Hindley-Milner typing (in the subtyping/assignment graph bits) as well as neural ideas (in name similiarity)
label: asp_originality

sentence: + The neural message passing architecture is adapted to the problem, handling features not present in the standard GNN literature (hyperedges, ...)
label: asp_originality

sentence: + Experiments compare with relevant baselines and consider interesting ablations, studying the effect of the GNN extensions in detail.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: - The hyperparameter selection regime (and the experiments used to find them) is not described
label: asp_replicability

sentence: = Recommendation
label: none

sentence: This is an application-driven paper with nice practical results.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The fact that standard neural architectures are extended and adapted to the task, and the way domain knowledge is used to design the graph representation makes this interesting even to people outside the task-specific audience, and hence I strongly recommend acceptance.
label: asp_substance

sentence: = Minor Comments
label: none

sentence: - page 2: "network's type to be class" -> "to be a class"
label: asp_clarity

sentence: - Evaluation Datasets: Did you take duplication in the crawled datasets into account? (Lopes et al. 2017 (DéjàVu: a map of code duplicates on GitHub) suggests that this is particularly problematic for JavaScript/TypeScript)
label: asp_substance

sentence: This paper provides a new dynamic perspective on deep neural network.
label: none

sentence: Based on Gaussian weights and biases, the paper investigates the evolution of the covariance matrix along with the layers.
label: none

sentence: Eventually the matrices achieve a stationary point, i.e., fixed point of the dynamic system.
label: none

sentence: Local performance around the fixed point is explored.
label: none

sentence: Extensions are provided to include the batch normalization.
label: none

sentence: I believe this paper may stimulate some interesting ideas for other researchers.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Two technical questions:
label: none

sentence: 1. When the layers tends to infinity, the covariance matrix reaches stationary (fixed) point.
label: none

sentence: How to understand this phenomenon? Does this mean that the distribution of the layer outputs will not change too much if the layer is deep enough?
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This somewhat conflicts the commonsense of "the deeper the better?"
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: 2. Typos: the weight matrix in the end of page 2 should be N_l times N_{l-1}. Also, the x_i's in the first line of page 3 should be bold.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I read the paper and understand it, for the most part.
label: none

sentence: The idea is to interpret some regularization technics as a from of noisy bottleneck, where the mutual information b tween learned parameters and the data is limited through the injection of noise.
label: none

sentence: While, the paper is a plaisant read, I find difficult to access its importance and the applicability of the ideas presented beyond the analogy with the capacity computation. Perhaps other referee will have a clearer opinion.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: I'd be interested to hear if the authors see a connection between their formalism and the one of Reference prior in Bayesian inference (Bernardo et al https://arxiv.org/pdf/0904.0156)
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Pro: nicely written, clear interpretation of regularization as a noise injection technics, explicit link with information theoery and Shanon capacity.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: Con: not clear to me how strong and wide the implications are, beyond the analogies and the reinterpretation
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: This paper presents a new synthetic dataset to evaluate the mathematical reasoning ability of sequence-to-sequence models.
label: none

sentence: It consists of math problems in various categories such as algebra, arithmetic, calculus, etc.
label: none

sentence: The dataset is designed carefully so that it is very unlikely there will be any duplicate between train/test split and the difficulty can be controlled.
label: none

sentence: Several models including LSTM, LSTM + Attention, Transformer are evaluated on the proposed dataset.
label: none

sentence: The result showed some interesting insights about the evaluated models.
label: none

sentence: The evaluation of mathematical reasoning ability is an interesting perspective.
label: none

sentence: However, the un-standard design of the LSTM models makes it unclear whether the comparisons are solid enough.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The paper is relatively well-written, although the description of the neural models can be improved.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: The generation process of the dataset is well thought out.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: The insights from the analysis of the failure cases are intriguing, but it also points out that the neural networks models are not really performing mathematical reasoning since the generalization is very limited.
label: none

sentence: One suggestion is that it might be useful to also release the structured (parsed) form besides the freeform inputs and outputs, for analysis and for evaluating structured neural network models like the graph networks.
label: asp_replicability

sentence: My main concerns are about the evaluation and comparison of standard neural models.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: The use of “blank inputs (referred to as “thinking steps”)” in “Simple LSTM” and “Attentional LSTM" doesn’t seem to be a standard approach.
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: In the attentional LSTM, the use of “parse LSTM” is also not a standard approach in seq2seq models and doesn’t seem to work well in the experiment (similar result to “Simple LSTM").
label: asp_soundness-correctness

sentence: I think these issues are against the goal of evaluating standard neural models on the benchmark and will raise doubts about the comparison between different models.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: With some improvements in the evaluation and comparison, I believe this paper will be more complete and much stronger.
label: none

sentence: This paper researches the pooling operation, which is an important component in convolutional neural networks (CNN) for image classification.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: Taking the perspective from signal processing, this paper proposes a pooling operation called frequency pooling (F-pooling).
label: asp_originality

sentence: The key motivation is to make the pooling operation shift-equivalent and anti-aliasing.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: This paper gives an improved definition on shift-equivalent functions and shows that the proposed F-pooling is optimal in the sense of reconstructing the orignal signal.
label: asp_originality

sentence: The F-pooling is then implemented with matrix multiplications and tested with recent convolutional neural networks for image classifiation on CIFAR-100 and a subset of ImageNet dataset.
label: asp_substance

sentence: It is interesting to take the perspective from signal processing to give pooling operation in CNN a formal treatment.
label: asp_originality

sentence: As indicated in the recent literature, enforcing shift-invariance does help to improve the performance of a CNN on classification accuracy and the robustness with respect to image shift.
label: asp_substance

sentence: At the same time, this work can be further enhanced at the following aspects:
label: none

sentence: 1. This work can make it clearer in principle how anti-aliasing contributes to improving the classification performance and robustness.
label: asp_clarity

sentence: This will help to make this paper more self-contained.
label: none

sentence: 2. When showing the optimality of F-pooling in Section 2.3, the criterion is to reconstruct the original signal x.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Considering that the ultimate goal is classification, the information to be maximally preserved through each operation through the layers shall be the information that relates to the class label y. In light of this, some justification and explanation shall be provided for using this criterion for optimality.
label: none

sentence: 3. The experimental study is weak.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Experiments could be conducted on more benchmark datasets with more CNN architectures to convincingly show the effectiveness of the proposed F-pooling.
label: asp_substance

sentence: Also, from the three Tables in the experimental part, the improvement of F-pooling over AA-pooling (developed by the main reference of this work) does not seem to be significant or consistent.
label: asp_substance

sentence: For example, in Table 2, the F-pooling only wins at either accuracy (marginally) or consistency, but not both.
label: asp_substance

sentence: In Table 3, the F-pooling consistently shows inferior classification performance, although obtaining slightly higher consistency.
label: none

sentence: This makes the advantage of F-pooling over the existing AA-pooling unclear.
label: asp_substance

sentence: The paper studies the Bayesian inferences with the generative adversarial network (GAN).
label: none

sentence: In the first half of the paper, the general framework of the Bayes estimation is introduced.
label: none

sentence: Then, The authors proposed how to incorporate GAN to the Bayesian inference.
label: none

sentence: Some computational methods for calculating the mean of the statistic under the posterior distribution are described.
label: none

sentence: Then, numerical experiments using MNIST and Celeb-A datasets are presented.
label: none

sentence: Though the Bayesian inference using GAN is a natural idea, learning algorithms proposed in this paper are simple and are not intensively developed.
label: asp_originality

sentence: In numerical experiments, there is no comparison with major competitors besides random sampling in the active learning setup.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: Hence, the effectiveness and advantage of the proposed methods are not clear.
label: asp_motivation-impact

sentence: - In active learning, the proposed method should be compared with other methods such as Bayesian DNN using dropout, etc.
label: asp_meaningful-comparison

sentence: - How does the estimation accuracy of GAN relate to the estimation accuracy of the proposed method? Showing a quantitative description would be nice.
label: asp_clarity
